Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BrazilianLu
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel with 2 kids and we liked very much. The free breakfast is ok (anything special) and they turn the light off when at 10am. A rude way to say: Leave!! The parking lot is free and very good. The staff is very nice and helpful. We stayed in a room just besides the laundry and there was no noise. As cons I'd mention the lack of safe box in the room, there is no oven on the stove and the area the hotel is located in (near Universal). So much traffic and we took so long to get to WDW parks.. But we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Choice for Home away from Home...”
Reviews.Author: Wishbones
Reviews.Content: We spent a week visiting Orlando with my brother, his wife and teenage daughter on April 9th for a week and chose this hotel since it was close to Universal Studios. My husband and I usually try to stay at these hotels and we enjoy the use of the large suites, the access of full kitchens, great full breakfasts and options of also dinnertime meals if we happen to around at that time. It is our 4th time for the Homewood Inns whenever we travel and our first choice. I'm sure my brother and his family were quite impressed and will also use these hotels when travelling in the states as well. We fully enjoyed the vast choice of big belgian waffles, fresh cut grapefruits, scrambled eggs, sausage patties, bacon, yogurt, grits & biscuites, fresh coffee, juices, oatmeal, etc Even though the IHOP Pancake House was just a stones throw, we were very happy to make our own fresh waffles with whip cream & strawberries for ourselves in the mornings. The mornings that were quite busy, people often enjoyed their breakfast just out the doors on the patio by the pool. My niece and I love the sweet fresh Florida Grapefruits every morning too. We found the service was excellent , not only at the front desk but from those that also worked hard to keep the eating areas clean and the kitchen staff were prompt and did an excellent job ! I made sure on our last day - to especially thank those hard workers and that we really appreciated the hard work they put in to ensure hotel patrons were take care of. That is why I always come back to this hotel on our travels. The cleaners and hotel staff always had a smile and cheerful greeting when we acknowledged them in passing. We rented a mini van for our week and the free parking here was great and we always felt safe in the area. The free internet was handy, especially in looking up data or printing off our boarding passes at the end of our stay. Our families were also able to soak in the hot tub and have a swim in the pool at the end of the day when our feet were tired and we needed to relax. We had fun chatting with other travellers at the pool. The hotel is also close to the main strip of International Drive where there were lots of excellent shopping (outlet malls at the end), mini golf places, wet and wild water park, stores, restaurants, etc . We dined at Boston Lobster Feast, Sweet Tomatoes, IHOP, etc. We visited Epcot, Universal Studios, WonderWorks and the Biggest McDonalds in the World which was on the strip. We also had Sunday service at Mary, Queen of the Universe Church. It was a very beautiful church and grounds and peaceful stroll in the Rosary Gardens. The Outlet malls were great shopping and we got some great deals. The weather was great and the crowds are now great since kids are back to school from Easter. Our thanks to Homewood Suites for another great holiday stay and for your hospitality !

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family gatherings”
Reviews.Author: bunnybunch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from April 2-8 with multiple extended family members for nieces wedding/vacation. Great breakfast every morning and dinner Mon-Thurs was special bonus. Was nice to be able to meet everyone for breakfast and not have to deal with a restaurant setting. Breakfast was varied enough on daily basis to not get too repetitive. Rooms were spacious with separate bedroom and living room space with door in between and 2 TV's and full kitchen. Location is right next to Universal and route 4, about 10-15 min to Seaworld and 20 min to Disney. Staff were helpful and gracious. Has outdoor pool/jacuzzi but no other on site frills. Only negative that took away from being perfect was at 4:30am water started dripping from vent in ceiling over toilet. Called front desk and they looked into it and told us everything was ok in room above us and would send maintenance in am. Called back after breakfast as was still dripping and told toilet had overflowed upstairs but was fixed. Was a bit upset that we weren't told it was toilet water after we had allowed overselves to be dripped on to use the toilet. But they credited us one nights stay for the inconvenience. Great place if you just need a home base to visit parks and are traveling with multiple families and don't want to spend a ton of money on hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Near Universal”
Reviews.Author: BigJoeNYC
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms, shuttle service to Universal Studios and Sea World. With so many hotels in the Universal area this is a very good choice. Small breakfast buffet in the morning which is convenient. Nice hotel in a good area. Red Lobster across the highway and a Denny's nearby. All rooms are suites and nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: wolfpierce
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Homewood Suites. Went April 11-14. Hotel was very busy. Were in room 202. Nice, clean roomy as expected. Had a toilet issue which was taken care of immediately after I called. Breakfast nice. Busy busy one day but that was no hinder to us. Front desk very helpful. Pool good but Garden Inn next door better. You can use it and charge to your room there also. Traveled with 5 kids and they loved it. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: LTfromCbus
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this property, April 14th, 15th, 16th. Needed suite for my family of 6. 2 adults and kids ages, 8, 10, 12, 16. Homewood hit a homerun with me. Stayed in room 225, on the end of the building, 2 queens and 1 sleeper sofa. Check in was easy, front desk personel were professional and seemed to really have concern that our stay would be a good one, room was clean, front desk called 10 minutes after check in to see if the room met our approval. They were working hard to do make our stay enjoyable, I like that. I liked the towel art done by housekeeping, so did my kids. Bathroom clean, additional towels sent right up. No issues with stay, breakfast was perfect and included in room rate, great deal for large family. Close to Universal Studios, less than 5 min drive, maybe more like 3 minutes, very close, good spot. Upon check out needed to print SW boarding passes, could not do it from Business Center. Front desk did it for me, that's top shelf service ! Highly recommend this property, they get it.

Reviews.Title: “14 night stay to visit the parks”
Reviews.Author: Craffwr
Reviews.Content: This was a once in a lifetime holiday for us - two adults and two children, and we were very happy with this hotel. Would defninately recommend it to others with the same activities in mind. Food - we got up early every morning to catch the parks before they got busy and took advantage of the American Breakfast. We also tried to return to the hotel by five on week days to eat the 'welcome home' food. Different food every day, but not much choice. We saved a lot of money by doing this and therefore splashed out on good restaurants during the day and on weekend evenings. The suite was spacious - two rooms, a kitchen and a bathroom. TV in both rooms. The kids especially enjoyed the pool after a hard day's enjoyment in the parks while we took advantage of the complimentary drinks by the pool side during the 'welcome home' buffet. Red and white wine and lager was offered. What a treat! The hotel offer free shuttle survice to Universal parks, Seaworld and Aquatica. (One of the reasons we booked here) They are within short travelling distance on International Drive. Disney Parks are not included in the shuttle service. They are slightly further. We therefore hired a vehicle for seven days and visited all the Disney Parks. I would also recommend this, because it gives you freedom to come and go as you please rather than tie yourself to bus times. We managed to arrive parks by opening times on some days, and stayed late on other nights to see the displays and fireworks by the evenings. Dennys and Ihop restaurants and 7 Eleven mini supermarket are within five minutes walking distance from the hotel. Very convenient. We really enjoyed our stay. What a holiday. Located in the centre of park attractions and a relaxing atmosphere by evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Travel73
Reviews.Content: The check in was quick and efficient and it was a nice room. We had two-double beds which were comfortable for all of us. They also provided many towels which I was originally worried about since many hotels can be stingy. There was enough parking although the hotel seemed pretty full. We did not use the pool so can’t comment on that but we also saw a basketball court which was a first. We chose this hotel to be close to Universal and it certainly was. Easy walking distance even for a 9 year old. The only issue we had was that the shower wasn’t as clean as we would have liked. There was some black around the handle bar and some hair but other than that the rest of the room was very clean. They also did not empty the trash in the kitchen after the first day but we just made sure to keep the cupboard open the next day. It was nice to have the kitchenette to reheat food and store snacks and drinks to take with us to Universal. The front desk person was very nice and he recommended a pizza place which was really good. So much so that we ate there three times during out four day stay. The Pizza place was Flippers and not too far from the hotel. They also deliver. The free internet was nice to have and enough was on the TV for my son to be able to amuse himself the little bit of time we were in the room. The breakfast was what can only be expected from Homewood Suites, a nice spread. They had different choices each morning to include eggs, bacon, sausage, fruits, cereal, waffles, yogurt, coffee, tea, milk, juice and other items. The only real issue was finding a place to sit as it was very busy, a few days we just took it up to our room as it was easier. They had a shuttle service which we signed up for just in case but we didn’t take it as we preferred the freedom of coming and going as we wanted. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Felt Like Home!!”
Reviews.Author: BakerBoysGirl
Reviews.Content: My son came home from College for Easter, so we only had a few days to scramble around to get a hotel in Orlando. Since we have passes to Universal, we decided to spend two days there. Homewood Suites was just great....we were able to get a beautiful room with enough space for our family of 5. We loved the separate bedroom with two queens...it's was so roomy! The couch pulls out to a bed, and my son thought it was quite comfortable. The kitchen was also good...stovetop, full size fridge, microwave, coffee machine with all the goodies for it. The dining table was small (only two chairs) but that wasn't a huge problem... Hotel was immaculate. Room was immaculate. The only thing I didn't care for is the shower...being on the shorter side, the shower head was not adjustable..not a huge thing, but being short, I got pummeled with water, and could not adjust it. Parking was plentiful. I did not use the pool as we were at Universal all of our days. It did look beautiful however. Wi-Fi was free. They also had a good choice on TV channels for kids and adults. Overall, a definite good choice for a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Quality formula and customer service”
Reviews.Author: duggem
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Homewood Suites whenever we travel as a family because we love their large rooms, comfortable beds, kitchenettes and good breakfasts (and dinners!). This particular location was no exception - everything was as it should be. However, the very helpful front desk crew went above and beyond when we ran into a problem. We had signed up to take the shuttle bus to Universal but the driver would not allow my handicapped daughter on the bus because he considered her foldable wheelchair "too dangerous." I think this is illegal, but that's another story. Anyway, the front desk overheard our problem and offered to pay for a taxi to and from Universal. Superb customer service to go along with a great, affordable hotel. They didn't serve cookies, however!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Flossloss
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed our time here enormously! The king bed was very comfortable and the rooms were kept beautifully clean with lots of towels in the bathroom. Both bedroom and living room had big TV's and the fridge and dishwasher were very useful. It was great to have a kitchen and on one night we ordered pizza from a local place that put menus under the door - it was a lovely relaxed night in! Breakfast was great - lots of options and the staff were helpful and worked hard to keep up with the volume of people going through. We walked to Universal, which took about 20 minutes. It is along the highway, but it is a proper pathway with signals to allow safe crossing. It gave us a lot of freedom to come and go at whatever time we wanted. We did also drive to City Walk in the evenings - the location is brilliant! I would stay again without doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Like a Second Home”
Reviews.Author: Edward S
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites motto is that this is your second home, I will say that this hotel proved to be just that. My wife and I loved this place, we had a very nice breakfast in the morning and they provide a light supper in the evening mon -thur. All the meals though simple, were very good. The staff was very friendly and always eager to help. The rooms and the hotel in general are very clean and well kept. The beds are comfortable, with great pillows. Many shops and resturants are within walking distance of the hotel. The mini golf near the hotel is a fun time, they have baby alligators that you can feed from a pole if you wish. The main living area and the seperate bed room had large screen tv's. The seperate bedoom is great for the afternoon nap, the doors can be closed and the tv does not disturb the sleeping person.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here - trust me!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy L
Reviews.Content: Awesome stay - top to bottom!! Very clean, very comfortable - and staff was MORE than courteous and helpful! We stayed in a one-bedroom suite with my 8-yr. old son for a trip to Universal, which is literally 5 minutes away. Room was comfortable, clean, spacious, and affordable. Amenities in hotel were great (free dinners, breakfast, game room, pool, etc.). Can't say enough about every encounter I had with the staff - very helpful and courteous in every way! Called the front desk for a cab, and in 5 minutes was a nice town car with great driver at no extra cost - regular cab rates. Only thing I would be leery about (which really isn't a reflection of the hotel itself) is the courtesy shuttle/bus to Universal. I know I shouldn't complain because it's free, but got on the bus at 8:35am to go to Universal that opened at 9am, but bus didn't arrive until 9:25 - and park is 5 minutes away. It wound up making several stops along the way to pick up other people. We will, without a doubt, stay here again - very close to everything - fun for the kids! A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Janet T
Reviews.Content: Stayed Spring Break 2012, had an excellent experience. Staff very friendly, helpful. Manager helped, scanning and emailing some business documents that we were having trouble faxing. Is within walking distance of Universal Studios, (15 minutes approx), but need to remember you will have to walk back after several hours in the parks and feels a lot longer on the walk back. Great location for Wet and Wild, 5 minutes. Excellent breakfast buffet, hot items vary each day, waffles, fresh fruit, pastries, bagels cereals etc. Took ours up to our room some mornings when very busy, used toaster in room to make toast and bagels. Did not attend the Managers reception so cannot comment on that. Large rooms, two queen beds in bedroom and sleeper sofa in living room so plenty of room for a family. Nice flat screen TV's in both rooms. Full kitchen even down to the dish washer... Hotel was fully booked so pool could get busy, not sure if people know this but guests can use the pool of the adjoining Hilton hotel which we did. That pool was very quiet with nice cabanas and a Tiki bar. Booked my stay through Hilton website (am an HHonors member) and could do echeck-in a couple of days before we went which was fantastic, could choose the room we wanted so knew where we would be before we got there. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kati74
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel again on our trip to Orlando and were as pleased as in the first time. Spacious and comfortable suite with very good beds. Great service and the staff seemed to be really concerned that we were enjoying everything. Hot breadfast with something for everybody and although the hotel was full, there was always tables and not too crowded. Also the evening meals were tasteful basic food and great fresh salad. The pool was nice and water warm enough to swim even on the cooler days in February. Our room was on the interstate side, but we did not hear anything to our room. We are likely to stay in this hotel also on our future trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Larger Families or for Those Looking for a Nice Place on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: sannicandrob
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Disney/Legoland vacation from March 15-21. I chose Homewood Suites mainly because our trip was somewhat last minute and it was the best rate I could find that could accommodate a family of our size (2 adults, 4 small children, 1 infant). I was a little apprehensive at booking because the last few times we've stayed in the Disney resorts or at the Marriott time share resorts in the area and were just overwhelmed each time with how awesome they were. This year we were on a tighter budget so our options were limited. Also, I know the area well and was a little concerned about the area as I-Drive isn't what it used to be and having a Motel 6 and Super 8 so close by can never be a good sign. But I have to say, I could not have been more pleased with this hotel and I would come back again. It far exceeded my expectations. We had a suite with 2 queen beds and the living room had a sofa bed. The suite was clean, spacious and the bedroom had plenty of space for the pack & play the hotel provided for our infant son. Kitchen area was small but it was great having access to a full kitchen to keep milk cold, prepare bottles, etc. Living room also wasn't huge but honestly, we didn't do anything more than sleep in the room so never actually had to use the living room 'AS' a living room. It was just extra sleeping space. It was nice to be able to spread out a little. Breakfast was always busy and depending on what time you went down there, tables were at a premium. We always got one, but it wasn't easy. They have a few high chairs available for little ones. There was a nice patio near the pool that had a few more tables if the inside got too crazy. The food selection was good. Eggs everyday, a waffle station, fruit, cereal, breads, coffee, juice, and varying selection from day to day of breakfast meats, or biscuits & gravy, or potato pancakes. Each day was different. Staff was overwhelmed from time to time just keeping up with it all and ensuring all stations were stocked, but they were friendly and hard working. An added hand wouldn't hurt them. They offer a light dinner on weeknights, but we did not take advantage of it as we were never back from the parks in time. They post a dinner menu on your refrigerator in the suite. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the suite clean and we didn't have any issues. The staff was very friendly and all the staff members we encountered said hello and were friendly. At check-in it was a breeze (late at night) I was advised of all the hotel had to offer, breakfast times, etc. Never had an issue finding parking during our stay but it was apparent that Homewood and their sister property HGI next door were close to capacity. If you stay on an upper floor the elevator closest to the lobby was a little slow so if your room is in the middle of the hallway, recommend the rear elevator. It was a little faster - and you can get good parking right near the door. Lobby isn't huge but its welcoming and they have a nice little waterfall/water wall that separates the check in area from the breakfast area. There is also a Universal ticket office in the lobby to buy tix to the parks. Laundry rooms had 2 washers and 1 dryer; found that a little odd. I ended up having to dry clothes on separate floors just to get the 2 loads dried with out draining $$'s on the single dryer. Used the Business Center to print our discounted tix to Legoland (buy online and save and don't wait in line). Biz center was small but had 2 computers and 2 printers available. Hotel also has a game room for the kids and nice fitness center. Not huge but has all the necessary equipment. Wi-fi in the room worked well and never had any problems with it. Hotel location is good That was one of my apprehensions prior to coming, but it really is a super quiet area and I felt safe. Back entrances required a key swipe to get in and there was an evening security guard (only saw the night I arrived but apparently they are there all the time). Hotel is walking distance to Wet & Wild and plenty of restaurants nearby. But to be practical, you need to rent a car if you stay here. Universal is close and they offer a shuttle but times seemed inconvenient. Disney is about a 15 minute drive, Universal about 2 mins, Airport about 15 mins. Stay away from I-Drive/Sand Lake intersection. That light has always been a disaster and 20 years later, it still is. Use the roads near Universal to get on/off I-4. WAY easier. There is a 24 hour Walgreens around the corner. Beware, its very understaffed and overwhelmed with late night foreign customers who slow the one line down trying to figure out American currency. It has all you need and is convenient but try to avoid the 11pm - Midnight hour. There is a Super Walmart about 5 mins away as well. The last day we enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi (pretty much had it to ourselves). The water temperature was comfortable, it was clean, and kids had a blast. Plenty of towels and chairs, as well as some 'cabanas' - they are not really cabanas, more like stylish tents, but they do provide shade if that is your thing. There is also a basketball court which is a nice addition if you have older children. Each night there were teens playing, but it never got too loud (occasional sound of ball bouncing heard from the 4th floor but court lights go out by 10pm I think so it isn't a big deal). Our room faced towards I-Drive. Other reviews say these are a little quieter than the ones facing I-4, but I don't know that for sure. We never had a problem with noise. Also the patio I mentioned above has 2 fairly new Weber grills so if BBQing your own meal is your thing, this is a nice amenity. When making your hotel selection, if you are looking for great value, good location, and clean, spacious rooms this place will fit your needs, especially if you are looking to accommodate a larger size family without breaking the bank. For $125/nt where else are you going to get that rate inclusive of free hot breakfast, free parking, free wi-fi, and all the amenities described above (WITHOUT a resort fee)? Hard to find a value like that during peak travel weeks, especially when booking somewhat last minute. This place exceeded our expectations and I recommend you give it a shot. The proximity to Universal is a big win for this hotel. We didn't do Universal this trip due to the younger ages of our children, but being so close to the park is definitely a perk of this hotel. I look forward to visiting again when the kids are ready for Universal!

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: limasboy
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects: 1) Very nice suite,with a kitchen and separate bed room. 2) Location,very close to several atractions. 3) Clean and comfortable. 4) Very nice staff. 5) Free parking. 6) Free internet,also into room. 7) New hotel,new furniture. 8) Very quiet room (pool view),more sound (road view). 9) Two flat TV sets,one in the living and one in the room. 10) USA today (newspaper) every day in the door. 11) Free breakfast. 12) Swimming pool,basketball field,game room,gym room,etc. 13) Extra snacks every night (monday>thursday) Negative aspects: 1) Breakfast,poor with few options of breads,iogourts,fruits and others (weak point of this nice hotel). 2) USD 5.00 per each packaging delivered for guests.

Reviews.Title: “for its price its as good as the best!”
Reviews.Author: kivenaberham
Reviews.Content: just got back from a wedding in Tampa. the Homewood suites was great! for its price with the breakfast included. it was great. very relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Carmen M
Reviews.Content: It was good but honestly wasn't "impressed" although we were only there one night and did not arrive until 9:30. Did not do much there but the free breakfast was just the normal and was ok. Rooms were clean but just nothing to them so a good place to stay just for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Homewood Suites nearest Universal and I would defintely recommend this Hotel. The location was perfect for park visits to Universal Studios. Its located right off International Drive with all the tourist attractions, restaurants and shopping you could want. The (price included)breakfast was a great money and time saver every morning. We didn't have time to sample the complimentary dinner from Mon to Thurs. The staff were very friendly and the housekeeping service was impeccable. The only complaint I can think of is the slow elevator (a minor annoyance). Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: Fly2ofus
Reviews.Content: Three adults just back from staying at the Homewood Suite nearest Universal Studios. We had a suite with a pull out bed in the living room. The room was very nice and very clean. Was very comfortable. Service/staff were very helpful and satisfied our every request. We had a few extra requests (extra night being one of them) and they accomidated without a problem. Was very convenient to have breakfast served every morning. The only thing I would warn about is that if you don't have a rental car it may be a little costly getting to all the parks. Shuttle only runs to Universal and only in the morning. High recommend staying at Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: waxmbordz
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel and can only give it positive marks in every category. With a location in the heart of International drive and just a couple of minutes from Universal Orlando, it couldn't have been more convenient. High marks for the hot breakfast buffet featuring eggs, waffles/pancakes/french toast, bacon/sausage, and a variety of breads and muffins. There was also a complimentary light dinner offered Monday-Thursday, including beer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages. While we did not sample it, it seemed more than ample enough for a full meal. The pool and hot tub area was very clean and quiet for guests, and there was a basketball/tennis court for anyone to use. Our room featured a full kitchen, living room, and dining room table, and were well-maintained by the staff. We couldn't have asked for a better stay and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: farmview
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at this hotel. We chose this hotel for its proximity to Universal Studios, the free breakfast (every day) and manager's reception (Monday - Thursday), and price. We are a family of 5 with three boys ages 9-11 and usually stay at Homewood Suites or Residence Inns. The hotel was fine for its price. It is not the best Homewood Suites but given the traffic and the range of clientele the hotel experiences more wear and tear. The breakfast staff, especially Maria, are very hard working and we appeciated their efforts. I was embarrassed for some of the guests who left garbage and plates on their tables instead of cleaning up after themselves. My only complaints concern maintenance, laundry, business center, and housekeeping in general. It just seemed like someone wasn't monitoring basic amenities or common areas. (1) Our room was missing a light bulb in the bedroom. This doesn't seem like a big deal but my son almost reached his hand in the socket when trying to turn on the light (he thought maybe there was a switch closer to the bulb). The maintenance guy was friendly but this should have been caught/known before. (2) The laundry rooms are unkept. It is clear that they are rarely cleaned given the dirt/dust on the machines and in the rooms themselves. The 5th floor facility had garbage bags, garbage, etc. all over so I used the 3rd floor laundry. That had lint and old clothes on the floor. I commented about their condition to the front desk and they said someone would be there to clean them. In the 2 hours that I did laundry no one came to clean. (3) The phone was pulled off the wall in the business center and one of the printers was out of ink. The light was blinking when I arrived and my guess is that it had been out for a while. We reported it and had to start all over on the computer (boarding passes). No one came to replace the toner while we were there. (4) The room was clean when we arrived but not really cleaned during our stay (the bathroom floor had a shoe print all week). That didn't bother us too much but housekeeping threw out shampoo, conditioner, and soap every day. This meant we had to ensure that we had all these things before getting into the shower. It just seemed like a waste and I've never had a hotel do this every day. The room itself has the bathroom off of the bedroom. While the sink is outside of the toilet/shower, there are no doors or curtains separating the sink area from the bedroom. That was a little tough. The bathroom also does not have a fan. Depending on your family, this means all your clothes changing, etc. is done in a hot, steamy bathroom. In all, you can't beat the price and location. We walked to Universal (10-15 minutes) and also took the shuttle (usually back to the hotel -- its the first stop back). Its a quick drive to restaurants, the mall, etc. If we didn't stay here again it would be because of the room configuration and the lack of attention to areas like the laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for Universal or to chill.”
Reviews.Author: family4Moriah
Reviews.Content: We liked how this property wasn't right in the middle of everything, but near things we were interested in. We rented a car from Dollar at the airport because we wanted to use this hotel as a homebase. There's just too many things we wanted to see/do while in Orlando...Space Center, Cocoa Beach, the parks, celebrate a child's birthday at Golden Corral, etc. If you don't rent a car, they have shuttle service to Universal ( they dropoff a few times in the am and pickup a few times in the eve.) and U could walk if U wanted. There is a 24 hour Walgreens a couple blocks away as well as other restaraunts and stores. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful...they gave me good advice on where to gas up the car, travel tips and times as well as local places to eat and shop. Our family of 4 had the daily "free" breakfast and got a plate of whatever they served for the evening meal (M-Th). We bought some of the kid's favorites (mac n cheese, chicken nuggets, treats, soda, juice, etc.) and stored them in the ref. in the kitchen area (it was also nice having a little stove and microwave). We used the fitness center and pool areas daily and found the other visitors to be respectful and friendly. We'll be going back next year :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristynWales
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Homewood Suites (nearest to Universal). We enjoyed it so much last year we brought our friends with us this time. As we were booking in the Manager approached us, said he could remember us from last year and welcomed us back! I cannot fault this hotel at all. The staff are always very friendly, approachable and happy to help. The breakfast menu changes slightly daily so you have a variety. The evening meals are lovely and the free evening beers/red wine/ white wine are always great after a day out (Mon-Thurs). The rooms are cleaned well daily. The location is great - walking distance to Universal Studios, International Drive, Denny's, 7/11, Walmart, etc. The free shuttle bus is fab. The pool is always quiet and the area always clean. Free tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc. 24 hours a day. Free internet and use of computers. I would recommend this hotel completely and cannot wait to stay there again! Sending a HUGE thank you to all the staff @ Homewood Suites + Kimi who was so helpful when it came to choosing our park tickets. See you all soon! xxx

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend, would use again!”
Reviews.Author: glastywyll
Reviews.Content: Was encouraged to come here because we know Orlando and this is a perfect base, good for I-drive, good for getting out of town East and West. Big rooms, really clean, loads of towels, staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are nice and quiet too. Don't hesitate, I have recommended to friends and family already!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: cjsutcliffe
Reviews.Content: Following our previous booking with Expedia and the hassle and disappointment, i am pleased to say that our direct booking with the hotel has been a great success and we are all delighted with the accommodation and above and beyond the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home!”
Reviews.Author: tecknik
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel that my boyfriend and I stayed at on our 5 day trip to Florida. We were here for two nights- February 5th and 6th. We chose this hotel based on the distance to Universal Studios. When we first arrived, we were there much earlier than the check-in time of 3pm. They had a room for us anyway and even gave us a few choices of which floor we wanted to be on. We chose the first floor and stayed in room 106. They were very friendly at the counter and answered a few of my questions including how far Universal Studios was from the hotel. He told me less than a mile so we decided to walk there. :-) Before we left for the park, we brought our bags to our room. I was amazed that this room had a kitchen, living room and huge bedroom. I also liked that it had the sink area in the bathroom separate from the toilet and tub. The room was extremely clean and fresh looking. I felt like I was home. We then headed to the park which was indeed, a short walk and not a bad one considering the temps for February were just around 76 degrees. (nice) Once we returned from the park, we decided to go for a swim. We were also told that we could use the hotel next door (I think it was a Hilton) as they are the same company owners. That hotel also had a nice tiki bar outside so keep that in mind if you go. In addition to the pool at at Homewood Suites, they have a large dining area and were setup to serve a free breakfast and I also hear they have a dinner set up on week nights but we were not around to check this out. I do not know the cost for the dinner. The hotel also has a computer area (2 computers that I saw) and a nice gym. We returned to our room after being out at the City Walk all night (Universal Studios.. I highly recommend Emerils) and retired to a very comfortable bed. There was no outside noise to bother us at all. Perfect. The next day we headed to Disney (Hollywood Studios) which is also not a far drive. It took us about 15-20 minutes. Once we returned and went to our room, I was amazed at how much they clean up. All of my toiletry items were neatly placed on the sink area with my jewelry (cheap stuff) placed in a glass. My ONLY complaint is that they moved some items such as my hair brushes to a drawer. I went crazy ripping my suitcase apart then the room looking for my brush. I finally found it in a drawer along with some other items I had. I don't think they should move items to drawers but that is my personal opinion. Overall, we had a very nice stay and I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is there for the parks. It's a great environment for a family especially on a budget because of the room and the full kitchen. Pictures will be uploaded separately.

Reviews.Title: “Great base while visiting Universal Parks”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidays077
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (2A/3 teens) stayed here while visiting the Universal parks and it was ideal. We caught the comp shuttle everyday. The times suited us as we stayed in the parks all day. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was fine. We stayed clear of the scrambled eggs as we had discovered that we felt unwell after eating them at previous hotels.( must be a premix that they use) however all other food was fine. We did not take advantage of the complimentary evening meals as we were usually out and about. The only negative incident was when a fellow guest let his preteen daughter do their laundry and she put their wet washed clothes into the dryer on top of my almost dry clothes before the cycle had finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BarnzGirls
Reviews.Content: I took my teen and preteen daughters to Universal the weekend of January 20. We initially were going to stay at a resort but had to change plans at the last minute. I have had great experiences with Homewood Suites in the past and thought i would give the Orlando location a try. I must say, the staff was outstanding! They were welcoming and helpful from the moment we walked in the door. They were able to arrange transportation and followed up with a restaurant to make a reservation on our behalf. They offer a shuttle to the park that leaves three times in the morning and has three evening pick ups. The complimentary breakfast was OK - typical of most places. Housekeeping was just average though, not replacing our drinking glasses - assuming we would perhaps wash them ourselves. If the weather is not too hot you can walk to Universal however the entrance to the park is a little tricky, especially if traveling with kids, so we preferred the shuttle service. The place is across the street from a Walgreens and close to dining. Perfect for couples or families. A definite 5 starts for customer service, but overall 4 stars due to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: LTRaider
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando and thought this property deserved a strong review. The rooms were spacious and clean,beds were comfortable, and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Marcela I
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here with my boyfriend in December 2011. It was the best hotel I've ever stayed in for many reasons: 1) VERY clean hotel 2) VERY kind staff, always with a smile on the face, everybody very kind, 3) Breakfast is included and is a good breakfast with a great variety of food. 4) Parking is complimentary 5) From monday to thursdays there is a free meal from 5 pm to 7 pm 6) Great rooms 7) Great location (Near Universal and near the highway that takes you to Disney, Miami and several other locations) 8) It has loundry so you can wash your own cloths. The hotel is very quiet, rooms are big and comfortable with fully equiped kitchen (fridge, microwave) and 2 separate areas in the same room: lounge and bedroom. I enthusiastically recommend this hotel if you are staying in Orlando. There is only 1 thing that I didn't like: there is a "handling fee" of 5 dollars if you send a package to the hotel. Maybe it was written somewhere, but I didn't see it, so when I checked out it surprised me to be charged with that. Anyway, I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but expected more. Busy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in early January 2012 while visiting Orlando and especially Universal Studios Florida. Upon arrival and check-in, we asked for a quiet room (not Highway side) and we've had a king room (203) but it wasn't on high floor as requested on booking and not with a particular view (should have been a pool view). The size of the room is good, 2-room suite with a comfy King bed, 2 flat TV's and a kitchen. Bathroom wasn't very clean upon arrival. The breakfast room is busy in the morning and we couldn't find a seat for a few minutes before someone finished his breakfast. I'd say come early or take it in your room. The staff couldn't work easily as the room was very busy. So the next day, we didn't have breakfast there. Choice is just ok. In the hotel, there's a USF kiosk with a lady selling tickets in the morning which was nice. She helped us and sold us 2 tickets and then we've catched the free shuttle which takes you in about 30 minutes to the Park entrance (where you have to walk another 10 minutes via Citywalk). If you want, you can have a taxi ride too (around 10-15 USD). Also possible to walk there if not raining or too hot. All in all, I might not come back while in the aera and choose another Hilton family hotel. I've expected much more from Homewood Suites in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed the first week of January 2012”
Reviews.Author: DeputyDan
Reviews.Content: The facility was approximately 90% full during our stay. I must say that our room was quieter than expected for the number of guests on site. The food was at best average and there were way more guests that the two employees on food duty were able to accomodate. They did work, but it was all they could do to keep an adequate amount of food out, the tables were never cleaned during the designated meal times. They were cleaned after the rush. All the employees were very pleasant and we enjoyed our stay (and would stay again). The mattress in our room was old and sagged in the middle. It needs to be replaced. Also, housekeeping would throw away any personal items that were left out. An example was that they threw away three sets of ear plugs. We always wear these when staying at a hotel and this is the first time they were ever thrown out by housekeeping. Do not believe the hype about the shuttle to Universal and the on site Universal Studio services. This is totally set up as a sales gimmick and provides no real value to guests. The shuttle only travels at time convenient to the facility not to best accomodate the guests. The only theme park we visited this trip was Universal and we found the "Universal service desk" at the HW Suites to not be worth the trouble to use. The location with respect to Universal Studios and Wet & Wild is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaCM
Reviews.Content: Last December we traveled, me My Husband, my son and his girlfriend to Orlando and we booked two suites at this hotel. This was our second time at this hotel in 1 year, and everything was perfect. the staff is very gentle, and they are always prompt to help you anyway!!! One day we needed an information about the Busch Gardens shuttle, so Rafael and Keith and the other gentleman (sorry I forgot your name).....made everything they could to find the information we needed....when they got it you could see they were very happy to finally get the information for us! The rooms are very, very clean......the housekeepers aver very polite. the breakfast is always very good, and the staff that take care of the area is always there to help you anyway, they are always cleaning the tables, adding missing items to the buffet etc.... At night from Monday through Thursday we had a light meal for dinner...and it's always very nice. The rooms are vey quite...love the kitchen area where I cooked some pasta somedays..... You can feel home even being sooo far away like in our case. Well, whenever coming back to Orlando again we will definitely stay herea again! The only thing we didn't know is that we were eligible for the senior rate, since we are both above 50.....it would be a 10 percent discount on the total.......

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: LisaJCapeCod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Xmas - our first non-Disney hotel in Orlando. Disney it's not, but It's solid value for the money: a comfortable two-room suite with hot breakfast for $125. Up sides: quiet, even though completely filled. Comfortable beds, plenty of hot water, good cleaning service, pleasant staff, and absolutely adequate hot breakfast. Down sides: the shuttle to Universal takes half an hour to travel about 1/2 mile, because this is the first hotel on the route. And you can only return after 4 p.m. We didn't bother. The pool is no great shakes: it overlooks a road, and is loaded with chlorine. Had this been a quieter season, we would have been much happier at a Disney resort. But with the Christmas prices jacked up, we really were quite pleased with Homewood. Would we stay there again? In a similar situation, yes - but during the off season, it's Disney for us!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: luv2trav3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one room suite with full kitchen, king bed and sofa bed. Although the suite is not very big, I enjoyed the separate bedroom and the two TVs so no fighting over channels with the kids! Suite is beautifully furnished with modern furniture. Most importantly it is very clean. Comes with breakfast and free wifi. Location is excellent for Universal Studios and International Drive. I would say within walking distance to the theme park if you rather not drive. Rate wise, it is more expensive than most of the hotels in the area but you are paying for a classy suite with full kitchen. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: Barbara F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the Christmas holiday. It was close to Universal, which was great, but the hustle and bustle of International Drive was enough to make us crazy and we ended up leaving a few days early. The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful and helpful. The morning breakfast reminded me of a day in NYC. There were no tables to be found, people were pushing and shoving for food, especially the waffle makers. The housekeeping staff was never seen, but our room was always clean, they were great! Pool looked very clean, we had trouble getting into the game room, but passed on it anyways. I would be back here if I could handle International Drive again - the staff makes it worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Just below average.”
Reviews.Author: sassysassy
Reviews.Content: Disappointed to see this hotel has gone down in a few years. Luckily this had no effect on the professional, polite and helpful and friendly staff. corridors to the suites were in need of modernisation and a lick of paint. Skirting carpets were falling from the wall and I nearly tripped over it! "free" breakfast used to be plentiful but I suppose recession hits everywhere. Apple cinnamon twists were cut in half (to make them go further?) Waffle maker was made part-time instead of daily breakfast. cheap bagels were replace with the standard of a few years back. Juice seemed to be watered down and cereals were generic versions. As vegetarians we found breakfast very bleak! The room we stayed in was average and in the middle of our stay, we found an unwanted visitor in our cupboards. It was immediately caught and brought to front desk. In fairness they found us another suite immediately and asked if a free night was acceptable for the inconvenience. However, the next day, the manager tried to backtrack on the offer and tried to put it off and it was not until we got home that the one nights free stay was deposited back into my account (and not as much as I paid for it either!) In my opinion, this place is not worth all the ratings it has. I would not stay there again. It HAS gone down a lot.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills! No Surprises! No Worries!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy_d_olson
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay at this location of a very nice budget-minded chain. Second visit confirmed that indeed food isn't up to par with other location's offerings, but staff and physical plant of hotel are both superb. Room was as expected. Staff were quite friendly and helpful! Location is great for access to dining on i-Drive and to Universal. Quiet rooms. Nice pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Excellent Amenities, Food not Up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: lpaulkelley
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this Homewood Suites on 12/12/2011. I found the hotel to be very nice and accommodating. The staff was exceptionally friendly and very eager to please. They were helping to "wait" tables in the dining area during dinner...quite surprising! Overall, the stay was very good. It would have been better if not on business, but we can't always play! All the amenities were up to Hilton standards. Only a couple of complaints. There was an odor (not necessarily unpleasant, although noticeable) throughout the hotel. It probably was the typical Florida/salty air smell and generally only in the common areas. It certainly would NOT deter me from staying there again. My bigger complaint was the food. I was not impressed. They served "sesame chicken" with rice and some "egg rolls," which I felt was a bit like school-lunch. Maybe I was spoiled at my first stay at a Homewood Suites (Mt. Pleasant, SC), but the food at other locations since haven't met that standard. Unfortunately, I didn't get an opportunity to eat breakfast as I was in a hurry out. It is convenient to have the ability to eat at the Hotel, especially when included in your room rate. The hotel location is SUPERB! Right near Universal Studios, although I didn't stay long enough to enjoy that. I would certainly recommend this location to others.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Universal, Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Lu1822
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a nice property, especially for families. The suites are quite large with room to spare. They were well appointed, but ours (#405) had a bit of wear. The bath was enormous and handicap accessible. Our shower head did not work properly, but we made do with the hand-held. There were several loose tiles beneath the vanity that looked funky, but other than that the bath was nice with plenty of towels. Our cable TV in our lounge did not work, but the staff promptly and competently repaired it. The hot breakfasts were good, but in my opinion, needed more fresh fruit. (Whole apples were offered.) Staffers were polite, efficient, and accommodating. They run shuttles to and from nearby Universal and other Parks, which saves parking, but we chose to keep our flexibility on departures and paid the $15.00 Universal parking fee. Oh, and in typical Hilton fashion, the bed was excellent! I wish the coverlet and dust ruffle had looked 'fresher', though.

Reviews.Title: “Plumbing nightmares!”
Reviews.Author: badgrammerMaryland
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable and the hotel is very quiet. The biggest problem is the plumbing. Every time we flush we have to plunge. Doesn't matter what. Room 217. We called over and over and they came every time very quickly but we shouldn't have to plunge the toilet at our hotel. The maintenance guy said this toilet has been causing problems. Okay then fix it before you give it to someone else! We are still here, checking out this morning and although we got a great rate, I don't think we will return. Too many problems

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Irecouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Homewood Suites for 9 days. 4 adults shared a room. On arrival we were greeted by lovely, friendly staff who welcomed us like old friends as they did for the rest of our stay with them. I really want to commend the hotel on this. Room: Four adults shared a room. The hotel room consisted of a separate sitting room with a kitchen area and table and chairs which was well stocked with a microwave, cutlery, crockery, large fridge, sink area and cooker. The only small negative I would have is that there were only 2 chairs at the dining table instead of 4. For us this wouldn't be a problem but it could be for a family who would plan to eat in the room. The sitting room consisted of a tv, coffee table and plenty of seating. The bedroom consisted of two large beds (king size, I think) and drawers. There was only one locker shared between the two beds, another one wouldn't go astray. The room is a huge room so all guests are not squashed. The bathroom consists of a bath with a shower head in it. The toilet blocked during the week but we informed reception and it was sorted out by the time we returned to the room. Breakfast: The breakfast each morning consisted of hot food like scrambled egg, sausages, porridge, bacon. There was pastries like muffins and danish. Yoghurts, fruit, cereal and juices was also available. There was a waffle machine where you could make waffles yourself, however this was not available everyday which was unfortunate. We only ate at the welcome home dinner one evening and the food was perfect. It was chicken florentine and rice. There are free beer, wine and minerals available at the welcome home reception. Shuttles to Park: There was a free shuttle available from the hotel to the following parks: Wet n Wild, Universal, Seaworld and Aquatica. Wet n Wild is within walking distance of the hotel. Universal is only about 4 minutes away from the hotel. Overall, this hotel was very good with friendly staff. Enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A travel Agent’s Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dan W
Reviews.Content: I have been very lucky to travel to Orlando many times over the past decade and have experienced a wide range of stays at many different accommodation types, from budget motels to the super luxurious. When comparing all of the hotels, motels and villas that I have stayed at, there is one property that stands out from the rest and that place is the Homewood Suites by Hilton Orlando, Nearest-Universal Studios. After selling Orlando and the United States in general for many years, I know how difficult it can be to find the right balance between location, amenities and value for money. The Homewood Suites easily achieves this. The location is hard to beat if you are looking to be close enough to the action of the theme parks and yet far enough away not to be bothered by the hustle and bustle of the ‘tourist Mecca of the World'. Located on American Way, just off the northern end of International Drive means that pretty much everything you could want is either within walking distance or a short drive away. Within 300 metres you'll find shops, restaurants, mini golf and even a British pub! Wet ‘N’ Wild Water Park is less than a 5 minute walk and Universal Studios is around a 20 minute walk. Having said that The Homewood Suites do provide a shuttle service to Universal if you want to save your legs for the theme parks! Sea World, Discovery Cove & Aquatica are just a short 10 minute drive and Walt Disney World, a simple 20 minute drive via the I-4 interstate. The atmosphere of the Homewood Suites is as the name suggests, ‘homely’. The moment you walk through the doors into the clean and cool lobby you will be greeted with smiles from the front desk staff. The whole team here are professional and helpful. Nothing seems too much trouble for them, especially Inna who is quite possibly the most efficient of all. There is always complimentary fresh coffee available in the lobby area as well as a small but well stocked shop where you can purchase food and drink items along with other day to day items like hair brushes, toothpaste and shampoos etc. There is also a fitness room, games room, computer room with internet access (which is free of charge for hotel guests) and even an excursion desk for buying those all important theme park tickets! Once you’re checked in, you’ll notice that the design of the hotel means that your room is easily found and never too far from a vending machine or a laundry room (Ideal for longer stays). They feature smoking as well as non smoking rooms which makes a big difference if you choose to smoke like I do. I usually prefer a non smoking room in hotels as the smell can be off putting; however at the Homewood suites the smell of cigarettes in the smoking rooms is barely noticeable at all. This must be owing to the fact that the maid service is second to none. WIFI is available in all suites and public areas of the hotel free of charge and has a good download and fair upload speed. The suites themselves feature a kitchen with a large fridge/freezer, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, stove, coffee maker and even a table and chairs. Complimentary tea and coffee are re stocked daily. One of the advantages of a suite is the space and privacy offered, especially for families or friends staying together. The lounge area that is open plan and runs off the kitchen is a great place to relax. They feature recently installed large flat screen LCD TV’s (which have the usual US cable stations) and even a DVD player which makes these suites feel even more like home! The DVD players are set to play region 1 DVD’s and not European region 2’s, but DVD titles are available to rent from reception at a low price and can be purchased very cheaply at supermarkets like Wal-Mart. The sofa bed can accommodate 2 and is comfortable for sleeping on, but is also surprisingly comfortable for everyday lounging. There is also an arm chair as well as a desk and office chair, ideal for working (if you have to) or writing those postcards to family and friends back home of course. The separate bedroom features a large window and is where the bathroom is located. The sink unit is located outside of the main bathroom to maximise convenience, which is a bonus if someone is using the shower and you need to brush your teeth. There is ample wardrobe space and yet another flat screen TV in the bedroom which again features most US cable stations. The beds are extremely comfortable and provide a prefect night’s sleep after a long day exploring what Central Florida has to offer. The grounds around the hotel feature a swimming pool and hot tub. The Sun shines directly over the pool and patio area for most of the day and features plenty of wide, very comfortable loungers and chairs. There are also gazebos if you prefer some shade and pool towels are provided. The pool area can get a little crowded during high season (June-August) as well as at weekends, but guests at the Homewood Suites are also permitted to use the swimming pool area at the Hilton Garden Inn, next door. This provides a quieter, more tranquil environment. One of the best things about the Homewood Suites is the complimentary food service. It’s amazing how much money you can save with these little extras and should not be overlooked. Breakfast is served daily with a varied selection of hot and cold options. The waffle making machine is fast and easy to use and the bacon and eggs are pretty good too! From Monday through Thursday evenings, a welcome home reception is also presented. This includes a light meal (served buffet style) along with locally produced beer, wine and soft drinks. Again this ‘perk’ is compliments of the hotel and features different options on different nights. There will be a monthly meal plan printed and displayed on your refrigerator in your suite when you arrive, advising of the theme on each day. In summary the Homewood Suites by Hilton Orlando – Nearest Universal Studios has it all. The prices are reasonable, the staff are fantastic, the rooms are clean and the location unbeatable. You may pay slightly more to book a stay here but by the time you have taken the complimentary ‘perks’ into account, you will spend a lot less overall! Thank you to the team at the Homewood Suites for a great holiday, it’s always a shame to leave, but I know I’ll be back next year! Review by Dan Wylde, North America Specialist,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: shenickisland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November with my wife and 2 young children. It was our first time visiting the USA from Ireland. From our arrival to our departure we found all the staff extremely helpful and friendly,from the front desk to the catering and maintainence guys, they could not have been more helpful. There was a problem with one of the TVs and it was fixed very promply with a little note to let us know. The Hotel is a great location for Universal, (5mins by car, 15mins walk, local lynx bus 37 10 mins) it is across the road from Wet N Wild,( best water park in Orlando) this was great for quick visits to cool down in the hot weather. Disney is a little bit further away, ok if you have a rental car, but about 90 mins by Lynx Bus 8 and a 50. Hotel would have been 100 % perfect if they had a shuttle to Disney, however there was free shuttles to Universal, and the other parks. Also all the shopping malls are just a bus ride away, Premium Nth or South take Bus 8, Florida Mall take Bus 42. The buffet breakfast was great, with lots of choice and variety and the complimentry evening food (mon- thurs) was an added pleasant bonus. There are lots of dining choices close to the Hotel for the other nights, ( Dennys is where we mostly went!) Our rooms were great very spacious and comfortable, lots of space to relax, 2 large TVs helped to keep the peace. Our suite had large fridge, kitchen and dining area, and a sofa/ lounge area to chill out. Air Con and ceiling fan was appreciated. The house keeping staff did an excellent job and there was always lots of clean fluffy towels and everything kept spotless. Nice pool outside with a hot tub, great for relaxing after chasing around the theme parks! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone but especially to familys, well done and thank you Homewood Suites, you made our stay very enjoyable and your staff are very helpful, efficient and friendly, we would definitely come back again and will recomend you to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MrsRaps
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Homewood Suites Orlando-Nearest Universal Studios for 3 nights in mid-September. We loved this hotel from the moment we walked in the front door. Check-in was quick & easy, and the clerk was friendly and helpful. The lobby had several couches and armchairs, where people could sit & wait for taxis & shuttles. The hotel also had a small convenience store with snacks & essential items, a gym, arcade, and outdoor pool. We were either too busy, or tired to use any of these amenities, so we don't have any positive/negative comments about them. Our suite: When we opened the door to our room, we were thrilled to find a very spacious, modern, clean suite! It had a small kitchenette, spacious living room, large bedroom & bathroom. There were french doors that closed the bedroom off from the rest of the suite, so my husband could stay up and watch TV while I got my beauty sleep. Side note: the week we visited, all of the carpets were being replaced on the 4th & 5th floors. This did not affect our stay whatsoever, and the carpenters were very accommodating if you needed to get by to access your suite or the elevators. Bedroom: Large bedroom with a king size bed and very comfortable mattress. Even the pillows and comforter were of good quality and very clean. This made me feel very comfortable and content when getting into bed at night. (There's nothing worse than questioning the cleanliness of the sheets & bedding!). There was a large flatscreen TV, complete with modern bedroom furniture and a big ceiling fan to keep the air circulating. Bathroom: The bathroom was right next to the bedroom, and had a separate vanity & sink area. This was perfect, as I could do my hair & makeup while my husband showered in the morning. The shower & toilets had good water pressure and there was always hot water whenever either of us showered at night, or in the morning. Kitchenette: We didn't use the kitchen at all, but it was very clean and well stocked with the basics (fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, kettle). Living room: The living room was very comfortable with a large sofa, 2 arm chairs, flat screen TV, and a big office desk. The hotel has complimentary high-speed wireless (consistently 3 full bars) which was a nice bonus. Breakfast: We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning, and it was great, especially considering it was free. On Saturday & Sunday it was DIY waffles with eggs and bacon. There was also a good selection of fruit, yogurt, cereal, bread & pasteries if you didn't like the hot breakfast option. Coffee, tea, juice & milk were self serve, and availble in "to go" cups if you were in a rush. Theme parks: For those of you visiting the theme parks, there is a kiosk in the hotel. The agent sells park tickets every morning, and is very helpful if you have any questions about the parks. We originally planned on walking to Univeral Studios each morning, but it was very hot and we wanted to save our energy for the park. So, the front desk called us a cab (it may actually be a car service?), which cost approx. $12 one way, including tip. We did the same thing on the way home because our feet were sore from walking around Universal for 8 hours! Overall, this hotel was perfect for us, and I would highly recommend it to anybody planning a trip to Universal Studios Orlando. We plan on returning next year, and will definitely be booking a room at Homewood Suites-Nearest to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: zlbenites
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Totally nice, relaxing, well decorated, clean and close to everything. My husband and I were there on vacation for 5 nights. The suite was wonderful, nice decorated, lively colors, excellent sofas, comfy and clean beds, clean and spacious bathroom.... everything perfect. The lady at the reception desk, Ina, was very nice, friendly and helpful. The rest of the staff very polite and nice people, always with a smile. The breakfast and the dinner excellent and delicious. All the hotel very nice and clean. If I travel again to Orlando sure I go back to this hotel. It is totally recomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Choice”
Reviews.Author: SmilingHospitality
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I recently stayed here at the Homewood Suites near Universal Studios. It was a good stay. They had a great breakfast every morning but I wished it started at 6am instead of 7am as I had to leave early for my meetings during our stay here. They have a evening manager's reception which was pretty cool as its "FREE". It was nothing fancy but it was a value you can't say no to. Overall I would stay here again. Its close to many different destinations and not too far from the Orlando Airport either.

Reviews.Title: “Three nights of great comfort!”
Reviews.Author: cliftonmorris
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for Halloween horror nights 10/20 - 10/23. Great service and a good all around service made for a great stay. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Safe Bet!”
Reviews.Author: Phil G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 13 nights from mid October and have to say we were very happy overall with this hotel. Of note: - Staff dealt with any problems quickly and were very approachable and friendly. - The selection at breakfast of hot and cold food was very good to stock up to start the day. Mon-Thurs 5-7pm there is also a hot buffet with wine and beer. Made it a little difficult to make these owing to the being in the parks, but when we were around at that time, on the whole chose these over going out to save some money as the food was good. In all, you could say it was some way to being an all inclusive half board. - The rooms looked good on the website and lived up to expectations and were comfortable and a good size. Nice to relax in with any spare time we had which was minimal. Having two TV’s was good and stopped any arguments what to watch with a family of 4. Only problem I had, and this probably would have gone for any hotel, being from the UK and not used to having AC. I’m a light sleeper and do have a sleep problem so the noise from these going on and off all night was a problem for me, but couldn’t think of a way round this. The room had a lounge with a bedroom that was separated by doors. My daughter slept on the pull out sofa in the lounge which was comfortable, but was woken by noise from the hallway from time to time by other residents as the doors slammed shut. Did find a way round this in the end by putting a blanket and two pillows by the bottom of the entrance door which kept out most of the noise. Whether the hotel can do something to the main room door to make things a little quieter at night. We used the pool one evening around 9pm in a cooler period of weather. Water was a bit nippy for us and didn’t stay in long but the spa hot bath next to was very warm, in fact probably too warm and didn’t stay too long in there either and could of done with some of the heat from there in the main pool. Pool looked inviting but didn’t appear to be used as much as it should have been and was wasted, maybe because it was on the cold side which was a shame, and we would have used a few times if warmer. The hotel is a few minutes walk from I-drive and for eating out the nearest place was Denny’s which was convenient, although you just have to try a number of different places around I -drive and the parks. Close by and part of the Congo golf complex was a section to feed small alligators which will interest the smaller ones. Part of a cut up hot dog is dangled by rod and string into their pit and gives you a good look at these, fairly close up. Tips For the Universal parks, the hotel is close by but did still look a good 20 min/half hour walk over I-4. With the amount of walking you need for the parks, paid around $10 with tip for a taxi. It seemed to be a small price to pay in relation to everything else and you could choose to go and leave without worrying about timetables. Used I-Trolley and got the 14 day unlimited passes for $17 each. Used this for Seaworld, Aquatica, Point Orlando, shopping mall at the bottom of I-drive. Found you may have to wait a while up to 15-20 mins at worst, but on other occasions timed it right and got straight on the bus. Suggest is you are new to I-drive, use the service along the whole route to see what’s around and to get your bearings. Also once you have your bearings but just want to get from A to B, use the green route where possible which misses most of I-drive and has a lot less stops. I would definitely consider this hotel again if staying in this part of Orlando. Thanks to all for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good place with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Memphisnative
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed 4 nights at the Homewood Suites-International Drive location and were pleased overall though we had a few minor problems. The pros: it's a good location for Universal Studios. We took the free shuttle in the mornings and walked back to the hotel in late afternoon. Too long a walk for little kids but fine for adults or teens. The hotel is the morning shuttle's first stop, so you get a seat before it gets packed. Close to outlet malls and restaurants. Breakfast was pretty good--eggs, meat, a few cereals, juices, waffles, yogurt, etc. They had grapefruit halves each morning but only provided plastic knives to section them--very messy. Didn't use the pool area but found the workout room well-equipped with TVs on each machine to use with your headphones. Kitchen was nice to have. Good TVs in bedroom and living area. Quiet hotel. A/C worked fine. Staff were pleasant and efficient. The flaws: Mattress sagged in the middle quite a bit, which was a disappointment. Our bathroom light kept dimming almost to nothing--informed the desk, and they repaired while we were out but it started going out again that night. The shower head was quite loose in the wall and made it difficult to turn. Grout could've been cleaner--appeared as if they grouted over some moldy spots. Towels were rough but there were always plenty of them. One of the lights over the bath sink was coming apart at the bottom but it worked. One night there was a tornado warning for the area (we were asleep) but we didn't find out about it until we saw it on the news the next morning. I don't know what their policy is on notifying guests of something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: olozbal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in October 2011. I stayed for free using my Hilton points and picked the hotel because we were going to Universal. Nice roomy one bedroom suite with plenty of room to stretch out. In fact I'm typing this from a one bedroom Residence Inn that's supposed to be for long term guests and I have about half the room. Ouch. No real issues with the hotel. Nice pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: miamiman1967
Reviews.Content: I had a friend tell me about this Hotel. This a great place for the family to stay, Staff was Super Friendly and rooms was very clean. We went to parks in June after the first day i just wanted to stay in room, As weather in June was almost like the sun was 10ft away, HOT HOT HOT ,I was glad to find my way back to hotel. Bonus is they throw in A large Hot breakfast and Dinner from 5pm to 7pm and for a large family the rooms are almost free. Large suit that sleeps 6 was under a $100 , granite counter tops in kitchen and baths! iI will be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Goes the Extra Mile”
Reviews.Author: Tony L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood Suites hotel because it is really close to Universal (only a 5 minute drive), and also close to Sea World. We were also looking for a place that was a suite with a separate bedroom with a closeable door so we could throw our three kids into one room, and be in another room on our own. The hotel grounds are really well kept, and the pool looked nice, though we didn't use it. The complimentary breakfast was much better than most that we've seen at hotels offering free morning meals, and there's usually eggs, a meat (bacon or sausage), pancakes/waffles/french toast sticks offered as hot items, in addition to the usual continental affair, such as fruit, breads, cereals, coffee, etc. Staff was always very friendly. The hotel seems to be finishing up some major renovations, none of which were obvious because the work seemed to be done during off hours. They were replacing all of the carpets, and all of the sleeper sofas from the looks of things. The room we were in featured two flat panel TV, with your typical kid channels available, like Nick, Cartoon Network, and Disney. We did have an issue with our room on the second day, and we called down to the front desk about it. The manager wasn't in when we called early in the morning, but the desk person took my cell number, and said that the manager would call me while we were in the parks if that was ok with me. That was fine by me. As promised, the front desk manager, Rafael, called me after looking into my issue, and made everything right. My highest complements to him and his staff for being super responsive to my concerns, and fixing everything to my satisfaction. All in all, this was a very good stay, and I would recommend it for its convenience, cleanliness, and very responsive and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location just need a little bit extra to make hotel great”
Reviews.Author: nycbig8487
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with kids while visiting Universal Studios and Disney World. Rooms were clean but bathroom was musty smelling. Staff was curteous. Only two elevators for property and a/c did not work on the main elevator. Security was present and patrolling at night. Breakfast could have been better - mainly mixing things up and not having the same dishes every morning. Bought tickets for parks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Feels Like Home.”
Reviews.Author: USMC_Retired
Reviews.Content: Overall Impression: Great Location. Have stayed here for the past several years. Have never been disappointed. Very affordable and a great value. With my Hilton Honors Diamond status, I received HH points. PROs: - Great staff -Very close to Universal Studios -Proximity to local restaurants and shopping -Clean rooms -Great breakfast and Dinner CONs: -None

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: Like what you would expect from a Hilton, this property is very well maintained, the service is great and the location is outstanding. You can walk to Wet N Wild and are within minutes from the Universal Studios. The Disney parks are about 15 minutes away and Sea World about 20 minutes away (with traffic). The breakfast is good but the problem (like any other hotels here in Orlando) is that people steal food to bring to the parks. That's not the hotel problem, but rather than these people that didn't had proper education on their families. The only turn off point is that they should had more laundries spread out across the hotel or inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper48
Reviews.Content: I had requested a high floor, away from ice machine and elevator. Our room for our 5-night stay was one door away from ice & elevator, handicap accessible and on the 2nd floor. Our other request to be close to the other room in our party was fulfilled. The hotel is solidly constructed. Our room faced the pool, away from the Interstate and I rarely heard any noise from outside. The elevator and hallway were hot. I don’t know if this is the norm, or due to a malfunction of the air conditioning. Complimentary hot breakfast is available daily and hot evening meal is available Mon – Fri. The hotel has laundry, a well appointed exercise room, a game room, pool, and hot tub. The TV was awkward to use with a very long delay and the channel not displayed.
