The nightstand clock was an hour off and I couldnt reset it. The bed was a bit too soft for my liking. If you are going to be out of the room all day, call and let housekeeping know you would like early service. We got back after a day at the park to an unmade room. I called to find out the housekeepers have 15 -20 rooms to clean and have until 4:30 PM to complete them. I think we had a different housekeeper every day as there were inconsistencies in how the room was made each day. One housekeeper moved my computer and printer, placed items in a drawer and kind of rearranged things which we didn’t like. If you are staying in the Universal Studios area, I definitely recommend this hotel. Having the separate living room, kitchen, and provided meals are a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great family location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: MOMof2BoysinPA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in the orlando area. This location is down the street from Universal, around the corner from a great outlet mall. Rooms are set up for families with a separete room for sleeping and one for "hanging out" when the kids go to bed. The lobby offers a great breakfast, and during the week they have a nice snack/small dinner M-F. The only thing this hotel does not have is an elaborate pool. There is a pool and my kids enjoyed it- but it is not anything fancy. Clean, large enough, but no slides, food/ drink service..

Reviews.Title: “Got me hooked on Homewood Suites brand”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at Homewood Suites. We booked a suite with 2 queens. I was traveling with a large group of Harry Potter convention attendees, and there were around 30 or 40 of us booking a block of rooms. The rooms were spacious and had common areas large enough to routinely accommodate dozens of us every night. We took turns cooking in the very well-stocked kitchens. I've always been a fan of room service and eating out, but this trip introduced me to the benefits of having a suite setup and making your own grub. Laundry was convenient, and housekeeping was wonderful. I didn't expect them to clean up a pile of dishes we left in the sink by loading it into the dishwasher for us. Our stay was very enjoyable, and I've been frequenting Homewood Suites ever since.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kabooooooom
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms with a separate kitchen and lounge area. Nothing was too much trouble for staff and they even rustled up a kettle for us. Very convenient for Universal and the free buffet breakfast was welcome too, including making our own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “second stay at this hotel.just as good second time round”
Reviews.Author: ltj-1964
Reviews.Content: stayed here between 2nd August and 8th August. i last stayed at this hotel in 2006 with my family and we decided to stay here again. A wise choice as the hotel was just as good as the previous time and has been redecorated. The staff at reception were helpful throughout. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the hotel also offers a free shuttle bus to universal studios. The free breakfast is an added bonus but can be repetitive and plastic cutlery, bowls and plates are annoying. We got a very good rate at Travel Republic. 6 days in August for £380 or $600. All in all excellent value for money. Spacious suites with two rooms, two tv's. Perfect for families looking for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: x42384
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Very clean, comfortable stay. Location is 10 min from Universal Studios, and is very close to all other attractions. Suite comes with a kitchen/stove/refrig/pots/pans. Pool area was also clean. There is a workout room (treadmill, some free weights) and computer room for checking email. Overall, we enjoyed staying here, and would be happy to stay here again. (BTW: IHOP is nearby - walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, great location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: franxc
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about. Large rooms with two large flat screen TVs. Bedding was very comfortable. Rooms were clean. We did not use the shuttle, the drive to Universal is very short. No restaurant except for the free breakfast. Although the quality of the breakfast wasn't that great, it did include scrambled eggs and sausage, and it allowed for a very quick bite on the way to the park. Oh, and the staff was very nice and friendly. We would definitely try to stay here again if we were going to Universal. The price was good, I paid $117.50 AAA rate. Free internet with HHonors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and close to all major attractions!”
Reviews.Author: FLYDL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off International Drive, minutes from Universal Studios. The suites are large and have very comfortable bedding. A nice hot breakfast is also included. The main reason I give this hotel an excellent rating is their staff. Front desk, housekeeping, the staff members working in their food service area. Each person greeted me with a smile and a hello. I would easily recommend this establishment to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: MKSRmom
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after an extensive internet search for a hotel near Universal Studios. This hotel was GREAT. It was about a 20 minute walk to the park which we did several times. We did take a cab twice for $8.00. It is actually close to Wet "n Wild, too (even closer). We arrived a little before check in time but they were able to get us into a room anyway. We also got a late checkout on the day of our departure. The flexibility around our schedule was appreciated. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were really clean and spacious. THere were 2 flat screen TV's that we never watched and a kitchen that we barely used but it was great have a suite so everything wasn't crammed together. Breakfast was crowded but they kept it stocked past the posted closing time. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good vacation”
Reviews.Author: ques
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Check-in was fast and I was glad we had been on the road for 14 hours. Our room was spacious we had our two children and plenty of space. We were close to everything. We visited Universal the Super Star shuttle carried us to the park which saved us on parking. We bought our tickets from the hotel and got free shuttle it was air conditioned and the driver was friendly and fun, it stops at several other hotels but it's less than 30 mins. The breakfast was great and plentiful. The hotel staff was friendly and spoke passing in the hallway.Our room faced Universal and we saw the fireworks each night from our window it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value, extra food amenities and convenience of parks”
Reviews.Author: pamela3969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites on American Way for 6 nights in July 2011. We chose this hotel because of it's availability to accommodate 6 of us and had a kitchenette. The room was a 2-room suite, with the 2-queen bed room separated from the sitting and kitchenette area. The beds were awesome and the air conditioner worked great!!! The couch in the sitting area opens to a full size bed. The sheets and pillows for the couch that opens to a bed did not smell freshly washed, and there was someone else's hair on the blankets. Since, there were six of us in a room, we needed six towels for bathing each day, but the housekeeping staff would always put only 5 towels in the bathroom, despite asking and daily tipping. The kitchen was tiny, but adequate, except that the dishes provided only accommodate 4 persons, which defeated our purpose for staying at this particular hotel. The morning breakfasts were plentiful and fresh, although, seating is an issue. Several times we had to take our food back to our rooms. The evening "welcoming dinner" was decent, complete with adult beverages of beer and red/white wine, which my husband especially liked. We only ate their one evening and it was a simple chinese meal. For the value, the extra food amenities, and convenience of Disney and Universal, overall, it was worth staying there. Pamela Katy, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for A Universal Studios or SeaWorld Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Occams_Hammer
Reviews.Content: I took my family for an Orlando Florida vacation to visit Universal Studios and SeaWorld. This hotel is almost walking distance to Universal, but it's still better to drive. Now that my kids are teens, I need to have a suite and this does the trick. The suites were large enough to accommodate 2 adults and 2 teens. Free Breakfast and also a free dinner time food available. the dinner time feeding was not a full dinner (e.g., light food items like cold cut sandwiches), but it satiated you appetite and you do this a few nights during your stay along with the free breakfast, you can save a decent amount on your vacation meals. Beds are comfortable and bathroom is clean. The room prices are very reasonable, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and definitely accomodating :)”
Reviews.Author: live_life_without_regrets
Reviews.Content: The location was right around the corner from everything! Universal studios, wet n wild and many restaurants and a walgreens, plus many gift shops, within walkin distance, altho we drove to them all the time. Having breakfast and sometimes dinner saved us so much money, and there was always a plentiful amount to chose from, eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, biscuts n gravy, toast, bagels, crosaints, cereals, hashbrowns, and many juices. For dinner there would normally be a maincourse and a salad, also beer and wine were on the house, for those who drink. Front desk was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for my family”
Reviews.Author: mmd13233
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families with young children because you can put them to bed and still watch t.v. or read in the other room without disturbing them. We chose it due to the proximity to Universal Studios. It was only about five minutes from door to door. Breakfast had eggs, juice, fresh fruit, breads and coffee each morning. In addition to those items, there was always some kind of waffles or pancakes or french toast sticks. There was also a meat each day. One day we had sausage. One day we had bacon. They also served biscuits and gravy. In the evenings, Mon through Thursday, they served a meal. One night we had lasagna, salad and bread. The other night we had stuffed peppers, salad, bread and corn. Soda was included. There is no extra charge for these meals which saved our family a lot of money on two different evenings. The hotel had a group of teenagers from Brazil staying on property while we were there and I was concerned about 150 people trying to access breakfast along with all the other hotel guests, but they set up a separate room for the tour group which was convenient for them and for us. Staff was very friendly from the maintenance guys I saw at the pool to the front desk clerk to the housekeeping staff. We stayed with a AAA rate and considering the food we received and the size of the room, this is certainly our hotel of choice from now on when we stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: saagarikapanchal
Reviews.Content: the rooms here are spacious and clean. the service is nice. the hotel is near to universal studios and other parks such as sea world, wet n wild. there is hot choclate, tea , coffee available 24 hrs.the hotel is quite good.the complimentary breakfast was nice. the staff was also helpful, welcoming.the rates are resonable. there was a small kitchen in the room. the hotel has many facilities. there is a swimming pool here which is good n enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have been to!”
Reviews.Author: Ponderosa123
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to everyone it is close to universal and round the corner is wet 'n' wild a water park.all the family lived this hotel there is good breakfast,dinner,pool and arcade.you get all these for free when you stay at this hotel.I really mean this when I say this hotel is the best I've ever been to and you would probably enjoy it more than myself and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fatmama_11
Reviews.Content: Totally loved this hotel. Reviews from Trip Advisor helped decide to book this hotel. Wasn't disappointed at all. Room was clean, staff was helpful and courteous. We actually saved quite a bit because the hotel offers free breakfast, shuttle service to / from Universal Studios, internet and dinner from Monday - Thursday. I would most definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs better dining area controls”
Reviews.Author: bounty01
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to its proximity to Universal Studios, spacious rooms, good complimentary breakfast and dinner, and full kitchen in the rooms. We also liked the fact that they do not allow guests to keep animals in the rooms, like they do at the on-site hotels at Universal Studios. There were a couple of significant drawbacks however. One was that although you can get a non-smoking room, there apparently are some smoking rooms in this hotel. So you can't avoid walking through a cloud of smoke in the hallways that has drifted from rooms (such as the cloud that was drifting out of room 505 on 6/19/11). Another issue was the lack of health code controls over the guests serving themselves food the complimentary food in the dining area. On 6/19/11, I saw a pot-bellied, shirtless, tatooed guy walk in dripping wet from the pool while I was eating dinner. He then proceeded to go into the buffet area and start serving himself a plate of food. The hotel employee working in the room made no attempt to tell the guy that he must wear a shirt and shoes in the room. Needless to say, I lost my appetite and now have second thoughts about taking advantage of the complimentary food at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, motel-like”
Reviews.Author: eloracm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights while visiting Universal after having spent several nights at a Disney hotel and the Disney parks. We weren't impressed at all with the neighborhood, nor the area in general. One of the reasons we changed hotels was to take advantage of the shuttle service. The shuttle turned out to be completely useless. You need to make a reservation for it and the reservation desk closes around 4; the first night we didn't check in until after 5, so we weren't able to make a reservation for the next morning. There are only 3 pickup times in the morning, at 7:40, 8:35, and 10:30. From the schedule it looks like it goes to 3 other hotels before finally going to the park, so it is probably a 30 to 35 minute ride. Then, there are only 3 returns, at 5:40, 7:45, and 8:35. Fortunately, we had a car, so we just drove, which took about 8 minutes. The room itself was large, but nothing special. Everything had a motel feel rather than a hotel. If we had known how useless the shuttle was and what the hotel and area were like, we would have just stayed in the Downtown Disney hotel for the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: j4traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights during our stay and went to Universal Studios. The room was spacious and clean. We enjoyed the small kitchen and the separate bedrooms. The room was quiet except for the traffic on the interstate. We would defiently stay here again if we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Tea_Meister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the sole purpose of visiting Universal Studios - nice property and very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are well appointed and clean. Neighborhood offer few food choices but you can get room service from the next door Hilton Garden (they also have a little bar there there is handy) Getting to Universal is easy - shuttle is free and runs about every hour or so.. Cab to is $8 before tip,return is $6 before tip Trip take 4-5 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: karlpestell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got back from Orlando earlier this week and I wanted to write a review before I forgot and went back to work! This hotel is great in many ways, it is in a great location, very close to Universal Studios (about a 15 minute walk) and still only about 20 mins drive to the Disney parks. The rooms are excellent, lots of space and the added bonus of a kitchen with big fridge/freezer. I have stayed at a number of hotels in Orlando and this has shot to the top of my list. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is great every morning and a welcome start to the day... saves you money compared to most other hotels who will charge for it. There is always a free evening meal (Mon to Thurs) which we had a couple of days and again, was great, especially considering it was free! There is a free shuttle to all the main parks, not something we used but recognised that many other hotels were charging for the same service. Overall, when I go back to Orlando, I will definately stay at this hotel again. Thanks for a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Homewood, hope wouldn't be the last”
Reviews.Author: gabibuj
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had the occasion to stay at a Homewood hotel, and frankly I did not know what to expect. It is probably not the best choice to stay solo, but I would definetively choose this hotel again when travelling with kids or family. Regarding this particular hotel, it seemed to me to be a little understaffed, but I got a good service, and I have nothing else to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmarie12
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 3 nights and I thought that the stay was wonderful. The continental breakfast VERY good. We were also lucky enough to be there on some of the evenings that they had the light dinner from 5-7. We saved so much money by not having to eat out every night! Rates were very resonable. Rooms were very clean. Beds were extremely comfortable. Check in and check out was a breeze and the staff was excellent!! They were very helpful in giving information and calling transportation when our group needed it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking in Orlando. It is about an hour from disney, but very close to universal and citywalk.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay - Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chealf
Reviews.Content: Arrived back today from our 4th stay at Homewood Suites. We can not fault this hotel one bit. Excellent location, clean spacious rooms, friendly staff and all the extras they provide, ie; free internet, free parking, complimentry evening meals with alcohol beverages Monday to Thursday, plenty of TV stations with films viewing daily and free shuttle to parks. The hotel staff will bend over backwards to help and ensure you have a plesant stay. Top hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR UNIVERSAL and Harry Potter”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Sharon
Reviews.Content: nice hotel good location for the universal theme parks away from the noise of International drive the homewood suites are starting to look slightly jaded ( nothing a fresh coat of paint wouldnt put right ) but this isnt surprising when the rooms seem to be full all year round , but they are clean and tidy and well worth the money , how long do you spend in your hotel room in Orlando anyway ? they are spacious and ideal for a good nights sleep . the staff are very friendly , as good as any top hotel , and the free breakfast is a definate bonus , a great way to start the day without leaving your hotel . having stayed both here and the adjacent Hilton Garden Inn i would gladly return to either next time in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in this area!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bec916
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, great access to Universal & other stuff on I-Drive. We arrived in Orlando at 7:30am after a 19 hour car ride and they let us check in and offered us breakfast! Stayed two nights with 3 adults,a 17 year old & an 8 year old. They loved the pool, buffet breakfast was great, room was comfortable & clean & there was plenty of space for all of us. Universal is within walking distance but it would be a hike. Best to take their free shuttle. We were able to walk to lots of shops, restaurants, water park & mini golf though. Kitchette was very ample...they had dishes, etc. but I chose not to cook in the room. Room was on the second floor and it was very quiet as hotel is set back from the road. We will definitely return to this hotel when visiting the area again!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Family Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrekerbabeNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Trust me, you will not be disappointed! This hotel was the perfect place to stay at, if you're doing Universal Studios. We reserved the 1 bedroom and it was perfect for our family of four. Our room was very spacious and clean. The kids had their own TV and we had ours. The bonuses were so numerous: Walking distance to Universal Studios & Wet n Wild, free breakfast each morning, Light supper Mon - Thurs, Free shuttle to Universal, Seaworld and Aquatica. Laundry room was cheap - $1.00 to wash and $1.00 to dry - Excellent. The hotel was filled with children, but the walls were so thick we never heard our neighbors! Each night we slept well! Stay here you will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Return there? Anytime!!!”
Reviews.Author: hatshepsout_11
Reviews.Content: Clean, excellent service, quiet, good location, can go to Universal Studios by walk. Persons at front desk were very helpful, and always with smile.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay for a great price in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: rastheaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites as we were spending most of our time at Universal Studios in Orlando. For what were paid, we were not expecting it to be as excellent quality - the service, the room and the food provided were all great. They provide a shuttle service to Universal Studios but you can also easily walk there in about 20 minutes. One thing to be aware of is that the shuttles are first in, best dressed so make sure you get there first thing in the morning or get a pass for each day in advance from the Universal help desk located in the hotel lobby during their hours. I would certainly stay there again when we go back to Universal Studios. It is definitely the best value for money accommodation I have stayed in, especially so close to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Still THE hotel for Disney trips!”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Every time we think about switching to a Lake Buena Vista property for a shorter drive to Disney, the personal service, friendliness, and warmth of the staff at this hotel makes the idea preposterous! One of the keys to their success is staff retention - we get to Disney about twice a year and the staff recognizes us and greets us by name as soon as we enter the lobby (yes, you Inna !). It's like staying with friends....with a lot of bedrooms and other house guests!

Reviews.Title: “I will Definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: joan72761
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights (Fri, Sat, Sun) in a suite with 2 beds in the bedroom and the sofa sleeper in the living room. I was very impressed with the size of the room. We brought our folding crib with us and there was plenty of room beside one of the beds to put it without being crowded. The staff was exceptional! Every member of the staff we interacted with was pleasant and seemed to Want to make our stay pleasant. The breakfast was very good although I did get rather tired of eggs. They had 2 types of eggs every morning with bacon or sausage or hashbrown potatoes. A real bonus to me was that they carried 4 types of juice to include cranberry juice. The only real negative I can say about this hotel is that the beds are not very comfortable and the hot tub out by the pool could use a overhaul. Thats it. I can't think of anything else that bothered me about this hotel. The hotel is very nice, family friendly and close to everything. I will stay here again and I will recommend it to anyone that asks for a hotel referral near Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies' mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTravelor62
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights for a little get-away trip (We're Seniors) & the suite was perfect. Loved the separate living room - kitchen, which could be closed off from the bedroom. The staff was very pleasant & helpful; the lady who manned the Universal ticket sales booth was an absolute delight, so enthusiastic & very helpful. Breakfasts were okay but not great; no complaints about anything else. It's very close to Universal & the shuttle's an added plus. Restaurants seem to be mostly chains, not great food!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: COmomma77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We asked for a suite so teens could stay up later in another room, within walking distance to Universal, a "quiet" room away from elevators, etc., top floor so we had a view and wanted a place that provided breakfast. The Homewood Suites was EXACTLY what we hoped for! The staff from start to finish were friendly, helpful and always in great moods! The rep for Universal was so much fun...and very helpful. We had use of the Tiki Bar and pool at the hotel next door as well. Loved it!!! We will definately keep this place in mind for our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, perfect for Universal trip”
Reviews.Author: dlabq
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. It's a 20-minute walk to Universal, all sidewalked. It's also a 5-min. walk to Wet and Wild. The hotel is really clean, the rooms are spacious. We had a two-bedroom suite and the beds were super-comfortable. Ours was on the 5th floor, which I had requested when booking it, with a view of Universal. Unfortunately, it also overlooked I-4. I wear earplugs, and my daughter can sleep through anything, so the road noise didn't bother us, but it might bother some people. Great view. Excellent breakfast buffet with above-average scrambled eggs. Really nice pool area. Friendly staff. We didn't book it thru Universal because I got a great rate with a federal employee discount. An earlier poster mentioned that you would get into the park early if you stay here, but that's only if you book through Universal. When you take the shuttle in the morning, this is the first hotel they stop at, so you get a seat. But you won't get to Universal until about 8:35. One day they opened the gates before we got there (although they officially don't open until 9). The other day they opened around 8:45, so we just made it. The last hotel shuttle leaves Universal at 7:20; we walked back instead. You can also take a cab but the line to get one was really long both nights. The idiot Mears driver took us to the wrong Homewood Suites, the one by the convention center, despite the fact that the address was on the boarding passes they gave us. The desk clerk paid for a cab to take us to the right place! Go Homewood! Unfortunately, I was out 2 tips, which Mears refused to reimburse. The return shuttle driver was late picking us up. He told us he got lost, and that a passenger had gotten him there. The desk clerk who got us the cab said, "Mears is the absolute worst."

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: PickyPassenger
Reviews.Content: After a steady diet of Crypts by Marriott (claustrophobic rooms), I mean Courtyard by Marriott and Hyatt Place, our first Homewood Suites was a breath of welcome, fresh air. Nicely decorated, clean, bright, light, airy, roomy and quiet suites provided comfort whether hanging out during the day or sleeping at night. Extremely warm and helpful staff made us not want to leave for our next destination. Homewood Suites will be my first choice from now on (until I experience a bad one somewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Smokey Non-Smoking Room”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: When I checked in on Tuesday, February 8 late evening I noticed the smell of smoke in my room 404 even though it was cleary marked as a non-smoking room. When I checked at the front desk there were no other non-smoking rooms available. The front desk also checked accross the street, but, nothing was available. So I slept there anyway with the windows open. The next day the front desk said they would install a ozone machine to remove the smoke and if we wanted to move they would look for an alternate room again. When I returned around 5pm it seemed most of the smoke was removed so I decided to stay in the room, since I did not want to repack my clothes. Other than above I did enjoy your the suite style room and hot morning breakfast and evening snacks with beer. I did not like the Franzia red wine.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: serviceplease10
Reviews.Content: Clean nice ,the best yet.I would stay here again. thank you for great time . I think this place should be worth more. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Clean, Affordable, Safe, close to Harry Potter without paying the big bucks”
Reviews.Author: wal-26
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay at Homewood nearest Universal Studios. The daytime staff and service are superior. All of the daytime people working there are friendly and helpful, particularly the Manager himself, so he should be congratulated for what he's created here - quite special. The daytime staff (reception/kitchen/housekeeping) go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and you're really treated as a welcomed guest. The beds are SUPER comfortable. The sofabed is not comfortable. Housekeeping does a nice clean, thorough job. It's great VALUE with the free breakfast buffet (lots of fruit, yoghurt, cereal, scrambled eggs, waffles or pancakes, juice, sometimes hashbrowns, oatmeal, toast, bagels etc) plus the dinner 4 nites (the raviolli was fantastic) with free wine and beer. Kitchen in room. This place is perfect for families. Feeling safe was important to us too. Quieter on the poolside but the highway side is ok too because tired after theme park activities. It's a great place to stay for Universal Studios but even for Disney and Seaworld it's great too because it's so easy to get on the highway. One time we even walked back from Universal Studios to the hotel. One of the elevators is often not working, but it's not a big deal to take the stairs. If it is for you, then ask for a room on main floor or second floor, or go on any floor but near the second elevator which works perfectly. Free parking. The universal studios booth at the hotel is handy, and Po is energetic and helpful too. We'd stay there again. The breakfast times and dinner times are fine, and we left full.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable alternative for a family of 5 going to Universal”
Reviews.Author: beachcomber89
Reviews.Content: *Pros* This hotel is a great option for a family of five to do Universal on a budget. We were all in one room and were comfortable. This is a Universal Partner Hotel so we were able to get into Islands of Adventure an hour early ahead of the general public. I cannot tell you how valuable this perk is. We rode every thing in the Harry Potter World by 9 a.m. and left when the crowds started pouring in. We took the shuttle so we didn't have to pay parking fees or deal with the crazy traffic. *Cons* If you use the shuttle to go to Universal or Islands of Adventure don't count on making breakfast or the manager's reception. Our shuttle times were 6:20 a.m. and & 7:05 a.m. both days. Breakfast does not begin till 7:00 a.m.?? The earliest shuttle back is 6:45 p.m. so you don't make it back to the hotel till 7:00 p.m. The manager's reception operates from 5-7 p.m. so they are shutting everything down when you walk in. I would suggest to management to start breakfast at 6:00 a.m. and operate the manager's reception from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. so people using the shuttle are not excluded. If these two issues were fixed, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected value”
Reviews.Author: chow_family
Reviews.Content: Our family lived in this hotel during Christmas. They have complementary breakfast and light dinner. This was what I expected. However, hotel also provided red wine, white wine and beer for the dinner, This was something unexpected. Although it was not the best wine, it was free, why should I complain? The light dinner was very convenient after a day of theme park activities. I didn't need to worry about the menu. We just sat down and ate. We were still be able to continue activities at night, such as shopping. We tried 3 nights. The hotel provided fried chicken, beef & rice, pasta, Overall, the hotel room was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: tvlagntwkids
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about the hotel itself. It is the typical Homewood Suites. Large rooms with kitchens, good size bathrooms, hot breakfast, good pool and whirlpool, extremely nice and helpful staff. But this hotel is really hard to find if you are unfamiliar with the area. We went to Sea World and used a GPS to get to the hotel (as did our friends who were not traveling with us). An 8 minutes drive took us 1 1/2 hours. We were right by the hotel and just couldn't see it. The signage is terrible. Our friends took over 2 hours to find the hotel.. and that was with us talking them in because their GPS was useless as well. A great stay was hampered by the frustration of trying to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One really nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMitchell29
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this last month for a quick family trip to Disney. we choose this hotel over and over again because of the cleanliness and more so because of the staff. This hotel have the best staff ever, I truly enjoying seeing Polliana, Chandinie, and Ms. Arlene. The hotel itself sits back off I drive and it is very quiet considering some rooms face the highway. The free breakfast is pretty nice too, the menu somewhat change daily and the evening reception is not to be missed. Overall a very good stay as always

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Orlando Nearest Universal Good Place to Stay for Trip to Universal”
Reviews.Author: Bosen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on November 1 and 2, 2010. We had difficulty finding the hotel. (We arrived in town at night, which made it hard to read the street signs, and our MapQuest directions were wrong.) I suggest calling the hotel directly for directions since the street sign for American Way is hard to spot. We requested a room on the Universal theme-park-view side of the hotel. Apparently, there are no fireworks this time of the year at Universal, but we could see part of one of the roller coasters (I think it was Dragon Challenge) from our 2nd floor room. If you were on a higher floor, you might be able to see more of Universal. There is a little noise on this side from I-4. Wasn't enough to keep us awake, but if you are an extremely light sleeper you may want to request a room on the other side of the hotel. The room was clean and plenty of towels were always supplied -- no need to ask for extra ones. Since bed bugs are a concern for many right now I should say that we checked for bed bugs before unpacking anything. We saw no trace of any and had no bites the next morning. The size of the suite was excellent for the three of us -- all adults. There is a living room/kitchen area separate from the bedroom. I think the living room had a sleeper sofa, but we did not use this. The kitchen has a full fridge and a two-burner stove but no oven. However, there is a microwave. For those who need two rooms that provide privacy, be aware that you must enter the bedroom to get to the bathroom. The bathroom is a tight fit between the door and toilet, but it was clean and adequate with all plumbing working properly and quietly. If you have balance problems, be aware that the tub is not really flat on the bottom. It curves in in such a way that it makes you feel a bit wobbly. If you have balance problems, you may want to ask the hotel about a handicapped room -- perhaps those have walk-in showers that would eliminate this problem. The rooms and hotel lobby are decorated with bright colors and tropical fish/shells/seahorse decor. Was very pleasant with a nice fountain in the lobby. The breakfast was good, with a few hot items each morning as well as the typical dry cereal, juices, coffee, and yogurt. The dinner at night (which I think is served M-Th, 5-7) was more than enough for our dinner and was at just the right time to make it convenient to eat at the hotel after returning from Universal (which closed at 6 both days we were there). They served a main entree, salad, a vegetable, and a choice of drinks on the two nights we ate there. The hotel is just a short drive to Universal's parking area. Just exit the hotel, turn right on International Drive, turn right at the first light onto Universal Blvd., and follow the signs to Universal. It took us about 5 min. to reach Universal's parking garage. All in all, this was a very pleasant stay and the free meals saved us a bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: crssafox
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Orlando with some friends for a concert and to spend some time away, and we ended up using Hilton reward points to cover our stay at the Homewood Suites hotel. Check-in was incredibly fast and efficient - we were in our room within five minutes. Very clean, nicely decorated hotel, the suite was great! Very comfortable for four people to be sure. The full kitchen was a nice touch, we were able to keep sodas and water cold for the morning. High ceilings, comfortable beds, nice big bathroom... what more can I say? Oh yeah, we had towel origami ducks waiting for us on the kitchen counter and the bathroom counter. What a nice touch for such a family-oriented hotel! We had absolutely no problems during our stay - and woke up to a full breakfast with eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, waffles... you name it, it was there. Our check-out the next day (which is at noon, by the way; you get an extra hour or two compared to other area hotels) was equally as fast as the check-in, just had to hand the keys to the ladies at the desk and we were good to go. They were polite and courteous, asking how everything was and seemed to be pleased to hear that we had a good time. Would definitely recommend to families - you can easily accommodate four to six people in one room, and the kitchen makes it easy to bring your own food. Especially considering that weekdays also include the full breakfast as well as a light meal at dinnertime, this hotel practically pays for itself. We will definitely be keeping this one in mind for future stays in the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the Money”
Reviews.Author: mrgrasso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really amazing for the money. If you are traveling with kids, the fact that you get a separate bedroom is fantastic. Couple that with the free full breakfast...that saves you $40 right there. The entire Homewood concept is great and and the private bedroom really seals the deal. The pool was very nice, free wireless internet...and how great was is to be able to use the business center and print stuff out for free! It's nice not to get nickel and dime'd for a change.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirggus
Reviews.Content: We spent eight nights in this hotel and it was a good place to stay. Friendly staff, clean rooms, nice little swimming pool, ok breakfast, good beds and even a good sleeper in livingroom (which is not very common, I have noticed...)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dmiller0216
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have stayed at many hotels in the Orlando area and this Homewood Suites exceeds all of them in service and cleanliness. The location is great, close to outlet shopping and theme parks. The suites are very large with separate living and sleeping areas. They also have complete kitchen facilities if you choose to dine in. Housekeeping did an excellent job servicing the room each day. Daily breakfast and Monday through Thursday evening meals varied each day and were hot, fresh and very good. The hotel staff is quite friendly, we were greeted with a "Welcome Home" every time we entered the front door. It really made you feel like they truly valued your business. The pool and hot tub were crystal clear with plenty of chairs and loungers in the sun or shade depending on your preference. The hotel also has a business center with two computers (free to use), exercise room and two laundry rooms. We will definitely return to this hotel the next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Yeanira23
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just came back from our vacation in Orlando. We stayed at the Homewood Suites-near Unviersal Studios. Usually we stay at the other Hilton property next door which offered us a good service but we sure prefere the Homewood Suites now. The facilities are good, the location is wonderfull and the service is amazing. The staff is very service oriented and were very helpfull and deligent with all of our needs. The transportation to and from Universal Studios was a plus and the location right next to Wet n Wild its superb. The breakfast was really good and the managers reception in the afternoon was an unexpected plus. We just got back yesterday and were so pleased with our stay that we are allready planning on going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Well above expectations”
Reviews.Author: jomaud
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We had a lovely suite with hugh bathroom and large shower area. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was great with a good choice but not too many. It was fresh and always filled up. If something wasn't there Maria, Max and can't remeber the other guy's name would always try and get it. There was a great pool with towels supplied. They had free internet access with free printed which was great cos we had to check-in online for our flights and print boarding cards. The location was fantastic for Wet & wild, Universal(can walk their in 20 mins) although we were the only people walking!!! Also good for International Drive. Buses to Seawaorld 1/2 ride. Also to Florida Mall 1/2 ride. We like the congo river golf at the end of the street and the IHOP(pancakes) also at end of street. Having never been to Orlando before and the rest of my family's 1st time in US this hotel made things so easy and enjoyable. I would highly recommend and very good value for money. Thank you all at Homewood nearest Universal. Oh and I forgot to meantion the evening recption (Mon-Thurs) having arrived from a 9 hrs flight they had burgers, salad & fries plus iced cold sodas and larger!!! all free and just what we needed in the heat!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel during our USA trip.”
Reviews.Author: sunthorn
Reviews.Content: We were in America for 18 nights staying in many cities in various states. And I have to say this hotel was by far the best hotel of our trip. Room was very big and very clean. Bed was very comfortable. Location was good and the staff was great. We love the breakfast they provided. Too bad we didnt get to try their complimentary light dinner. If I ever get to visit Orlando again, I would surely stay here without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy and very convenient to Universal”
Reviews.Author: OhioTarheel
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised with the large, clean room and how very close to Universal this hotel was. It was very easy/quick to drive over to Universal and drop off the kids - even faster than the free shuttle from the hotel. The hotel was crowded, but we were not bothered by excessive noise. An extra touch which we all enjoyed was the decorative folding of the towels in our room by the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously - overrated... be cautious.”
Reviews.Author: realdealtrav
Reviews.Content: First, I'll admit this is our first time staying in a Homewood Suites, however, we use Hilton properties quite often. We chose this hotel after reading the wonderful reviews and needing a suite since we were traveling with our two yr old, seven mo. old, and our preteen nephews. Second, I'll admit that we were looking to do this trip on a budget considering we just came back from Hawaii a few months ago. Third, we wanted something very close to Universal with easy access to Sea World, Aquatica and Wet n Wild. I guess you need to take just a tidbit of info from every review because my husband and I came back from our trip wondering where in the world did all the great reviews come from; even our nephews (11 and 10) were shocked at the lack of quality. I'll start with the small things and build to the big issues: (1) yes, there was breakfast and it was the sorriest breakfast ever. I think they offered bacon two days out of our 9 day stay and everything else was pitiful. I think the instant grits and oatmeal were the best part of breakfast; (2) The pool area was mediocre. (3) Service was standard - nothing extra special, just the usual decency. (4) The room is standard jr. suite sized - and honestly, having the bathroom in the master bedroom doesn't really work for people who are looking for a suite for teens and children. The full size refrigerator was nice and so was having a dishwasher (great for bottles). (5) Men's bathroom on main floor absolutely gross per the hubby and nephews. I also noticed that someone threw away a Popeyes chicken box and other garbage in the hallway can outside our room and it remained there for our entire trip. (6) Security doesn't exist. Every night we received coupons from various pizza restaurants, yet when we called the front desk to inquire, they told us they don't recommend any of the places because they have been known for questionable behavior with credit cards, etc. Also, when we did order pizza, the delivery person came directly to our room with no call from front desk to inquire if we indeed ordered pizza. What??!! (7) I was assaulted or violated in some way by a security guard on duty. I was using the hotel computer and a security guard came in the room to offer my nephew and I some kind of assistance by trying to grab my seven mo. old baby out of my hand and when I told her no, I have him, she leaned across me (very close for any stranger), reached between my legs to grab a piece of paper I dropped on the floor. VERY STRANGE. My nephew even noticed the oddness. I immediately told this guard that I could get the paper and she left the room but not entirely because she listened at the door, as I tried to downplay the situation for my nephews sake by telling him, "Hey, what's her prob, trying to grab my baby?" The guard came back in and told me that she tried to grab him because he was so cute. WEIRD. I went to my room and told my husband about the incident and was glad to know that he thought the situation was bizarre too and that I was not overreacting. My nephew told me he thought she was "hitting on me"! Yikes! So, you see where my not fully being able to decide if I was assaulted or violated comes from in this situation. (8) There were some shady people hanging in and around hotel. One night it looked like there was a pimp in the game room, and another night, there were teenage young men just hanging around an empty lot by the hotel. Now, we are not prudes... we are from a big city with crime and all kinds of activity, so we recognize when people are up to no good and these teens were waiting for prey. SO, if you are looking for a good location, very mediocre and quesitonable living arrangements for a regular value, this is the place for you. We, on the otherhand are back to staying at Universal hotels - Portofino, Hard Rock, etc. or giving other chains a try.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: forrill04
Reviews.Content: Just like every other review on here. The hotel is great, breakfast and dinner meals were awesome! Very close to parks and easy to get around. American way was a little difficult to find for me, but an easy tip for someone trying to find the hotel is turn like you are going to eat and Denny’s. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: TakinItEasyinIowa
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor is the ONLY way I find hotels anymore. With the exception of Gatorland, with hotels and attractions it never fails. That being said, Homewood Suites was another great pick. My teen son loved to have the sofa bed to himself in the next room. It was a lot of space and very neat quarters. I wasn't entirely crazy about the decor (not sure if it was slightly dated or just different choice), but that's personal taste. :) Everything was clean and our maid did a very nice job. I will never understand that typically the more you pay, the less you get at expensive hotels - basically you typically pay for a really fantastic lobby. With Homewood, we got everything - big room, good breakfast, no awkward bell boy service, an arcade that actually had games that weren't broken (most hotels they are some broken), nice pool and although I didn't use it on this trip, a decent looking fitness center (they APPEARED to be functional) and all for what we usually pay for a double bed without a suite. We were always out too late to try the Welcome Home meal or whatever, but it seemed an awesome bonus perk to have yet a second meal. Unless you actually like paying extra for things - highly recommend! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Again !”
Reviews.Author: Swedish
Reviews.Content: Greetings from Sweden ! On my last day out of a 8 day stay here at Homewood suites I can now conclude this stay. This was my fifth stay at this Hotel for the last five year. And they still keep up the high standard. The one and only thing that i have complained about before are now fixed, The breakfast area where earlier a mess since the only lady filling up now have increased to two person. That have corrected the issue with the staff not having time to fill up items that where out. Now its a much more clean breakfast-area. I am surprised that the hotel still looks like its brand new ! As always the staff are wonderful. Other thing that I like with this Hotel is that it is in a PERFECT location in Orlando.. Smack bang in the middle of everything important with the same distance to everything, with extremely easy access to the highways that take you to the things you want to visit in Orlando. And the price for staying here is unbeatable. You get a full two room-suite with breakfast for about half the price it would have cost at an equal luxury hotel elsewhere in Orlando. The only thing that I can say is that if you are a beginner-tourist in Orlando, This is the absolutely best hotel you can get for this price. And I can say that after having visited Orlando for over 25 years. Peter & Ingela Marschall Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Orlando Theme Park Visitors”
Reviews.Author: rosienjerzy
Reviews.Content: Rooms-- We stayed 2 nights over the past weekend. The hotel is nice, clean, updated & the rooms are very spacious. Continental Breakfast-- Very good. Only complaint was the group of kids that overtook the breakfast area in the morning. I wish the hotel would have served them in a conference room away from the guests. Pool / Hot Tub-- Very nice Theme Park Shuttle-- Leaves & returns 2x a day..wish it was more frequent:(

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Universal Guests”
Reviews.Author: maurich1
Reviews.Content: Although it has been over a year since we visited from NJ, we just booked another stay here at Homewood Suites near Universal studios (gotta see Harry Potter!!) This hotel was outstanding, service was great, suite was huge and the beds were sooo comfortable. The suite is big enough that the family wasn't on top of one another. The room came with a free hot breakfast AND a managers reception (Mon-Thu night) which included a free evening meal and complimentary wine and beer--what a bonus!! Food isnt exactly outstanding cuisine but it was decent. The pool was great also. I cannot say enough about this hotel, if you are a family going to Universal, stay here. Its clean, close and very inexpensive. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home-wood again”
Reviews.Author: Floridashirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned after three weeks touring the USA, the last week spent at the Homewood Suites. It was our second stay at this lovely hotel. The staff are all very helpful and would always smile and say hello where ever they saw you in the property. The rooms are spotlessly clean but a little on the small side compared with other suites, there was only the two of us but if there was six of you in a suite it could feel a little crowded. Check in was easy, they even let us have the room before the usual check-in time. A beautiful hot breakfast is served every morning consisting of; bacon or sausage patties, scrambled egg, potatoes, cereals, toast, pastries and make your own waffles, Everything was lovely and hot and replenished regularly all included in your room price Mon to Thurs evening they do an evening snack with wine or beer, the snacks while we were there included; meatballs and spaghetti, cold meat and salad, salisbury steak,potatoes and veg, again included in your room price. The pool is clean and a good temperature, not too cold to make you shiver but cool enough to be refreshing, plenty of towels, sun loungers and cabanas. The hotel is well positioned for Universal Studios, you can see it out of the windows across the I4, for this reason we had a room overlooking the pool rather than the noisy road, the rooms do seem to be well sound proofed tho. Easy access to Disney particularly if you go down Turkey Lake road and onto Palm Parkway. There are plenty of restaurants close by and only a short drive to the new Prime Outlet for some fantastic shopping. There are a couple of computers to use free of charge near the reception but they are dreadfully slow so it might be better to take your laptop and use it in your room. We had a wonderful stay and will consider using this hotel again in the future. This was our 12th time to Florida and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean welcoming place to stay. So Mr Manager, well done to you and your staff. (I wonder if he will respond to this review)

Reviews.Title: “New plan for my future travels thanks to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1markp
Reviews.Content: I've recently been sticking with the Marriot subsidies such as Courtyard, Fairfield and Springfield on my domestic travels but that will hopefully be changed for the better thanks to my stay at this Homewood Suites. Little things like welcome and thank you emails before and after my visit were nice, but the things that impressed me were the hotel itself. The room layout was nice with a kitchenette that hada full sized fridge, since, dishwasher and stove top with the microwave. A dining table, a living room with a wide screen TV (not digital signal though...darn) and a seperate room with TV for the bed. The room was comfortable and clean and had plenty of nice sized towels. The pool area is nice (with pool towels there) and the lobby attractive. Breakfast each day had plenty of options with breads, fruit, cereal etc standard and waffles french toast etc alternating. (They should have scrambled eggs without green stuff, or cheese etc in them however.). The staff was attentive, friendly and very helpful. As if they liked working there and making people welcome.The hotel is minutes from all major and minor amusements in the Orlando area and there's a 7-11 around the bend for snacks, beer, etc. So, now that I found this hotel, if all of the Homewood Suites are as nice, you have a new faithful customer. One thing...avoid room 103. It is low to the water table in Florida and everyone on that floor's waste water runs through a sump pump near the room and it gets a bit annoying as everyone wakes up in the morning. Otherwise, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Taffman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just off International Drive, near the I4, which means you can get to wherever you want to go fairly easily. We stayed four nights and were really sorry to leave. We had a two Queen suite, with kichen/diner and sofabed, a separate bedroom and bathroom, all immaculately kept. There were 2 tv`s and all crockery,cutlery, etc for 4 persons in the kitchen. Staff were all friendly and helpful,particularly the breakfast room staff who worked tirelessly and laid on an excellent hot breakfast buffet. Another bonus was a complimentary evening meal with beer and wine between 5pm and 7 pm Monday to Friday. This hotel surpassed my expectations and if you are looking for quality, comfort and value, then look no further, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, convenient and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here multiple times and have had enjoyable experiences every time. As indicated in other reviews, the staff truly does go the "extra mile" to insure your satisfaction. Both Inna (who lools like she she be on a magazine cover!) and Vanessa were extremely pleasant and always greeted us by name when we passed by. When my daughter asked about biscuits the next day, the breakfast host tucked her a few away and made fresh gravy for her the next morning - how nice is that? That is far and away more than one should reasonably expect from hotel staff. Believe me, happy doesn't adequately describe it! The pool was a little cold this time of year but the hot tub was very pleasant and there was always an adequate amount of pool towels - again, this attention to service is appreciated. During our stay, workers were having to tear into hallway walls to locate interior pipes to find a water leak. However, this work did not affect our sleep or our stay whatsoever. How these guys got their work done in such a quiet and non-intrusive way was absolutely amazing. The hotel location makes it ideal for Universal. One hotel guest commented that he drove his family to Universal, dropped them off, and then returned to the hotel and walked the 1 mile to the park and saved the parking cost and hassle - not a bad idea if you're up for some exercise to save some $. As far as getting to Disney, I-4 is within easy access from the hotel. If you're getting in late from the parks, the IHOP just down from the hotel is a great place to finish off the night. Although we got there a bit late to take advantage, they currently have a special in which a child eats free for a paid adult. I don't recall the start time but the special ends at 10 pm so you can likely make it if you end your day before fireworks. I always wonder about the adjacent HIlton Garden Inn but I just can't seem to break away from this Homewood - it exceeds our expectations every time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, the staff go the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: adamat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Homewood Suites nearest nearest Universal in February 2010. The hotel is situated on American Way, just off of I-Drive. From the moment we arrived the staff could not have been more helpful. This includes reception and housekeeping staff. The suites are very well appointed with a lounge / diner and a seperate bedroom, we had 2 queen size beds in ours. There are 2 TV's One in the lounge & One in the bedroom. the bathroom was spotless. Breakfast is included every morning and the managers reception (light dinner) is included Mon - Thurs. We found that this arrangement saved us a fortune on dining out every day. One morning at breakfast my partner was feeling unwell and the chief engineer went and got her some painkillers and a drink...he didnt have to, but thats what we mean by them going the extra mile. Maria who looks after the breakfasts in the morning is a very friendly lady, one morning we asked what the weather was likely to be like, within 2 minutes she had been and printed off a forecast for us. Evening meals usually consisted of things like Meatballs and subs, Stir fry , Lasagne, and lots off other tasty dishes. Reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful, no matter what time of day (or night) we approached them for information. One small tip- the rear of the hotel overlooks Universal and the evening light show can be seen from every room, however, there is a road between the hotel and universal and it can get just a little noisy. It didnt bother us in the least, but if you are a light sleeper, you may want to request a room with a pool view. We felt that this hotel was 'head and shoulders' above anything else in the area - and that includes the Four Points, just down the road. Checking in and Checking out was a smooth and painless process. If we ever decide to visit Orlando again, this hotel will be at the absolute top of our list. Well done Homewood Suites Nerarest Universal, Thanks for a great stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TigerCME
Reviews.Content: Visited Hilton Homewood Suites for a 5 night stay with my girlfriend whilst having a theme park vacation. Fantastic hotel with a great location just off International Drive, 20mins to Disney via car, 5 mins to Universal Studios or 30mins on the free shuttle bus (this was a real money saver as it costs $14 per day to park at the theme park and the shuttle picked you up direct from the hotel at 0800hrs and had you at the park for 0830hrs) the staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was spacious and clean. A buffet breakfast was on offer every morning including sausage, eggs, bacon, cereal and pancakes etc...a perfect start to the day. The Homewood also had a good sized outdoor swimming pool, outdoor jacuzzi, and fitness suite. Given that the interstate was directly to the side of the hotel it was also very quiet with virtually no traffic noise at all. All in all a great hotel and i would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Great value”
Reviews.Author: masstravelerwithkids
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel seemed to have thought of everything we'd need for a comfortable stay. The free hot breakfast was plentiful and offered a variety of foods. The room was quite spacious, comfortable and quiet. It was nice to come back to after a long day out playing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with an excellent breakfast bar at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: countdown6
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient; we visited Disney but the majority of people were visiting Universal Studios. Things that impressed us most were: Location: Shared a parking lot with Hilton Garden Inn and all amenities including a licensed restaurant and bar at the Garden Inn were available to Homewood guests. Staff: From front desk staff to cleaners, all were extremely helpful and polite Breakfast Bar: Very nice with a bit of variety. Selection was better than a lot of other similar chains of hotels especially considering it was free. Typically scrambled eggs, sausages/bacon or beef hash, potatoes, waffles or pancakes along with a variety of breads, yogurt and fruit. Make sure you are there before 8:30 though, it does get crowded then Also a complimentary light supper from Mon-Thur. Didn't work for us as it's served from 5:00-7:00 pm. Still nice, especially to keep cost down. Some of the food on menu was stirfry, turkey(Christmas Eve), hotdogs, burgers etc.. Rooms: We had a 2 room suite consisting of 2 beds and a separate living area with a sofabed, kitchenette with dishes, full size fridge, stovetop, dishwasher, and small table/chair set. Cleanliness: The hotel is only about 4 yrs old(according to front desk lady) and still relatively new looking. Everything from lobby to rooms were well maintained, neat and clean. Security: Frenquently saw security guards walking the grounds. We chose a hotel in this area to escape the craziness of Disneyworld. We are going back for Christmas again in 2010 but will stay on a resort. The only reason is because we didn't do anything but go to Disney for our holiday. We want to try both options. If we do stay off Disney another time, we'll definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family”
Reviews.Author: bbcreg
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with everything about this Homewood Suites. The front desk staff was friendly, everything was clean and well maintained, and the hotel has a fun look with tropical themes everywhere. I don't often give a 5 for a hotel because I limit that for a hotel that is exceptional and this one made the cut.

Reviews.Title: “Usual high standards from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: dundeesfinest
Reviews.Content: after just having returned from a two week holiday at this hotel i had to write to express my delight with the hotel and all staff. this hotel has had some poor reviews my husband,son and myself have nothing but praise for everyone concerned with this hotel. the rooms were spacious spotlessely clean ( maids were in everyday) and well maintaned. the managers special was varied and more than adequate as an early evening meal with wine,beer(budweiseron tap) and various fruite juices and soft drinks for the kids.the breakfasts were filling and plenty of choice for all the family including cereals,toast,pastries,fruit and cooked items.out of our two week stay only one morning was the breakfast room busy.the hotel is located just behind the sheraton four points in a quiet cul-de-sac.we could see the big rides at universal studios and universals islands of adventure from our room.nearby resturants include ihop,the black angus steakhouse,trey yuen chinese resturant,kfc and a lobster resturant.you are also only a ten minute walk from our favourite indian resturant in orlando called the passage to india. the pool area is particularly nice bathing in the sun from morning to early evening.there are plenty of tables and chairs aswell as sun loungers,gazebos,a jaccuzi (hot tub) and a large supply of fresh towels.the sports court located behind the pool area is built for basketball,tennis,badminton and there are nets up so if you want you can throw a baseball about and practice. as far as travelling goes there are i-ride and lynx bus stops located a two or three minute walk from the hotel in front of the sheraton four points and congo river golf. in finishing i would just like to say how genuinely friendly and helpful we found the staff to be during the whole of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: usxpat
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice suite. Good price, good staff. Manager's reception in the late afternoon, which was really a meal, and a good breakfast. Excellent business center.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in stay and with the hotel's unwillingness to respond to concerns.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC1
Reviews.Content: ** Before writing this review, I tried in vain to resolve my issues with both the hotel and Hilton themselves. Hilton gladly opened a dialogue with me, but stopped after they handed it off to the hotel to resolve. Unfortunately, this hotel did not even try to contact me, even at the request of Hilton, to discuss this issue. I never once asked for ANY restitution. I just wanted to ensure that no one else has to go through what we did. ** Let me begin by saying Homewood Suites is a great brand. I enjoy the cozy atmosphere and generally hassle-free experience that is inherent with the Homewood Suites image. The staff are extremely friendly and outgoing, and work hard to make your stay memorable. Unfortunately, my recent stay at the Homewood Suites Orlando (Universal Studios) was off the mark. My (pregnant) wife and I had a business trip in Gainesville via Orlando. We began our day at 4AM and caught an early flight. Through connections, we arrived in Orlando in the afternoon quite exhausted. We arrived at the Homewood Suites at appx 2:30 and were informed that the room we had booked, a king suite non-smoking, was not available. We were given the option of a double queen suite or a smoking king. Given my wife's pregnancy, and my use of a CPAP machine to sleep (would never be able to get the smoking smell out!), we could not consider a smoking room. We had no choice but to settle for the queen suite (no big deal: just one night). Not having the class of room that we booked available was disappointing, but I quickly learned that it was the least of our problems. We were quickly checked in, and given our key cards. We made our way across the hotel and brought all our luggage to the room on the 4th floor. Much to my chagrin, we discovered that both key cards did not work. I returned to the front desk to have the cards fixed and then returned to the suite. When I got back up to the room and tried the cards again, we discovered they still were not working. A friendly housekeeper swiped her card and let us into the room. When we entered, we were greeted by the stench of stale cigarette smoke. A maintenance worker came to the room to investigate the card problem and I commented on the smell of smoke. He agreed that it was "pretty bad" and that there was a definite stench in the non-smoking room. He contacted a supervisor on his phone, who told him to just run an ozone machine in the room. Thankfully, the worker reminded the supervisor that we were right there in the room and that it was unsafe to run the ozone machine. The gentleman offered us the choice of either spraying some 'chemicals' in the room to eliminate the smell or finding us a new room. Again, given my wife's pregnancy, the use of gases and chemicals were absolutely out of the question. We requested another room. We returned to the front desk. Apparently, today was "inspection day" and for whatever reason, there were now no rooms available until after 3. We said we would wait until 3 for the new rooms. We drove around for a while and when we came back, a room was ready for us. By this point, the front desk was busy and I had to personally go right behind the counter myself to retrieve my luggage that they were holding for me. We came to the new room and everything seemed fine: key cards worked and it didn't smell like cigarette smoke. There was, however, a tangible odor in the room. It wasn't until my wife went to throw something out in the kitchen that we discovered the source: the garbage was OVERFLOWING with trash from the previous occupants. (see attached photo) By now, the front desk and I were fast friends. I sat down in the desk chair, which was broken in a semi-recline position, and called the front desk. They were obviously tired of hearing from me, and I was tired of calling them. They sent Harold, the housekeeping manager, who profusely apologized and said the garbage was his fault as he had personally prepared our room for us. He further explained that the inspection had completely messed things up, and that they were trying to catch up. He said that this room's previous occupants had basically trashed it and they had been replacing fixtures and fixing things all day. Hearing how filthy the room was before we got there was a little too much information. He promptly changed the garbage for us, along with the broken desk chair in the room, and said to contact him personally if there were any other problems. While I appreciate that Harold took responsibility, to be brutally honest, we would have packed up everything and left for another property upon finding the garbage if we weren't so tired. The front desk called later in the evening to make sure everything was alright, but the damage had been done. In isolation, most of the problems we experienced were not major issues. Combined, they compounded to make our stay extremely unsatisfactory. All I wanted was to check into the room we had booked and to relax and unwind after a long day of travel. Within half an hour of arriving, I shouldn't have been on a first-name basis with the front desk, the maintenance staff and the housekeeping supervisor. Instead, we had the absolute opposite experience.. I hate complaining, but I think it is important to share our experience. We emailed our concerns on July 22nd and despite several emails from Hilton itself (who have asked us to allow the hotel to personally resolve the issue), we have yet to hear from anyone. The date of this review is Sept 1, well over a month past our stay. I would have liked to give this hotel a higher rating for service, but their unwillingness to offer a simple response to an email is terrible. Disappointing, indeed. After this stay, we stayed at the Homewood Suites Gainesville and had an EXCELLENT stay. The two experiences were absolutely night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: DUPY46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Homewood Suites for a 3 week stay and were immediately greeted by a very gracious staff. The managers Keith and Arlene were very attentive to all the guests needs. The rooms were very large and the kitchen area is a great touch. Housekeeping is very efficient and courtious. The pool area was for the most part quiet and when children were there they were behaved. The food area is very clean and the food is delicious (Thanks Rosa). If you need anything, Harold is the "go-to" person. James is a treasure and willing to do anything to help you out. All in all, our stay was very memorable and the whole staff makes you feel like we were "home". In fact, we all felt like "cousins". Stay here and enjoy hospitality at it's best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay going back next year.”
Reviews.Author: Donsrgr8
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Homewood suites, American Way,Orlando.The rate when I booked in 2008 was $129 per night.This year we have booked for March 2010 and the rate was $105 per night.Then we added the AA code(428) and were given the rate of $99 per night. The two room suite has a more than adequate kitchen,including a full size fridge/freezer and dishwasher.The bedroom had two queen beds and there are TVs in the lounge and in the bedroom.. The buffet breakfast was very good and only busy at peaktimes 0900hrs on the weekends.The managers supper Mon-Thur was also very tasty,pasta and rice dishes and free wine and beer. The location is very handy for Universal,literally two minutes drive.There is a shuttle from outside the Hilton Garden which is opposite and was never busy to Universal but was very busy on the return. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful and we were able to get a room for my sister across the corridor when she and her daughter came for a few days. There is a pool,not too big,which was never busy. There is an IHOP around the corner if you miss breakfast as well as many restaurants on IDrive..Looking forward to our return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but quite basic”
Reviews.Author: Monica004
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a trip to Florida and chose the hotel for the location close to Universal. On reflection we didn't need to be that close as we drove anyway, not close enough for us to walk in the July heat! The suites are good and a good size. We have 2 children age 11 and 8. We had 2 queen beds in the bedroom and that was fine, there is a sofa bed in the lounge if you have 3 or 4 kids. I would say though, the furnishing is basic, flat pack kind and not all that well put together. Drawers not easy to open, panels coming off that kind of thing. 2 Tvs one in lounge and one in bedroom so you don't have to fight with the kids! Breakfast and evening meal provided ( Monday to Thursday 5-7). This was one of the reasons I chose this place as I thought we would save on breakfast, we found the food ok , not great and I would give the food 5 out of 10. Pool small and we didn't use it. If you want a hotel where you can relax by a pool don't choose this one.Ok for a quick dip after theme park. All in all for the price the suites are comfortable. I would not let my children roam alone in the building as I might do in some hotels as there are multiple entrances, and seem to be a lot of people around . I would say this place is good if you have kids and are on a budget, and your trip is about going to the theme parks not the hotel. It is good but basic accomodation. I didn't have too much intraction with the staff but they were polite and helpful when i did.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: MSRuby-7
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a five night stay at the Homewood Suites nearest to Universal Studios. We are senior adults who traveled with our grandchildren, ages 13 and 9. The suites are perfect for families. We were pleasantly surprised at the suite size. The living room, full kitchen, and large bedroom with two queen beds was perfect for our purposes. The vanity area being outside the bathroom made it quite convenient for us. The hotel provides a nice hot breakfast each morning, and a light meal in the evenings on Monday - Thursday. We had breakfast at the hotel each morning, and ate two evening meals. The food was great, and the staff was quite pleasant and helpful, especially Maria who worked in the serving area. It is rare that you stay in a hotel and don't have to ask for extra bath towels or linens. They were most generous with bath towels, bath cloths, pillows and extra sheets for the sofabed. We didn't need to ask for anything during our stay. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is busy and seemed to stay full during our entire stay, but we never had difficulty finding a place to sit at breakfast, and food was plentiful. The staff does an excellent job! This is the best bargain we have ever had in Orlando, and this was our 24th visit.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonArlington
Reviews.Content: Water bugs in the bathroom (everyday), kids by the bus load, breakfast ok if you can get to it, small pool...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but awful bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: ShaynaBaby
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in this hotel about three times already when visiting WetnWild. After each time, I've decided to give it another chance and overlook certain things because of the things that it does offer. Positives are: 1. The room is a suite with a separate bedroom. That's great when travelling with family. 2. Kitchen with a full size refrigerator. Also great when traveling with family to save some money. 3. Free breakfast. Enough said. 4. Decent size pool. Negatives: 1. Every single unit I've been in has had a bathroom issue. In the first unit, the bathtub was clogged after the first shower. Maintenance had to come fix that. In the second unit, the tub faucet would not close all the way and there was a steady stream of water running all night. In the third unit, the bathroom toilet was DIRTY.
