There was urine residue around the base of the toilet. The shower curtain also smelled musty. For some, the trade-off might be worth it. But I personally am skeeved by dirty bathrooms and will probably not stay here again because of it. If you are someone who can overlook that, then this hotel will be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Bell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood near Universal six nights, together with my wife and two sons. The location is great, near Universal, short way to Sea World, not to long from Disney and close to Prime Outlets. It's hard to get better value for your money in Orlando ($ 129 / night). The suite had all that we needed and the breakfast was exelent from american hotel standards (wich are way below norwegian). The pool ar great for kids, but a bit on the small side for adults who wants to swim as an exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAtraveller3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect. Clean and Neat comfortable size. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which has a small kitchenette with full size fridge, 2 plate stove and microwave and dishwasher.They also provide coffeemaker with complimentary coffee and tea however they did not readily replace these you have to ask. Seperate bedroom with large vanity, sink and bathroom. Drive in access from Universal boulevard and International drive. Staff were very friendly but Not too forthcoming.We enquired about a supermarket to get some groceries and were told it was a 10minute walk with vague directions. After wandering around for almost an hour we hopped on the trolley bus which picks you up outside the hotel and drops you off outside the Publix supermarket - cud of spared our feet by telling us this when we asked them.Breakfast was very good and had nice variety.Pool area very nice.Free shuttle to Universal but no shuttle to Disney.Trolley bus service stop is at back of hotel on International Drive which is perfect for if you sight-seeing and shopping around Orlando - stops at 2 big outlet malls and convention center.Free wifi is bonus.Free parking.housekeeping is a bit lax over the weekend

Reviews.Title: “Kids first time at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Travelfamily490
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families. This was our kids first time to Florida and the hotel was perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. when we arrived we had just missed the Manager Reception and they put out enough for us to serve our family. Our kids were 6 & 8 and we loved the hotel. My son is very picky and managed to find something he like everyday for the free breakfast. The room was spacious and clean. There were plenty of clean white like new towels. Our room was facing the parking lot and I did not hear any noise. The pool was never crowed and the water was clean. The hot tub was small but still comfortable and a treat after the parks. Great location close to Universal and Sea World. Even close to a Walmart and a Dollar Tree. Picked up plastic raincoats and bought snacks for the kids. We're going again this June and will stay at the new Homewood Suites Lake Buena Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let first impressions fool you - this is a good hotel for Universal.”
Reviews.Author: geisnj
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights over Easter there. We had 4 people in the suite. Suites were smaller than other suite hotels we have stayed in and at first the area where hotel was located appeared questionable. Construction and a large vacant lot were the reasons. Mears transportation even had trouble finding it. However, the positives greatly outweighed the negatives. Any problems we had in the suite were quickly alleviated by the extremely friendly front desk. There was a free full breakfast every morning. We especially liked the freedom to be able to walk to Universal since it is only a mile from the hotel. An easy walk for any fit family. Besides the walking, there was free shuttle service to and from the park. When we returned each day from the park, the pool area was very nice with plenty of chairs and cabanas around. Again, after spending a day or two, the hotel worked out very well for a Universal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jtm123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites from April 4-10. The room was nice (easily slept 5). The kitchen was small, but met our needs. Breakfast & manager's reception were well stocked and had a decent variety of items. The location of the hotel was about 5 minutes from Universal Studios, 10 minutes from Sea World, and about 20 minutes from Disney. The pool was not extremely large, but was not very crowded. The parking lot seemed to fill up in the evening. The business center always had kids in it playing online games on the computers. We got a great AAA rate at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal- but smelly”
Reviews.Author: nannya
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this property. The rate was decent for what we received=a one bedroom suite with two double beds. The kitchen is small, with a standard fridge, dishwasher and microwave, and two electric burne rs- no oven. The breakfast buffet was consistent and adequate, and the evening offerings- lasagna, deli meats etc were enough to keep us from having to eat out. We found the location to be noisy- very close to Rt 4. The surrounding area of International drive is not attractive, over developed and filled with 'bargain land' type places with not much to offer at grossly inflated prices. If you want to eat anywhere but chain restaurants, there is not much nearby. There are some places that call themselves 'supermarkets' but they are high priced convenience stores. Our biggest complaint with this property was that while we requested a non smoking room, and the room was labeled as non smoking the odor that hit us when we opened the door was over powering. The carpet was burn marked, as were the counters and the bathroom reeked. Cleaning was superficial, with splash marks on the bathroom walls and poorly covered marks on the walls of the other rooms. Wireless internet was free but shut itself off every 24 hours, with lots of freezing and hanging issues which made work difficult. All in all, a great concept for a hotel, with some annoying issues.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: vwsunny
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself checked in to this Hotel because another Hotel we were placed in origianally was terrible. To say the staff at the Homewood suites were amazing was an understatement. They were kind and helpful in every way. We checked in early in the morning as we had left our other Hotel very quick. They made sure we settled in then made sure we went for breakfast, which was lovely. Nothing was to much trouble. It is a lovely Hotel, large rooms, every thing you would need in a kitchen,( if you wanted to be self-catering) and spotless in always. Lovely pool area with towels supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nirvanaqween
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights, with 4 people. This hotel is stunning! It does not need a long review because it's that nice. The room was super clean, and comfortable. The staff was amazing, and the free breakfast was fantastic. There is a free shuttle to and from Universal/Islands of Adventure a few feet from the property, and also an on property bar.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, would go back tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: charliecatsmail
Reviews.Content: Although the room we booked was not available on check in, the staff were very accommodating and switched us as soon as possible. The rooms are big enough for 4 and the kitchen is well equipped. Breakfast was good and plenty of choice. Evening meals were a mixed bag- but what do you expect for nothing. Loved the spaghetti and meatballs, gagged on the pizza pockets. Did laundry and found the machines in good order and cheap to use compared with some hotels. Pool a good size. Staff really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Glad This Was Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: ny2tx2ga
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, we were very happy that this hotel was the choice for our Orlando vacation. The staff, the suite, the complimentary breakfasts, the complimentary shuttle to Universal - all combined to make this a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: ladamo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful Thanksgiving week stay at the Homewood Suites, Universal. I traveled with my husband and mother-in-law. We checked in without any fuss and found the suite in good order. However, the sliding closet door was hard to close or open, so we reported the problem right away and the maintenance man came right away and fixed it. Aside from that, we had no further problems. The desk and dining room staff were stellar, especially Maria in the dining room. The food was good and some items were rotated daily (eg., hard boiled eggs, home fries, bacon, etc.). Other items were available daily (e.g., scrambled eggs, sausage, cereals, breads, etc.). John from the Hilton Garden Hotel paid us a visit almost daily to see if we needed tickets and speed passes to the park (we did buy a day's worth of speed passes). He was most helpful. On Thanksgiving Day, the Hilton and Homewood Suites had a Thanksgiving dinner (Hilton for $15 each and the Homewood Suites' dinner was very basic, but free). Mom wanted to go to a fancy restaurant on City Walk at Universal. We won't mention the name of the restaurant, but we would've liked the dinners at the Hilton or Homewood Suites better and the Hilton's dinner would've been a fraction of the cost of the place we dined at. Oh well, next time. There was a free shuttle to the parks which we took advantage of more than half the time. The rest of the time, we took cabs which were about $6.00-$8.00 a ride. You can walk too, but we elected not to do so. The cost of the hotel was very reasonable. We got in via the Senior rate. I would say this hotel beats time share all the way with free breakfast to boot. Stay here and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chezza9
Reviews.Content: We stopped at Homewood Suites for 14 nights from late October and have to say the hotel is absolutely first class. The rooms are massive with a kitchen area, living area and large bedroom (and two large TV's with great channels for all). Breakfast was more than adequate and was a nice start to the day. At this time of year the dining area was nice and quiet, however i guess it could get busy in the main school holidays. The staff were incredibly friendly, it was impossible to pass reception without a friendly chat with the staff. Maria in the dining area was also first class as was John, the Universal Rep', who was always on hand with advice regarding Universal at breakfast time. The free bus to Sea World and Universal were well worth using. As for the weather (i struggled to find much info' on the weather when planning this holiday), it was varied. We had 2 days of rain, most days in the 70's and sunny and a couple of days in the 80's and very sunny. A couple of days it was in the mid 60's which the locals did not like, however the queues at the parks on these days were non existent. In summary, if you are going in October for the sun you may want to re-think, however we found the weather perfect for visiting Disney/Universal and went to the water parks on the hot sunny days. Just need to get my TCD money back off ATOL and it will have been a perfect holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay EXCEPT...”
Reviews.Author: jessigrl26
Reviews.Content: Everything about the room and the stay was good except when we came back to the room there were little ants covering the counters. The next morning they were gone but we couldnt leave any food or anything open on the counters.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lou9477
Reviews.Content: This by far is one of the best hotels my husband and i have stayed in. The rooms were a great size with 2 queen size bed, which were supererb. really comfortable. You also have a seperate living area and a kitchen area. It makes a difference than from being in a hotel room which is just 2 beds and a toilet. Rooms are cleaned every day and we had no problems with the service they provided. You get a complimentary breakfast in the morning which was great. You get cereal, fruit, yoghurts, bacon .eggs, toast, also donoughts, pastries, tea, coffee and juice. You can also make your own waffles (Mon-Fri) which we did almost every morning. Sat and Sun they make pancakes. On a Mon-Thur from 5-7pm you get a choice of different things for dinner, there is also snacks and a salad bar and you get beer and wine. This is complimentary too. The hotel is on a quite part of International Drive(across from wet and wild just behind the Sheraton four points hotel) but close enough to walk to all the shops etc. Would definately recommend this hotel, and if we are back in florida next year we will definately be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with homewood suites universal orlando”
Reviews.Author: Pat064
Reviews.Content: well worth the price. very clean and spacious. Very Quiet and an excellant choice for breakfast. Clean towels every day and the beds made.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: magscork
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor I was prepared for the worst. I approached the reception staff with a smile and got a very friendly service in return! We booked a suite for 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The bedroom was fantastic - two very generous double beds. And the pull-out couch was excellent. We didn't use the kitchen so I can't comment, but it looked quite adequate. We were all very pleased with the comfort of the beds. Our room was No. 202 which was wheelchair friendly, and our bathroom was huge! The towels were beautifully arranged:) We noticed that we only had shampoo etc for one guest, but when I asked for extra suppiles there was no problem, they were sent up before we arrived back after our night at the park. Shuttle service to Universal is only in the mornings. We were hoping for a night shuffle, but the reception called us a taxi which arrived within 15 min and cost $8 to Universal. Breakfast was basic, but there was no shortage of food! There was a gentleman who seemed to be at our disposal for information regarding anything we wanted to know. Our 17 yr-old son was delighted with the gym and our 18 yr old managed to get internet access (there are only 2 computers available). People who have complained about thieving at the hotel may be interested to know that the side door to the carpark can be left ajar by guests while they run out ot their cars. It's up to hotel guests to protect the security of all by making sure that that door is securely closed. I would have no hesitation in recomending this hotel! We did have a problem finding the hotel - it seemed that there were 2 entrances to Amereican Way, but as we missed the first one we had to navigate our way back. That took almost half an hour!! Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel for families! Mags

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Expect From Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shamrockConnecticut
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in the middle of June after staying on property at Universals Portofino Bay Hotel.My overall impression was this hotel was very below average and I have no idea how this property is rated so highly on tripadvisor ,which is why I booked this hotel in the firstplace at a very inexpensive rate. Upon arriving and entering our 2 room suite the beds where very warn and the room at best adequate.These beds had no support and a terrible comfort level. I tried another room with the same results so we just settled in and decided to make the best of it for a short stay as we wouldn't be in the room that much.The furnishings were also very drab with a view of the highway. The pool is very small so we used the much nicer one across the street at the Hilton Garden Inn.The buffet food was very unappealing to us so we didn't partake in it and it looked rough . Interestingly across the street at the Hilton Garden Inn the breakfast was made to order and served in a much nicer environment in the restaurant .The final negative was that the morning we went to check out we found dirty towels and somebody elses bathing suit under other towels on our towel rack. Housekeeping left a little to be desired. The positives are that the front desk employees were very nice and the Manager did take off one nights stay for the laundry incident. I used to manage hotels so I understand that sometimes these things happen even at the top flight properties. My question is how is it that the Garden Inn across the street is rated in the 70s on Trip Advisor and this hotel is top 20?It is clear that the other property is a much better hotel. Bottom line is if you are very budget conscious you may get a great rate at this hotel but bottom line is you get what you pay for!!! If you pay over $99 a night at this hotel you are paying too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: pcbgirl0806
Reviews.Content: The three of us (two adults and a teenager) stayed at the Homewood Suites just after the 4th of July. We were surprised to find there was construction out front for a new wing, but it didn't impact our stay (with the small exception that the driveway was blocked on one end). The room was somewhat smaller that other Homewoods I've stayed at, but we got a great rate online as a Hilton Hhonors Gold member. The free breakfast and evening happy hours, again, were not as good as other Homewoods, but it was nice to have the option to use either their pool or the one across the parking lot at the Hilton Garden Inn (note: there are pool towels between the pool and hot tub in the wooden closet on the deck). The teen was quite pleased with the pullout sofa...it was more of a hammock style, without the bar in the middle. We left a few dollars for a tip for housekeeping daily and were rewarded with clean dishes daily and adorable towel figures. We weren't impressed, however, with Universal Studios (except the Twister show) and decided to go to the Magic Kingdom, which is about a 30 minute drive away (a bit far). Because of our dissatisfaction with Universal, we are unlikely to stay here again, but it's a great, value-added option. We enjoyed our stay. p.s. If you have an even-numbered room, you will hear the freeway noise but can see fireworks from Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Come Any Better Than Homewood”
Reviews.Author: N_irelandJojo
Reviews.Content: as someone who holidays in orlando every year, i would like to think i knew quite a bit about where to stay. Needing a place to stay for a couple of nights before going to a villa i read previous reviews and plumped for the homewood suites at universal studios. Thanks to trip advisor i was not dissapointed. The rooms were clean and spacious and even the sofabed was comfy. the managers reception at nights was great and the breakfasts every morning are terrific--my kids got to make their own waffles! a fun experience even if they do taste vile. Breeakfast was never the same and always more than enough to set everyone up for the day. think of the money and especially TIME saved in nipping downstairs with no bill to pick up after!!! the pool was lovely (not petty enough to let a bit of work annoy me) and loads of pool towels and seats-even cabanas! the drinks machine was in use all day by everyone which was great but maybe not supposed to be ! the only downpoint was the lift-only one in building so was a bit slow but hardly worth mentioning. anyone going to orlando should seriously think about staying here--or at any HOMEWOOD SUITES. we did a bit of travelling and found homewood suites kinda dictated our route YES, THEYRE THAT GOOD

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at the Homewood Suites Universal”
Reviews.Author: Tynesidetraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family (5 of us) for two weeks in August 2007. Had previously stayed at The Crowne Plaza Universal and Residance Inn Seaworld. Decided to stay at the Homewood due to the good feedback and high ranking on Trip Advisor. On the whole, we had no complaints with the Hotel. Room was comfortable and fairly spacious and the breakfast was ok, if not somewhat repetitve. Pool is average size and no problem getting sunbeds etc as there were not many users of the pool when we were there. Staff were polite and friendly. My only comment would be that this is an above average Hotel and I am struggling to see how it ranks as highly as it does compared with some other hotels. For example, of the three hotels I have stayed in I would rank this in a close third place (prefer Residance Inn). We paid £820 through Hotelopia which I think is good value. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to Like It More”
Reviews.Author: Jakuch
Reviews.Content: We get in a plane. The plane lands in Orlando with us still in it. Goal #1 achieved. We planned to take the Lynx bus #42 to the Homewood Suites hotel for $1.50/each but the plane was late and we wanted to get in that pool so… taxi it is and $47 later we are at the Homewood Suites [HS] Nearest Universal. Check-in is pleasant and we have a view of the pool plus a vast dustbowl or mud pit depending on the weather. We learn later that HS is building another wing to the hotel with 2-bedroom suites on top of the dustbowl. We get to the pool, which is okay but a little small and somewhat crowded. Not to worry, the Hilton Garden Inn across the parking lot has a LOVELY pool with tropical landscaping and a tikki bar and the HS encourages you to use their facilities. So we do. Ahhhhh. Monday-Thursday at Homewood’s a light dinner and cocktail hour is served included in the room rate. What gets plunked down into the warming pans tonight? Why, it’s Sloppy Joes, rice, rice pudding (I am not kidding, rice for side dish and dessert) and salad sans tomatoes. The two wines are Red and Pink (no white, but the server says strangely that it’s WHITE Zinfindel). The beer is Bud lite. In case you don’t know, each Homewood Suites (under the Hilton Hotels collection) is independently owned, operated, and must meet minimum standards. Our favorite, in downtown Chicago, sports high end furnishings, comfy beds and high quality food & drink offerings and a somewhat indifferent staff. This HS has a very friendly front desk staff, but an almost surly serving staff. The breakfasts are better, but we are not choosy breakfast eaters. Give me an English muffin and some O.J. and all’s well. One morning though, a pan of French Toast sticks was sooo soggy and yucky looking the natives revolted and the “sticks” were taken hurriedly back for some more prep work. I am loathe to give a less than four-circle review, but I have to dip down to three for this one. The rooms are average for Homewood Suites. We like the kitchen and two rooms. With a mom, dad and two teens, it's a good way to go. The pull out sofabed was among the more uncomfortable I've slept in, though. All in all, it was an okay place to stay, but I am grading them compared to other Homewood Suites we have stayed in as Hilton Honors members. Others who experience this kind of hotel for the first time may have a better impression.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: camilleris
Reviews.Content: Homewood suites is so convenient for Universal, International Drive and shops. The rooms are spacious, with 2 TV's, which was great when the kids wanted to watch something different. You have a lot of towels in the room which are replaced everyday, and also there are pool towels. Everything was clean and you had fridge/freezer, ironing board, and cooker, hairdryer and microwave. All staff were great and helpful. The pool was small but quiet and never overcrowded, you can use the pool in the Hilton opposite as well. The Breakfasts were ok, but a bit too much of the same thing every day, we would have this on theme park days, but go to Denny's or Ponderosa's other days for a bit more variety. Only went to dinner once, it was ok not much on offer. They have a games room and a computer room, and a basketball court. I would definately stay here again, I have stayed in a lot of hotels on international drive, but this was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bec060874
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights using Hilton points. The room was quite nice - neat little kitchen area complete with everything you needed to stay for long periods. The living area was comfortable and the bedroom area was quite large. Bathroom was just right, as well. They offer a free breakfast which was decent (had everything you needed to start the day). We didn't get to experience the weeknight dinner because we stayed over a weekend but saw that there was quite a selection of food available on an info sheet in our room. Only thing I noticed was that housekeeping seemed a little slow. We went back to the room at 2pm and the room hadn't been touched. But when we arrived later it was cleaned. They did not leave any new coffee, though, for the coffee maker. Staff was nice, property was clean and very convenient to Wet n Wild and Universal (as well as a ton of other stuff on International Drive). Seemed like a great place for families!! I like staying at Hilton properties because you always know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Katpol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May, 2008. We had a very pleasant trip - the hotel was clean, and a good value for a suite. There was a hot breakfast, but the food was not very good. Close to International Dr, but a little removed so it wasn't too crowded or loud. Pretty centrally located as to amusement parks. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: echo64
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Homewood Suites for 6 nights. The reception staff were very friendly & welcoming. Our room was facing the main highway and although there was some noise it did not bother us too much. The suites were a good size with a living/kitchen area and a separate sleeping area with bathroom. All was very clean with fresh towels supplied daily. There is a free security deposit box available at reception if required. We enjoyed the free breakfast and also for 4 evenings, there was complimentary hot buffet available if you wanted a snack after a long day at the parks. Pool area is ok although you can use the pool at the adjacent Hilton Garden Inn across the car park. We did and found this better as it had more shade & a drinks bar. We enjoyed the Homewood Suites. It is a great value for money hotel. From experience though comes a word of caution. Be alert if you are walking down American Way to & from the hotel. There are some unfriendly people driving around the area from time to time. Enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: MnmsUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites on American Way for 6 nights from the 27th March. We chose the hotel because it was a 2-room suite, with the 2-queen bed room separated from the sitting and kitchenette area, it was near Universal / Wet and Wild and it had very good reviews on Trip Advisor. We were pleased with our choice although the breakfasts became rather repetitive. There are many good things about this hotel. The pool and hot tub were good sizes and never got very crowded, despite the hotel being full. The rooms were pleasant and had good kitchen facilities. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and the morning shuttle bus to Universal, Sea World etc was very convenient and swift. The worst thing about the hotel was the lift. Although there were two lifts only one was convenient for 80% of the rooms and was busy and usually frustratingly slow in arriving. Despite being on the 5th floor (the top floor) we chose to walk down the 64 steps rather than wait for the lift after the first couple of days – and frequently walked up too. This would not be an option for some people. We were put on a smoking floor although we’d asked for non-smoking but the staff were very good and fumigated the room twice for us to ensure it was acceptable. We were dismayed on arrival to find a huge and unexpected building site next door to the hotel. However this gave us no problems (very liitle work was carried out during our stay) and it meant that there was a very open view from our rooms. The internet room in the foyer was very useful. Coffee was available from a machine in the foyer 24/7. The managers evening “welcome” from 5 – 7 pm Mon – Thurs was useful when we returned tired and hungry from theme parks. Wet and wild was within a 5 minute walk from the hotel (which we rated higher than Aquatica), and Universal was about 25 minutes walk. Taking the shuttle bus to Universal / Islands of Adventure (10 minutes in the bus) and then getting a taxi back ($6) was very successful for us. The shuttle bus to Sea World / Aquatica / Discovery Cove was equally successful (only around 20 mins maximum) but we then took the I-trolley back to the hotel (rather than wait for the shuttle at around 6pm) which took us over an hour – a long ride when you’re tired! We weren’t very ambitious in our meals. Denny’s Diner was a big hit (especially the take-away banana splits!) and we enjoyed a meal at the friendly Red Lobster, both were only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel was close to Prime Outlets, which was great and we had a couple of shopping trips. We were pleased with our hotel choice and paid £89 per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Homewood suites are a bargain!!!”
Reviews.Author: pennymang
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Orlando Universal. We arrived on April 9 and stayed through April 13. Check-in was at 4pm but we arrived around 11a.m and were told a room would be available in 1 hour. The front desk clerk suggested we catch the free shuttle to the park instead of waiting in the lobby. Great idea!! The shuttles provided convenient ,quick,safe transportation several times per day to all the parks in the area. We typically pay cash for all our hotel rooms which proved to be somewhat of a problem initially. Plus the hotel wanted extra for incidentals!! We worked out the kinks and headed to our room. The suites have a great kitchen with full sized fridge, a pull out full sized sofa bed and a seperate room with 2 queen beds. All bedding was fresh and soft , all towels were clean,soft and white!! Housekeeping was available everyday to tidy up. We ate the free hot breakfast every morning. There were heaping piles of bacon,toast,bagels,fruit,cereal,waffles,eggs...endless supply of juice,soda or milk. We didn't eat the free dinner because the kids wanted to eat out, but it looked pretty good to me.The hotel is located off a quiet side street but is close enough to International Drive. We had no problems locating the site right off I-4. By the way, our room faced the highway and it didn't bother us at all!! Of course there were a few problems. The t.v. picture tube kept going in and out. We complained twice and finally got a new set. Parking is shared with the Hilton Garden next door so there were times late in the evening when parking was scarce. The shuttles leaving CityWalk at night weren't as reliable as the daytime shuttles. The last night, we waited almost 2 hours for a return shuttle. Beware, people drink alot down there and the heat adds to the frustration. The shuttle rides may get a little rowdy at night. I can't wait to go back!! As we traveled on the shuttles I was able to see the other hotel choices. I was never disappointed in my decision to stay at the Homewood near Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Decided to give it another chance”
Reviews.Author: 808Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for Spring Break and had a reasonably nice time, with the exception of food freeloading guests from neighboring Super 8 and Motel 6. I'm happy to say that I did not witness that again the second time around. They did, however, have Hilton Garden Inn guests eating breakfasts and evening meals. But since it is considered their sister property, and H.S. guests are invited to attend their Tiki Bar, I guess they must have some sort of arrangment. It still does add to the lack of seating/crowds at mealtimes. I was a little disappointed to arrive and see the whole area in front of the hotel streetside under construction. There was no indication when I made the reservation on the hotel website stating this. There is a sign upon check in asking to "pardon their dust" as they expand the hotel. It seems to be a popular place and expansion is definitely a good idea. We had a room facing the pool (hence, facing the construction). To my pleasant surprise, there was no construction noise at all. The living area was a little smaller in this room, but it was still nicely decorated and clean. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast and evening receptions were nice with food readily replenished. However, seating is at a premium, so it's best to get there early. We had a nice stay this Spring Break. Considering that we also stayed free with our Hilton Points, it was a really nice stay :) The location is nice if you're going to Universal. There was free transportation, but we opted to drive ourselves. We liked not having to pay for our breakfasts and dinners since we stayed during the week, and we liked that the pool area was spacious. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: themanfromsudan
Reviews.Content: I chose the Homewood Suites based on the reviews from this web site and their own web site which shows a floor plan of the rooms. We wanted a suite because I’m an early riser and my wife needs her sleep, these suites fit the bill perfectly. I had booked a king suite when I made the reservation, then confirmed it a few weeks prior to arrival, but upon arrival we were told only double queen suites were available. We were not happy about this arrangement but felt we had no choice but to accept. We were able to arrange to change to the first king suite that came available, this went surprisingly painlessly and within a couple of days we were in our king suite. The rooms are well used but in good condition, we found no maintenance related problems with our room. Our bedroom was right beside the elevator so we were concerned about that, but not once did we hear the elevator operating. The rooms have very good sound proofing on either side and up and down but noise from outside and the hallway was quite obvious. We often cook for ourselves while vacationing, the kitchen of our unit was very well suited and equipped for this, and the full size dishwasher and fridge were a real bonus. The housekeeping staff were friendly and polite. We stayed for a total of 16 nights and we found the front desk staff to be helpful and polite as well. The location of the hotel was not an issue to us, there are several transportation options available, so getting around was not a problem. We were very pleased with this hotel and would consider staying here or at another Homewood Suites in the future.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed in Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Wilross3
Reviews.Content: Can't figure out how this place was rated so highly on TripAdvisor. Our opinion was that it is an average at best hotel, and at the bottom of the barrel compared to other Homewood Suites we've stayed in. HS usually has left us feeling great about our stay - see my San Diego review. This place is reasonably convenient - we visited Disney and Universal, and the front desk was helpful with printed directions to everywhere we needed. There was a problem at our check in with how many nights the hotel had a room available. The staff discussed this in Spanish, which I thought was prety rude to begin with, so we started out on the wrong foot. Cleanliness - average. We had a big wad of chewing gum ground into the carpeting in the living room, and the spare blanket for the fold-out bed had stains. If you stay here, request a room away from the highway - very, very noticable traffic noise all night long. Breakfast was ok, not the usual assortment we've had at other Homewood Suites, but we all ate fine. I do like the breakfast option at HS. Overall we left unimpressed. I will still stay at Homewood Suites, but wouldn't stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect - best hotel for family !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Quebecfamily
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at this hotel in early december. Everything was perfect. The staff was nice and helpful. We appreciated the morning hot breakfast, with 3 childrens we saved a lot of $$$. We also tried the happy hour lunch and drinks for 5 nights. Mom and Dad appreciated the complimentary wine! Again we saved $$$. The room is very large. We also loved the wet and wild water park across the street. We spent a few afternoons there after a morning at Disney taking a rest before the night shift at Disney again. I read a lot of reviews of a lot of hotel before choosing this one. I would say don't read anymore just get there in confidence IT'S PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoOnATrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at this hotel over the Christmas holidays, along with our teenaged son and our adult daughter. The suite was quite spacious, and having two queen beds plus a sofabed made it possible for all of us to share one room rather than booking two rooms at another hotel. The sitting area was comfortable for relaxing at the end of the day. We also utilized this area when we opened Christmas gifts. Although we did not cook while we were there, the refrigerator was great for storing drinks and snacks. The bathroom sink and vanity was separate from the rest of the bathroom which was helpful when four of us were preparing to leave in the morning, and the doors between the bedroom and living area provided plenty of privacy for us to change clothes. The hot breakfast each morning saved both money and time. The menu varied, but there was always sausage or bacon, scrambled eggs, toast, bagels, juice, and cereal. In addition, some mornings there were pancakes or Belgian waffles, donuts, and muffins. The breakfast area in the lobby was quite large, but when necessary, the staff opened an adjacent meeting room so that everyone could sit down. We only returned from the parks early enough to have a light dinner there one evening, but it was quite nice. They served a salad, chicken gumbo, chips and salsa, and rice pudding. The menu for the evening meals was posted on the refrigerator in our room. The pool and hot tub area were clean and well-maintained. We used one of the computers in the business center to book tickets to Blue Man Group. Although there were renovations in progress, we were never disturbed by noise. The location of the hotel is quite convenient to Universal Studios and Sea World. It took us about 20 minutes in the morning to get to Disney World. The only real problems that we encountered were that the route to reach I-4 to go to Disney World was rather convoluted and the traffic on International Drive was often gridlocked. However, we would still stay at his hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: daisy20071960
Reviews.Content: I used trip advisor before I booked this stay, I am glad that I did, the infomation that you all left was helpful. The hotel is nice for a family vacation, as it has two seperate rooms (the more space the better, when with the family)! I must say that I have stayed at other Homewood Suites, and all of them have had larger suites than this hotel. Tips that I have to offer are as follows: Eat a big free breakfast to hold you over before heading out (I think this is worth about 30 bucks for a family of 4). Treat the family to a nice, healthy lunch during the day, and use the "managers reception" food from 5-7 Monday-Thursday as a hold over before bedtime. I travel a lot for my job, and do not like eating out every meal. It was nice to have the option of cooking a healthy meal for my family, and did so a couple of nights. Another tip that I have to offer is that in the same parking lot, Hilton owns another property, a Hilton Garden Inn. The pool and hot tub are much nicer there, and they have bar service and food service at the pool (unlike the Homewood). Because both properties are owned by Hilton, they make it clear that as a guest of Homewood, you are welcome to use the other Hilton pools and guest services, take advantage of it. At a rate of 114.00 per night, with two meals included for the 4 of us, I think that this hotel was a STEAL, please book with confidence. You might want to request a pool view room, as a busy highway is on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MAP12
Reviews.Content: Great location for Universal Studios and Wet & Wild. They mention a shuttle to Universal, but it only runs a few times a day. We were told it was about a 20 minute walk, but we drove anyway. Wet & Wild is right across (busy) street. The rooms are great. One bedroom (2 double beds), TV and enough room to walk around comfortably. Toilet/tub separate from sink and mirror, so easy for group to get ready at same time. Separate room with desk, TV, recliner and sofabed - attached to nice kitchen. Full sized refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher, sink with disposer, table and 4 chairs, 4 sets of dishes, a few pans, etc. This was VERY comfortable for the 5 of us. Staff was helpful and cheerful. Pool was outdoor and not heated (during a cold snap - we didn't use it). Breakfast was the best I've ever seen at a complimentary breakfast hotel - eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, donuts, rolls, bagels, biscuits and gravy, fresh fruit, coffee, tea and 3 kinds of juice. We weren't back to the hotel in time to take part in any of the evening activities or food offerings. I will definitely keep this place in mind for our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: wolfden
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on all the excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a bit hard to find due to a couple of reasons. There is very poor road signs and it's not on a main road . This can actually work to your advantage if you do not like the traffic. Our check in and check out were flawless. The hotel staff were all very pleasant. Our room (King Suite) was enormous and very clean. The kitchen in the room had everything you could require and came with a full size refrigerator. The bathroom was massive with twin sinks. The breakfast was your standard "buffet" food....nothing special, but it was free. We used the free internet in the lobby several times and it was very convenient. They also have a gym and games room, plus an outdoor pool which we did not use. The hotel is literally 3 minutes by car to the gates of Universal studios. You could probably walk there in 10 minutes. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Portugal100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 9th to 19th December with my husband and 7 year old son. Were here for 5 nights last December also. As before we found the rooms were great. Loads of room and the most comfortable beds you could ask for. The breakfast was great and we made the Managers reception a few times and the food was more than enough to save you having to go out for dinner after a busy day at the parks. All the staff were great. Only downside is that is a bit of a journey to Disney. Our holiday was 3 weeks in total and because we loved it here so much last year we decided to stay here for the first part of our trip whilst we hit the parks. Great for Universal but you definitely have to have a car for Disney. Saying that, you soon forgot about the drive once you were back in your nice room. My son swam every day except one when the temp dropped to 60 degrees. The second part of our trip was at Disney Saratoga Springs where we spent 8 nights. Also given that 5 stars but then we did pay more than double. Homewood cost us $104 a night booking direct with Hilton. Was also able to get one night free using points. All in all a great stay, just wish they were located at Lake Beuna Vista instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: belle3
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel~ it is not frilly, but you get a great value for the money! They offered all guests a complimentary full breakfast's each and every morning! Besides that, each evening Monday -Thursday, they offered a main course dinner with salad, including free beverages for 2 hours! What a wonderful perk! We all were full after each meal. We spent no money on food at all Monday-Thursday because of this added benefit! The pool was large, but outside, so if the weather wasn't cooperative and warm enough to swim, you wouldn't use it! Same for the hot tub. The hot tub, is a 6-8 person model. I would definately go back and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pt25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early Nov and have no serious complaints. Great rooms, helpful staff, good breakfast included. Only negative issues were some staining on the room furniture and the lack of a bar though you can use the tiki bar outside the hotel opposite (if weather allows). Pool is quite small but quiet whilst we were there so no problem. Hilton are currently expanding this hotel so expect building work for some time. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to LIVE”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: In a land of plentiful cheap hotels, Homewood Suites - Universal is worth every bit of the extra $100 or so you will spend here for a room. The raves are justified; clean, beautiful rooms, helpful staff, great location (minutes to shops / resorts). The rooms are super nice, nice enough to live in, not just stay at for a vacation. The breakfast was good (including a waffle maker with hot syrup). There is a wine / beer hour between 5-7 Mon-Thu with a little bit of food. It's good for a drink before dinner; the food was nothing to write about. The amenities are nice, but not spectacular (small pool, small gym, the WiFi wasn't so great in our room). Still, the rooms outshine any potential deficiencies, and I would stay there again. There are some nice restaurants nearby. Try Pio Pio, right around the corner. It's the same as the NY chain, and just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Really Is Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: kriswilli
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at Homewood Suites and loved it! Very comfortable, quiet, clean, spacious suites. We stayed one night at Royal Pacific Resort and actually preferred Homewood. The free breakfast was a great way to start the day! The light weeknight meal was a money saver and we enjoyed free computer access in the business center. The location away from International Drive is a definite plus. Our room faced the freeway but we never heard any traffic and had a great view of Universal Resort. I would highly recommend this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not as good as Homewood on I.Drive.”
Reviews.Author: sassysassy
Reviews.Content: We arrived 2 October in the pouring rain and dark mood to suit the atmosphere. After being given a room on the second floor and what seemed like a mile long corridor we arrived at our room for three weeks. Nice and O.K until we realised that we didn't have a safe in the room[ none of the rooms have them!] On the way to Orlando we had heard stories of theft and burglaries in the area and naturally felt nervous leaving valuables in the room. We went downstairs to put our valuables in the front desk safes only to be told that there was none available until someone checked out and to ask every day, which we did. Ten days later and still no safe, the receptionist suggested that we could use the Hilton Garden deposit safe next door. It was a bit of hassle each morning crossing the car park before going out but hey ! Swimming pool- Bad luck for us as we couldn't relax by the pool and cool off as the pool was closed for a week for maintainance. We were told that we could use the Hilton Garden's pool anytime. Hilton Garden pool was nice and spacious but crossing that car park all the time from the Homewood Suites to the HG made us feel we had booked the wrong hotel ! Towards the middle of the three weeks, we began to spend most of our time at the Hilton Garden [when we weren't at the parks etc!] We loved the tikki bar and oversized jaccuzzi! Oh yes, back to Homewood Suites! The suite itself was rather nice- large bedroom and seperate living-room-kitchenette. It was clean. The 'free' breakfast was rather basic and 'cooked' breakfast really meant for non-vegetarians-sausage, bacon etc and was not cooked on the premesise but warmed up there as I seen it arriving on a trolley early one morning !. After making a snack one evening,I cut myself quite badly on the door of the dishwasher. And to be fair maintainence repaired it quickly. Because the Hilton Garden also served evening meal, we tended to stay there after getting back from the parks etc. So in effect we have little to say about the Homewood Suites really. The beds were comfortable but the shiny cover kept slipping of the bed during the night. The staff were not as helpful as the homewood Suites I.Drive. Homewood Universal's receptionists were rather loud and giggly and seemed to want to crack jokes together. Don't think we would stay there again. It wasn't horrendous but Hilton Garden was nicer as was Homewood Suites I.Drive.

Reviews.Title: “20 out of 10!!!”
Reviews.Author: bell51
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from orlando and stayed at this hotel, I can honestly say that it was the bees knees!!!, it was v.clean, the staff were a.1. the breakfast and light dinner were excellent and saved us a whole lot of money on our 10 night stay. The accomodation was first class, seperate bedroom, kitchenette and a huge bathroom. I particularly liked the seperate front room, as I am an early riser I could go and make a cup of tea without disturbing anyone else!! if there WAS a downside, it was the distance to International Drive, although only a 5/10min walk, because of the intense heat, and not being able to walk great distances, I did find it a bit much, but nothing that taking it slowly I could'nt overcome. I would definately recommend this hotel without reservation. The free computer room was a bonus as we could check out places to visit, and prices etc. as non drivers we found the best bargins were multiple trolley and lynx bus tickets they would get you nearly anywhere you choose to go. We found a day trip advertised to Winter Park and jumped on the bus to Dowtown bus station (does'nt run very often though) for a connection to WP but although a pretty place, it really was'nt worth the long journey.The only dissapointment was the fact that they are knocking down all our old favorites, the Mercado has now gone, and the old Beltz Mall has changed to all designer shops...not many bargins to be found there anymore, overall a good return but would'nt go back, too much change...and not all for the better. Best place to eat we found was the Green(Red) Tomato restaurant just across the road by Kirkman (near Michaels craft store) all you can eat buffet, fresh salads and hot soup etc.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: floridafun06
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Homewood Suites and cannot find fault with any aspect of our stay there. The rooms were clean and comfortable with a fully equipped kitchen, lounge area, internet access in the room, a large bedroom with 2 queen beds, a separate vanity area and bathroom. The breakfast provided each morning was ample, with scrambled eggs and sausage each morning then 2 of either bacon, corned beef hash, breakfast potatoes, ham, boiled eggs or biscuits. Also bagels, English muffins, bread for toast, 3 cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, either waffles or pancakes, croissants, pastries, doughnuts or muffins, hot drinks, fruit juice and soda. We did not attend the managers reception so we cannot comment on this, but it seemed to be well attended. Free hot drinks and soda were available all day. All the staff were friendly and helpful. There is a pool and jacuzzi on site, as well as a games room, gym and computer room. Guests can also use the facilities at the Hilton Garden Inn (tiki bar and their pool/hot tub). The suites are a short walk away from International Drive but as they are on a street off I-Drive there is no unwanted noise. We would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: WALTDISNEY6
Reviews.Content: Me and my family have experienced two fantastic holidays in Florida using this accommodation,December 2004 and August 2007. It cannot be faulted in my opinion in any way at all. It is super clean, the complimentary breakfast is delicious and the staff, rooms and pool are first class.. It is safe and secure which is important for me with a young family and close to all types of amenities and cheap food places if you feel you want to go out.It is quiet too, away from the traffic and noise from the I-drive but with enough going on around and about. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff in this hotel and we look forward to returning for our third stay in August 2008.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value for Money place”
Reviews.Author: Deb m
Reviews.Content: This accomodation is right in the heart of International drive, however because it is on a side street there is no noise. The suites have 2 queensize beds and a pull out double sofa in the lounge. Both rooms have large tv's and there is a fridge and dishwasher in the kitchenette. We found them to be clean, comfy and in a great location for all the attractions. Breakfast was included and to be honest i was not that impressed (i like healthy food and even the cereals were a choice of chocolate coated or chocolated coated!) however my kids and partner like the waffles, cakes and scrambled eggs and other stuff which was on offer - also we went out for breakfast one day and found it to be worse than the hotel so for Orlando it was probably a good breakfast!. The pool area was really nice and they provide u with courtesy towels. There is a computer room which delighted my kids as it was free! There is also a laundry room which is really useful should you need it. There is also a shop near to reception which sells basics and one evening when the fire alarm went off a few times ( through a fault) they gave us our shopping for free! We loved Orlando and are planning to go back and we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: tony_105
Reviews.Content: I rarely believe everything I read but I must agree with most of the reviewers of this hotel, evertyhing went very smoothly from check-in to check-out. The service provided from the front desk was excellent, breakfast was a real bonus & the managers buffet was welcome after a day out at the themeparks. We arrived in the middle of a thunderstorm, lightning had hit the building causing the fire alarm to sound & a full evacuation down the stairs to the lobby just as the fire trucks were arriving (my nine year old daughter had her first holiday photo taken with the firemen). The rooms were spotlessly clean but the layout of the apartment was a bit strange, I was with my wife & two daughters 18 & 9 so the sleeping arrangements (2 queen beds in one room) took some organising, eventually my eldest settled for the pull out sofabed in the sitting room. The pool was open until 10pm each evening & was flodlit with soft piped music playing to relax you even more, pool towels were also provided. Internet access was available at reception, a 24hr juice & soda station a games room & a gym were all free. All in all wonderful value for money & I cant relate anything but positives fot the Hilton Homesuites Universal Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTravelmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from this hotel and we had a great experience. This was our first trip to Orlando and we were not familiar with the area. We had a one room suite; the bedroom was ample to fit two queen sized beds. The room rate was great and the breakfast was enough to keep us going until late lunch. Although the hotel was busy, it was quiet at night. The staff was friendly and helpful and I would definately go back again. We looked at other hotels in the area and decided that we would go back to to this chain if we returned to Disney. Staying in this hotel and getting discounted tickets is the best way to have a nice trip without breaking the bank. We (5 people) had airfare, Disney, Universal and hotel & car for 8 days for less than $2,500. We plan on going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: exquisate
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends had a get-a-way weekend from our husbands to see a concert. After researching what seemed forever, we decided on this hotel, and I am glad we did. We checked in 30 minutes early, check-in was fast! The clerks at the desk where very nice. We got a universal view room, it was over looking the highway. The windows where ceiling to floor basically, so the nightly view was gorgeous! The staff was very quick and efficient. When we got in our room the batteries where dead in the remote, I called front desk, within 5 minutes, maintenance knocked on door with fresh batteries. I felt very safe and secure, because security was always walking around the property. I was trying to come through the door with my luggage and the security man helped me with my bags and into my room. You don't see that often. You had to have a card key to even get inside the building. Well lit parking areas and pool. The breakfast was good, and they let you take it back up to your room on trays. Always kept it well stocked. When they say black out curtains they aren't lying!! That was nice, when you wanted to be lazy and sleep in. The rooms do not have those floor air conditioners that make a lot of noise, all rooms had central air, with a digital thermostat to set the temperature. There where more thamn ample supplies of towels. The bed's where a dream! They had goose feather pillows. Each bed had 3 pillows and a spare in the closet, but we asked the maid for more, so we ended up with 10 pillows to snuggle with. Anything we asked of the maid, was always with a smile, never an attitude. The kitchen had everything you needed. This hotel had all the comfort of home! Check out was simple as well, you just called front desk tell them we are leaving, leave the keys on the table and your done. I highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Kristall123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 nights and we found it to be more than adequate for our purposes. Very clean and comfortable and the service was excellent, The complimentary breakfast and welcome home meal was a nice touch and although not fancy food, was very palitable, the thing to remember is that it is complimentary . We found all of the staff we came in contact with to be very helpful and courteous. Although on International Drive it is set back from the road and like one of the other reviews we found it to be very quiet so you could get a good night sleep. For what we paid we were extremely impressed and would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “good place to rest after day at Disney”
Reviews.Author: HHbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood for two nights and we were very pleased with our stay. It was very full (you could tell by the parking lot...) but we did not hear anything or anyone when we went to sleep at night. It is situated away from International Drive which is nice (as that can be very busy). The breakfast had many great choices from scrambled eggs, yogourts, bacon, sausages, waffles, juices, cereals, bagels etc etc so everyone was happy. Our check in was a breeze and the staff - everyone from housekeeping to breakfast bar staff - were very friendly. We did not use the pool but sat poolside at one of the tables to enjoy a glass of beer from the manager's reception. Bedding was comfortable and the beds were very comfy. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. There were five of us and we had lots of space to spread out after a day at Magic Kingdom (a 15-20 minute drive from this hotel.).

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Spaceman58
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly good - but not exceptional - suite-type hotel. When we booked this hotel in early January 2007, it was rated on tripadvisor as the #1 hotel in Orlando. Trust me, it's NOT worthy of being #1, but it is good, maybe even very good. This Homewood Suites is conveniently located near Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure, and they offer free shuttle service to and from the park. You could almost walk there is the streets weren't so busy and pedestrian-unfriendly. The rooms are reasonably comfortable, though not luxurious. Of course you get a kitchen, a living room with sleeper sofa, and a large bedroom. Everything in the room is fine. The breakfast buffet is certainly convenient, but just average. Each evening they also offered a light dinner buffet, though if you enjoy nice dining, this won't be for you. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you have a family and you intend to visit Universal, I can recommend this Homewood Suites. Its safe, conveniently located off International Drive, near many fun activities and dining. And it is fairly clean. It is not the best place we've ever stayed in Orlando, but its very good.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for families, next to Universal”
Reviews.Author: ITDude13
Reviews.Content: Great place, just off all of the action on International Drive and just 2 minutes to Universal theme parks. We slept 6 in comfort. Kids loved the free breakfast that had more choices than any place we have ever stayed. It was very clean and the staff was very helpful. This is a very conveniently located property. Shuttles run to all theme parks. If you are driving, the location makes trips to Disney, Universal or Sea World very easy. Lots of fun things to do within a 3 mile radius along with lots of great restaurants. Our family ate a big free breakfast at the hotel, then had a snack mid-afternoon at a theme park, then back to the hotel for the reception from 5-7 that was more like a meal. When the kids didn't like what was being served, the staff made them peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: My family and our friends stayed here 29th June - 13th July and it was great. The breakfast had everything you could want and although we werent around for the happy hour to "meet the manager" - was actually 2 hours and was a really nice touch. The rooms are very well equiped, a good fridge, with a full sized iron and ironing board (yes I did all our ironing every day). There was a washing machine and drier on one of the floors and the gym was small but fine for a quick work out in the morning. Towels are provided around the pool, which was generally very quiet during the day and didnt ever get too busy. Reception staff were helpful and the small reception shop was fine for the odd ice cream beside the pool. We all said it was a good choice and I would go back if we are in the area. Wilson family - Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizElady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites from July 11 - July 14. I choose this place because it being a suite hotel, amenities and location to Universal. Let me tell you it did not disappoint! We couldn't have picked a better place. It's not that it's the most beautiful hotel or a high end, it just perfectly fit our needs for this vacation. The suite was exactly as it appears in pictures posted. The suite stayed very cool and comfortable in the hot, hot, hot Orlando weather. We couldn't believe how quiet this place was. It seemed pretty full, but we never heard any noise at all. The suite was spacious for our 4 day stay and probably would have been a little crowded if we had stayed longer. The beds were very comfortable and kitchen was convenient, but only used it on a limited basis. We really appreciated the breakfast buffet. Anything you could want and good. Eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, really good do-it-yourself waffles, so many things. They mixed it up a little each day. I usually eat very little for breakfast at home, so obviously this didn't disappoint. Really, anything you want . Plus they kept it refilled and had real dishes which was nice. Also, we got there most days at 8:00 am and that seemed to be the best time. Crowds were less and we could pick anywhere to sit. There was all day soft drinks and the light dinner. First day the dinner was very limited and just okay, but the second day it was a full meal of Spagetti and meatballs, salad, garlic bread and rice pudding. I thought it was pretty decent. Also beer and wine is served at this time. They had a menu in the room for the whole month of July. Homewood Suites guests also has previleges at the Hilton Garden Inn across a small street. We went there once because I liked their pool a little better and it had a Tiki Bar with mixed drinks, beer and soft drinks. A little pricey, but heck it's vacation. The location of this Homewood Suite was ideal for our trip to Universal. It took maybe 3 minutes by car to get there. We could also see the fireworks from Universal outside our window. The girl at check-in told us. We were right off International Blvd and as other posters a said has everything you could want. It was bumper-to-bumper traffic most times. Kinda reminded me of Pigeon Forge in the busy season. Hope this information helps anyone looking for a good place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chickandabug
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an eight night stay in Orlando. I picked Homewood due to the great reviews on TA and we were not disapointed. The rooms are very nice and super clean. Staff was wonderful with our many requests and even let us check in when we had a small problem with our Universal reservations. They gave great directions!!! The pool was great but I liked the pool next door better w/ the tiki bar. (Homewood guests are allowed to use the pool facilities at the sister hotel across the street.) Breakfast was nice- only waffles during the week - not weekends. The food was good but got pretty boring after a couple days. There is a great IHOP right up the street. The manager reception (Mon. thru Thurs.) was nice and offered more than enough food for us. The rooms were plenty big for us (three adults and two kids). We had a great view of the pool and I drive. The kids loved that their stuffed toys were always "tucked into the beds" when we got back from the parks. Lots of great little touches to make you feel welcome. We will be going back in a few years and plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Dillonguy4
Reviews.Content: We (2 of us) stayed there twice. Once in June and once in July 2007. Everytime we go to Orlando for the weekend, we stay there. I use my Hilton points to get a discounted rate because it is a little pricey ($139/night). But it's very roomy. Separate living room and bedroom. Free WiFi and breakfast. Breakfast has gone down a bit since we stayed there last year. They used to have a waffle maker but now it's just your basics....But you can't complain about free stuff, right? Room was pretty clean and bed was comfortable Location is very close to International Dr (all tourist spots) and about 5 minutes from Univeral Studios. I will stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best location if visiting Universal”
Reviews.Author: Juna
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the TripAdvisor reviews...so thank you! We were not disappointed! The best part of this hotel, we believe, is the location. It being on a cul-de-sac gave it more privacy, but was very close to I-drive and to Universal Studios. The breakfast was decent and had good variety. I especially liked sitting outside by the pool. We stayed on the 3rd floor which was lucky....because I had to catch up on some laundry. It was only a few doors down! Pool seemed nice although we did not use it...had some nice shaded areas and an adjacent basketball court which my son enjoyed. Homewood Suites shares the driveway with its sister hotel - the Hilton Garden Inn, and guests were invited to visit their brand new tiki bar. Never did go but from a distance, it looked really nice. Reviews of this hotel seemed to be just as positive. My only gripe was that we noticed what looked to be people from adjacent hotels (Motel 6 / Super 8), walking back to their hotels carrying food (breakfast) from Homewood Suites. They should probably do a better job of screening who comes to their "free" breakfast. THis will reduce the congestion in the dining area.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: puremega
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most enjoyable hotel stays we have ever had. Our room had a full kitchen, large bedroom and main area with pull out sleeper couch. The breakfast buffet was the biggest hit. The kids still talk about it. Full hot service with waffles, bacon and more. I cannot think of anything negative to say about this. The parking was convenient and the hotel is convenient to all attractions, shopping, restaurants and everyting Orlando is about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ussfrank
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay for three nights at Homewood Suites. The location is close to Universal theme parks and many restaurants. They have a shuttle bus "D" that will take you to Universal and return to Homewood Suites. The A/C did not work right on the bus and it was crowded at times with other riders from Enclave, Clarion, Sheraton and Hilton that are all on this route. The bus has three times in the morning for departure and several times for returning. To get tickets for the bus you must walk across the drive to the Hilton. If you don't like the bus there are cabs everywhere when leaving. Just make sure you go to the front cab. We tried to get a cab or two back in the line and they would not take us. The rooms were very nice, clean and spacious. Had one dead TV remote and it was promptly replaced at the front desk. Our room faced the highway on ramp and a couple times we were bothered by loud motorcycles but generally we were very happy with it. They serve a very nice breakfast in the mornings with choices usually eggs, sausage and waffles. I also had bacon and pancakes one day. Cereal, fruit, muffins, breads, juices, coffee, tea, soft drinks, etc. You will not leave hungry. I believe they also have some food during the evening on Monday thru Thursday. There was a calendar on the refrigerator in our room showing what they had each day. I think I saw tacos one day, chili another, soup another. Also a drink with the manager. I stayed during the weekend so I missed out on these. They have a small bar outside at the Hilton just across the drive if you want an adult beverage. There are many restaurant choices on International Drive in short driving or walking distance if you choose. We tried the Black Angus Steakhouse and loved the steaks. Another night we tried a pizza place called Sal's that had the menu stuck under our door. We ordered a pizza a wing special and a second pizza. Said it would be delivered in less than 1 hour. 1 1/2 hours later it finally showed up. Price was much higher. Delivery boy padded the bill big time and the food not too good. I heard later that many pizza places sneak in the hotels and stuff there menu under doors. These are not reputable companies and the hotel staff is always running them off. I should have used Pizza Hut which I heard later was nearby. Overall this is a great place to stay and I will be happy to try another Homewood Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: OGP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites Universal for a 5 day vacation. The location is ideal if you want to stay outside the park. It's on a long stretch of safe, walkable road with restaurants, mini golf, and nightlife. We rented a car and it was an easy 15 minute drive to Disney each morning. It is literally around the corner from Universal. We did not have any problems with traffic. You really do need to rent a car, however, because public transportation is not easily accessible. The hotel itself is wonderful. It is clean with spacious rooms and very friendly staff. They provided driving directions to many local attractions. The complementery breakfast is different each day and includes tasty hot and cold items. There is also a nightly manager's special with hefty hors d'oevres. The hotel was quiet and the bed was comfortable. The pool is clean with cozy seats on the deck. We will definitely stay here again next time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Universal. Awesome room & wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: tracesings
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our 2nd anniversary....fun trip to Universal. We had a car and and the hotel is just minutes away from Universal, Wet & Wild, and tons of restaurants and other fun things. The room was a well appointed suite with a king bed (changed at my request at no extra hassle or charge). There was a manager's reception nightly (during the week) with cocktails and food. The breakfast was good and many took advantage of the complimentary services. All of the staff members were fantastic and made sure we were well taken care of. We had a HUGE basket of fruit and a bottle of wine, not to mention an anniversary card personally signed by several of the staff. I will definitely stay here again anytime I am in the Orlando area. I reccommend this hotel for anyone...families, couples, and singles. GREAT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hyperdrop
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for four days over Mother's Day weekend. I was in town for a wedding that was held at the Portofino Bay and this hotel's proximity to the Universal Orlando Resort was fantastic. The resort was right behind the hotel. We stayed in a suite with two queen beds. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The hotel had complimentary breakfast every morning we were there. I'm not talking continental either. They had scrambled eggs, sausage, toast and corn beef hash. There's even a small arcade with video games and pinball and a small gym to get some fitness going. The best part of this hotel is the proximity to all the major Orlando attractions. Other than Universal being next door the drive to the WDW property took no more than ten minutes to get to. SeaWorld was closeby as well as Millennia Mall. This is a wonderful hotel. I look forward to staying there again and highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: jptown
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a great value with a before tax rate of $109 per night. We spent two nights and found the room very comfortable for a family of four. The bedroom was spacious, with comfy beds and pillows. Although we did not use the kitchenette, it was more than adequate for preparing a family meal, with a 2 burner stove and full sized fridge.We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning, and the taco bar on Thurs. helped to stretch our meal budget. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool was a good size with an ample supply of lounge chairs and canopies for shade when the sun became to hot. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: elizabthmp
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 night with our 3 children (9,5,2). Our suite had 2 queen beds loaded with pillows & very comfy duvets (I wish I had taken a picture as it was not the bedding shown in all the candid pictures here). We found the beds to be very comfortable (perhaps it was because we checked in at 2am and were just exhausted!). Our room was located on the side of the hotel facing the highway, but we did not notice any bothersome noise. The room was very clean until we found a sock beside the sofa. A nice touch was that they left a light and low music on in the room when we first checked in. Breakfast was the typical free breakfast (cereals, breads, scrambled eggs, ham, biscuits, fruit). My daughter enjoyed making her own waffle. We were able to find a table right away, but by the time we were leaving, people were having difficulty. There are also tables outside on the patio where you can take your food to eat. There is a small game room, pool and hot tub which we did not utilize but all looked clean. Check in was very quick and check out was was even quicker. Staff was friendly, they could have used an extra person at the breakfast area refilling food, clearing tables, etc. Overall we had a good experience here and found it to be a good value for the money (I think we only paid 130.00 or 140.00 for the room online through CRS). I have read some reviews here stating that people don't think they go what they paid for. Keep in mind this is a 3 star, family friendly, value hotel. It is not a 5 star resort. If you keep that in mind, I don't think you will be disappointed. If you are looking for 5 stars, spend the money and book somewhere else! Enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: shabdeep
Reviews.Content: I am another who booked this hotel purely because it was #1 on the TripAdvisor list for Orlando when I booked. I think that rating was optimistic! This is an OK place, good value for money, you get a lot in the rooms (lounge, small dining table, kitchenette) and breakfast is free. However, many of the early reviews commented that they had given it very high scores because of the service and friendliness of the staff. We didn't find anything to support this. They weren't particularly friendly or supportive. I had to carry my own luggage from the car to the room. When leaving, I phoned to ask for a trolley to be brought to the room but was told I would have to come down and get one myself, which I found odd. All in all, we found the staff distant and unhelpful. We arrived after 3pm and there was a queue at reception, but only one staff member on duty. We were initially told our room would not be ready for half an hour (despite us getting there at 3pm which is check in time). After a while waiting in reception, we asked another staff member how much longer it would be and were told that there were plenty of rooms and we could choose whichever one we wanted! Having wasted 20 minutes waiting, this annoyed us. The rooms themselves are ok. They are spacious for the money, they are clean and they had good facilities. However, as with all hotels, the walls were thin and we could hear our neighbours TV clearly and whenever they went to the toilet(!) and flushed! The pool area was small - you'd be better off just walking the short distance to Wet 'n Wild. The breakfast was ok, not great but then it is free so I can't complain too much.
