The location is good also. We were only there for one night so it wasn't too bad, but I can't help but feel that we would not have enjoyed it had we been there for a week or two. Ultimately, you get what you pay for and this place is basic. It's number 1 rating a short while ago was unwarranted in my opinion as there are much better places in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Homewood suites Universal”
Reviews.Author: josephineEngland
Reviews.Content: Suites are situated just off Internation Drive, just over the road from Wet and Wild and within walking distance of many restaurants. The I trolley stops just a few minutes away from the Suites. We stayed here April 2007, as a family of 3 adults. We thought the suites were great. Two large queen beds, bathroom, living and kitchen areas. Microwave, hob, dishwasher and large fridge included. Although it was great to have facilities we never cooked in the suite so didn't use everything. Also had a swimming pool which was very nice. The staff were all very helpful and polite. The free breakfast was great - toast, muffins, cereals, fruit, eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes and best of all there all machines to make your own waffles. Range of hot and cold drinks. Also in the evenings there is a free buffet with wine and beer, we were never at the suites at this time but understand it was very good. There was a free shuttle bus to the theme parks if you wanted to use it. All in all a very good place to stay, wish we had found it sooner. Thanks trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “NO WAY this should even be in the Top Ten”
Reviews.Author: Akba
Reviews.Content: Okay lets get real people. I booked this hotel totally off of tripadvisor reviews as usual. Nothing was special about the rooms, they are a typical suite hotel rooms with a kitchen. Our room was on the I-4 side of the hotel which my kids loved because you can see all the fireworks from Universal at night. My biggest problem with this hotel was the horrible breakfast. Everything was absolutely terrible. I am in the Army and this is the absolute worst food I have ever eaten. When I say everything I mean everything, even the juice. The hallways are absolutely filthy. When I checked out one guy was returning tools that he was using to fix his bathroom (which speaking of that I had to jimmyrig my shower even for it to come on) and it looked like half of the United Kingdom was fighting with the staff at the front desk about issues on their stay. Tripadvisor is usually right on point but not on this one, you have been warned, search a little longer for somewhere else. The swimming pool is about the size of a teacup.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great Experience - Bugs in Room”
Reviews.Author: wutsnext
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites on American Way for our Universal Vacation. Since it seemed close to Universal we were excited about the location. The hotel is located off of International Drive next to Motel 8 and Super 8 chains and empty boarded up restaurants, empty lots including the closed Skull Kingdom. We felt safe walking during the day only. The food chains down International Drive past the tatoo parlor were quite old not updated and food pretty bad. But not as bad as the cafeteria type food at the hotel. Tried it the first day never again not even for free. The room was ok but a previously stated the living area was tiny very tiny. The 2 seat sofa bed was extremely old and worn. The desk was chipped and the carpet was stained in the room and in the hallways. There were ants or some kind of tiny bugs on the table in the living area which we killed the first day. When we arrived home we realized we had a few bites also. One of the two elevators broke for hours one day. The printer in the Business room was broken and we had to use the one next door at the Hilton Garden. The jacuzzi and pool where used alot and the color of water showed it. We have stayed on property at Disney and Universal and have stayed at a couple of 3 and 4 star hotels in the area. But we will never stay at the Homewood Suites again. Save your money and pay for on-site hotels. They are much safer, cleaner and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: ats262m
Reviews.Content: I often stay at Homewood Suites, so was surprised that the room with the pull-out sofa at this location was so small. I don't recall ever staying at a Homewood with such a small living room; it was barely adequate for our 2 teenage kids and like a previous reviewer, we too had to move furniture from this room into the main bedroom. Kitchen space was also the smallest I'd seen at a Homewood. Other than that, the hotel was fine. Breakfast was ok, although they were very slow to replenish items, but it was fine. The room was clean, and even though our room faced the freeway it was very quiet. Location was good. Wireless internet service was free, fast and reliable. I've stayed at better suite hotels before in Orlando for this price, but they were not available when I was making reservations. If you plan to use the pull-out sofa at this location, be prepared for it to be a very tight squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “No. # 1? I think not!”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites are our all time favorite chain so we are familiar with the general structure and amenities of this hotel chain. I did not realize I had booked us at TA's Number One pick in Orlando until after I made my reservation. Perhaps that high rating created some unrealistic expectations in my mind. I certainly expected an experience at least as good as what I normally have in a Homewood Suites. Unfortunately I did not have it. To begin our experience I was not able to book directly with the hotel property unless I wanted to pay an additional $50/night. I had to reserve on-line with the Hilton website to obtain a rate of $170, which is still expensive for our budget. Registration was painless if performed by an employee who was clearly indifferent to her assigned task. I had specifically requested a room on the inside of the building so that we did not hear traffic noise from I-4 outside our window. I even called earlier in the day to confirm that room assignment, and was assured there would be no problem. We were placed on the I-4 side of the building. We were also informed that the swimming pool was closed due to some non-specified issue, but were invited to use the pool across the parking lot at the Hilton Garden Inn. Given that both properties were filled with parents with smaller children, the absence of one swimming pool put a huge strain on the one remaining, if one could ignore the inconvenience of traipsing across the parking lot. When we entered our room several things became instantly obvious. The first was that the room was certainly the smallest we have ever seen in a Homewood Suites. One glance told us that we would have to engage in significant furniture moving in order to use the hide-a-bed. In fact, once the bed was extended it was impossible to reach anything between the bed and the window, and pretty much impossible to use the desk or the arm chair. The second obvious issue was the condition of the room. The furniture was flithy, and clearly in need of replacement. Not only were there huge streaks of grease and dirt on the furniture, but it was not comfortable. Something had happened to the bed mechanism in the couch and it was not, or could not be closed completely. In addition, the bed in the couch was totally worn-out and truly uncomfortable. One also wonders why the bed in the couch cannot be made up with sheets and blanket like the other beds in the room. Clearly someone is going to use it as a bed at some point, and It is obnoxious and, in the case of this room, difficult to make-up a bed particularly when one is tired and desires to retire for the evening. The third issue was the decor. Who knows what had happened it the room. The walls were fairly tasteful in jewels tones, but the curtains inthe living room were truly strange. The hard valanece over the windows was a floral print, which matched the fabrics in the bedroom. Unlike the bedroom draperies; however, the living room drapes were bright stripes, which clashed horribly with the flowered valance. My husband hated to touch them because he claimed they felt like rubber. Underneath the draperies there were, for some unfathonable reason, polka-dot sheers. Perhaps the room was being transitioned into a circus theme. Who knows? Whatever the concept was, it did not work for us. We can clearly acknowledge that the decor of the room did not reflect a $150/night room, nor did it reflect what standards I thought would exist for TA's Number One hotel. I would also note that all of the pillows are horrid. I believe they are cheap K-Mart pillows that have seriously out lived there life expectancy. If possible, it would be best to bring our own. In terms of room amenities, there were almost no choices on TV unless you wanted to do pay-for-view movies. The wireless internet, however, did work effectively. Overall we would give the room and its furnishings a C- Breakfast on the first morning was standard fare. We headed for the waffle irons because it is always possible to get a fresh waffle when you make it yourself. Everything else on the buffet had been prepared well in advance. The bacon was so thin and burned black that it virtually dissoved into the puddle of grease in the chafining dish.....same story with the sausage. There were about two tablespoons of scrambled eggs remaining on the buffet and the dish was not replenished during our breakfast. Nonetheless, the waffle irons worked well, and there was the additional perk of hot maple syrup or bluberry or strawberry topping. Overall, out first breakfast was a good thing......probably a B+. The second day was another story all together. There were no wafles. In place of the waffle station was a dish with about eight "somethings" that might have been, in some previous incarnation, bisquits. Next to these things was a bowl of glutinous substance that one of the food service workers identified at gravy We opted to leave and find actual food somewhere else. That breakfast would get an F. We did not participate in the little supper and free wine/beer hosted in the evening as we were doing our own entertainment activities. I have never understood why this particularly amenity is not offered on Friday, Saturday or Sunday but the room rates for those three days are just as high, if not higher than the rates during the week. I also found it strange that guests were pressured into giving the Hilton sponsored surverys "all 10s". We were advised upon check-in that we would receive a survey in the mail, and were requested to give "all 10s". In addition, we were called on the last night of our stay and reminded again about giving "all 10s". If the verbal warnings were not sufficient, there was a notice on the refrigerator stressing, once more, to give "all 10s" when we received the Hilton survey. I can confirm that it is truly a popular property. At breakfast there were dozens and dozens of families with young children. Every time I passed the business center it was filled with pre-teens playing games or using the internet on the computer provided, for what one assumes is, business use. The children also seemed to enjoy playing on the elevator next door to our room. One understands that when in Orlando coping with children is inevitable, and one does not expect the hotel to act as babysitters for exhausted parents who have given up on the job. Still, a visitor to this property should be aware that it is highly family oriented and be prepared for behaviors that come with family-oriented properties. In other words, do not plan on using the hotel business center, swimming pool or common areas. Be prepared for the patter of little feet overhead, and squeals of frustration among sibilings. Know that looking in the direction of a parent will be pointless. By the time they arrive at the hotel their eyes are already glazed over in some type of trance that clearly prevents what would other wise be direct child abuse. You are free, however, to mutter quietly to yourself that your children would have never been allowed such liberities in a nice and very expensive hotel. If I had paid $75/night for this experience I would still have been bothered by the decor, and the wornout furniture, but would chalk it up to on-going rennovations and a comparable room rate. At $170/night I expect my room to look unblemished and appropriately decorated with matching fabrics. I expect food that falls into the eatable category. I expect an on-property swimming pool. I expect some TV choices, including several premium channels. I have stayed in some lovely Homewood Suites, but I have never paid $170/night to do so, and I have never stayed in a place quite as tiny and shabby as thie property. Homewood Suites Universal - Number One Hotel in Orlando?? I certainly think NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: redsox77
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. When we arrived, there was a sign right inside the lobby that said "Please welcome the Guest of the Day" which had my name under it and I wasn't quite sure what that meant. While checking in, I didn't say anything about it but just as I was given the rooms keys, he also handed me a bag with lots of little goodies, like snacks and lotions, etc, and explained that I was selected as the Guest of the day and was receiving a welcome bag. That was definitely a nice little surprise. The hotel itself is spotless, the staff is very friendly and attentive, and the suites are great sizes and comfortable. The ONLY negative thing I would say is that we had a problem with the extra blanket and sheets they store in the closet for the pull-out sofa. It was late the first night before we pulled it out and noticed the blanket was clearly not cleaned. It wasn't a huge deal so we rolled it up in a ball and assumed they'd replace it was a clean one in the morning. After coming back after they cleaned the next day, the room was cleaned but unfortunately the blanket and sheets were still rolled up in the ball next to the sofa. We considered that pretty minor compared to the overall cleanliness and convenience of the hotel. Also, just to note, I'd consider the hotel on the very limits of "walking" distance to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, loved the stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mike463502
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at Homewood Suites and were very pleased with our visit. Everything we read on TripAdvisor was true. The rooms are amazing. We had a living room, kitchen, and a huge bedroom with two queen beds in it. We really couldn't have asked for more. The only issue we had is that there were ants in the bathroom of our room. But that was not too bothersome. The breakfast was pretty good. It wasn't the best I've had, but I've had much worse in other places. Either way it was still worth it. Plus I recieved a very good deal on the room because they offer a military discount. The hotel is also in a very good location. Less than a two minute walk from busy International Drive and within arms reach of any kind of restuarant to can imagine. I would probably stay here again and suggest it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “As GOOD as last years stay.”
Reviews.Author: TheArtTeacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again this year in March and it was a Great as last year. One mile from Universal Studio's so you can walk or take a FREE shuttle. I like this place because it is a Suite. You get a bedroom ( get two beds...the king bedrooms are much smaller)livingroom and full kitchen. You actually don't need the kitchen....They give you a complete Full hot breakfast buffet every morning...Bacon.sausage,eggs,potatoes,fruit,yogart,waffles and much more. It may vary a bit each day. BIG PLUS...they even have a light meal in the evenings Mon.-Thurs. including wine and beer. One night they had shepards pie,pineapple and ceaser salad. The next night they had cheese burgers,fruit and regular salad. Not bad for an evening meal. It's all included in the price of your room. Meals change nightly. They even put a meanu in your room. Last year we paid $154 a night and this year it was $124. You can't beat it. Clean, well located place. We wouldn't stay anywhere else when at Unniversal and you can always drive to Disney from there too. Next door a couple paid more than we did,not a suite and no food. Stay here instead. Read my last years review too. Nice pool and a small store area to buy food if you want. Safe area too. Happy traveling.

Reviews.Title: “This place RULES!”
Reviews.Author: dhansen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a recent business trip and we were very pleased. The breakfast was awesome and the welcome home reception/meal was a great added feature. We are going to Orlando for spring break with the kids will be staying here for the last two days. We are staying at the Royal Pacific the first four days only because of the fast pass room keys for the Universal Parks. Now if Homewood Suites would provide these then it would be a perfect world!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!- Exceeded Expectation- (Free Food!)”
Reviews.Author: Novaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in early Dec2006 and booked by phoning directly. The person we spoke to was clear and helpful and the reservations were made smoothly. We had a CAA discount rate of $125US/night. We were going to check in very early (9am) and they were so flexible that we were able to get into our room PLUS help ourselves to the breakfast buffet before we caught the free shuttle to Universal Studios. (as well as do some laundry!) Shuttles were very not that frequent, so we took the later morning one. Check-In was a breeze- took 5 minutes, maybe less. We had a first floor room and it was lovely and large. Terrific kitchen with full size fridge and whatever supplies you could think of although we didn't get a chance to use any of it. As well- they left bottles of water and cookies as a snack on the kitchen table- a nice touch. There was a large living room area with a couch+tv+desk. We didn't take advantage of their free wireless internet. A separate (spacious) room contained the 2 queen beds. They were very comfortable. The adjacent area contained a closet + vanity/sink area. Lots of storage space and brightly lit. Toilet+bath/shower was very clean with fluffy white towels and good water pressure. We didn't have a chance to use their outdoor pool as the weather was too cool. They also had a outdoor basketball court and an indoor fitness room that we didn't have a chance to use. I have to mentioned that the free food aspect of our stay was a very pleasant surprise- even though I had read about this hotel in previous reviews. It far exceeded my expectations. The breakfast buffet was quite bountiful- above average for sure as it contained several beverage options, fruits, yogurt, pastries, eggs, sausage, bagels/toast and waffles. It also ran till 10am? which is nice- when you're on vacation it's nice to be able to sleep in and still get breakfast. PLUS they offer a light supper Mon-Thurs I think. After coming back from the theme park- we were still able to catch the tail end of the meal-- this is really nice since we were tired and didn't really want to venture outside the hotel again for food (although there were many options nearby-maybe not walking distance but definitely by car). The light meal was substantial enough that we were quite satisfied. (meatball subs+salad+fruit) We also used their business facilities- they only had 2 public terminals so we had to make the rounds several times in order to get some time on them. I also want to mention the VERY pleasant staff in the entire establishment. Everybody greeted you pleasantly, and the staff managing the food were very accomodating when asked for additional buns etcetc. The hotel was about a $40 (incl. tip) cab ride away to the airport. (it was 6am when we had the cab ride) And roughly a 15 minute shuttle ride to Universal studios. (the shuttle stops at several other hotels, so the time would probably vary according to how many people were going) As well, you have to go across to the hotel across the parking lot to get 'tickets' because they have a special counter detailing which shuttles go where. In summary- this was a terrific hotel - For extended stays of large groups- this hotel would be an excellent deal. Like a home away from home. Highly recommended. One little tip-- we had a semi-incompetent cabdriver drive us to the hotel-- even though we said we wanted to go to the Homewood Suites closest to Universal Studios on AMERICAN WAY- he still drove us to the wrong location. Make sure you emphasize which location you are going to! Good thing I question the cabbie before I got out of the cab...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Honestopinion2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this location, on American Way, twice last year and would do it again and again. Everything was perfect: customer service, rooms, cleanliness of bathrooms, gym, pool, hot breakfast, and the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingerbell
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt one of the best hotel experience I have ever had. The breakfast was excellent, staff helpful and friendly. We only enjoyed the dinner one evening but it was good. The room was nice and very clean. The kids even enjoyed the pool in December. My only complaints are I wish Wireless internet was available and the evening meal was served more often. Overall I really believe I got the best deal for what I paid. I plan on returning to orlando in a couple of years and will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: gillg
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 , 2 adults and 2 kids (12, 15). This place represents great value for money. It is clean and well maintained and the management and staff were all friendly and professional during our stay. The rooms were clean and well stocked with amenities (Neutrogena). The carpets are getting a little worn but that is a minor detail. We had 2 queen beds in the bedroom and a sleeper sofa in the lounge/kitchen area. Wireless internet was free and fast. There is a small bathroom with shower over bath, water in the shower was hot and plentiful. Our room faced the pool with easy access to the carpark. The managers reception was good, we had it every night of our stay and were happy with it. It's not fine dining but filling, and it saved us a lot on meal bills. Several guests complained about the buffet running out but they were there at the end of the 2 hoyrs and the staff managed the situation well with top up food (different tho the advertised menu). I thought that they were complaining unnecessarily. We were also more than happy with the breakfasts. Wide vriety of food- croissnts, yogurt, cereal, waffles, bacon, sausages, etc The location was very good, short drive to all major attractions and shopping malls and outlets. There's a fun mini glf just down the road and lots of restaurants such as Dennys,etc within walking distance. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Is it too good to be true?”
Reviews.Author: alpenmicho
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days pre-cruise in Orlando mainly visiting Universal. (If bought online our 2 day passes were good for 7. We used 4 of the days.) We stayed at the Homewood suites on American Way. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is rated number one in Orlando for good reason. Because I'm writing a review, I'm trying to find faults and I can't. Oh yah, one of the laundry machines ate my quarters and broke...and then they gave me all these little boxes of bounce and tide...to make up for it. Even though I think it's worth the hotel's direct online rates 129-149....I was able to book through a website called CRS reservations for $84/night (payment to be made to the hotel itself). This was honored no problem. A credit card is necessary to stay there. A hold will be put on your card even if you pay cash (something I didn't realize until it was time to go on the cruiseship). The rooms were extremely spacious. Very bright, homey comfortable clean feeling. There are two separate sleeping areas closeable by a door. One is the typical hotel room...the other is the attached kitchen livingroom. The decor is casual (think a nice Hampton Inn) yet has upscale touches...a little granite here...nice sconces there...The beds were comfortable all over, meaning it didn't sag in the middle nor flop in the sides. They had feather and regular pillows. You can comfortably sleep 5 or 6 in this hotel room. They had an amazing breakfast each morning. They also had a nice supper with free beer/wine M-T. We ate breakfast there everyday, hopped on the universal shuttle, came back on the 5pm shuttle, walked in, had supper. The pool was heated and hottub was clean. They have 24 hour pop (4/5 varieties in a dispensing machine), juice, water, tea, coffee, and hot chocolate available. We just felt we could walk downstairs in our pyjamas and help ourselves. Great business center with printer. The staff was great. We checked in at 10 am and they got a room ready for us while we had breakfast. They even brought the papers to me to sign at my table...so we could be on the universal shuttle by 11am. There's also a trolley bus that you can catch nearby that brings you up and down the main street with tons of restaurants and stores. $1 for adults...free for kids.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Cheschirecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites over the Thanksgiving Holiday and it was GREAT. We got there around 2pm and were given our suite in a timely manner. Our keys did not work for our doors and approximatley 2 -3 people came to our rescue. We were always greeted with a smile and all staff were kind and courteous. The suite was beautiful. it was more like an apartment than a hotel room. They served light dinner fare and refreshments including wine and beer M-Thurs, so Wed we had sloppy joes and chicken salad. To me that is more than light fare. That is a meal! Thanksgiving they did not have food, but holiday pies. That was really nice! The breakfast was outstanding and we enjoyed making our own waffles. Everything was great, but their shuttle service to the parks is limited, but Wet and Wild is in walking distance. I do not recommend walking to Universal. We walked there and then the kids were to tired to walk back. PLEASE, PLEASE ask them for their directions(written) to local venues like Wal-Mart, Target ect. I wish I had on the first day! I will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate booking this one!”
Reviews.Author: iangoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood Suites for four nights at the beginning of November and quite simply could not give it a high enough recommendation for it's value for money, cleanliness, and location, if you are visiting Universal Studios it is just a leisurely 15 min walk. The suite we had was clean, well equiped and very comfortable. The breakfast was a great start to the day with a good variety available. The light evening buffet and free drinks, (red/ white wine and beer mon - thur evenings, 5 to 7pm) was a fantastic bonus-we used it every evening. All staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. Free internet access and gym. My only advice to anyone going there is take note of the following when trying to find it .Head for the Sheraton Tower as a landmark because Homewood is tucked away. Going up International Drive with wet n wild on your right go straight across Universal Bvld and access to Homewood will be about 200-300 yards or so on the left and it is tucked away so watch out, but it is well worth finding.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: travelexpertallan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this absolutely great property! The morning breakfast and dinner/reception in the evening are fantastic! The staff and accomodations are the best I have found in over 100 trips to Orlando! We really liked the location, the rooms and environment are quiet and spacious. You will find an upgraded alarm clock in room, 24 hour hotel maintenance on site, a great pool and internet center as well as a variety of guest services and restaurants as well as a great night life location (Howl at the Moon) nearby. Every spacious one and two bedroom suite features separate living and sleeping rooms, and a full size kitchen. All suites are large enough for work, relaxation or entertaining and feature comfortably sized floor plans. The suites feature a kitchen: Full size refrigerator and microwave, two-burner stove top, coffee maker and cooking utensils. Separate living room with sofa bed, lounge chair and coffee table. All rooms have a 25” television with video cassette player Bathroom – Full bathtub/shower with separate vanity area Hair dryer, iron and ironing board . The hotel offers a Complimentary High-speed wireless Internet access and television has the Premium channels (HBO, CNN, ESPN) On-demand pay-per-view movies Two phones with voicemail In-room safe and a Complimentary USA Today newspaper (Mon-Fri) compliment the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A true home from home”
Reviews.Author: DiverDH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 14 night vacation at the end of October/beginning of November- our first in USA/Orlando. The suite was of good proportions - very clean and tidy with all new equipment thoughout. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the daily maid service was excellent; not to mention the breakfasts - a good choice and plenty of it! Also took advantage of the "Managers Reception" evening meal (Monday to Thursday) a couple of nights, the food was good and the free beer and wine an extra bonus. Would happily stay there again / recommend this Hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Superman2k38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 9 night stay at this property. We were glad to see the #1 TA rating was very well deserved. The rooms are very roomy (like a comfy, small apartment) with a kitchen, living room, and bedroom area. Two TVs were a nice touch. The staff overall was helpful and pleasant. And you can't beat the free breakfast every morning. There's free dinners Mon.-Thurs w/ free beer and wine, but we never had the chance to partake of it. They post a nice calendar of dinner themes on your fridge for your convenience. We've stayed at onsite hotels at both Universal and Disney over the years but plan on making Homewood Suites our "home" from now on. We're already planning another stay in the Spring. Can't forget to mention that the property is right across I-4 from Universal Studios. You can even walk there w/o breaking much of a sweat. P.S. They have the biggest sets of pillows I've seen in any hotel. They are bulging, so if you like a flat pillow...better bring one. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popet
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Homewood Suites and thought the staff including the manager Mario practice excellent customer service. This has left a great impression on both myself and husband and would certainly go back. We had a two centre holiday firstly staying at Homewood Suites for 6 days then flying off to Dallas for 5 days, then back to Orlando. Unfortunately, we didn't book anywhere for our return, thinking that we would be able to book in with easy. How wrong can you be!!! There was a big conference that week and all hotels appeared to be booked but Mario came to the rescue and rang an ex colleague and got us a suite further on from them. It was good but nothing like the hospitality we received at Homewood. The breakfast was nothing in comparison. I must say that Mario did invite us back for breakfast at no cost - a very nice guy. The Managers Special (I think they call it that), was very good especially that it was free, wine and beer also free and as much as you wanted to drink. No cocktails though as they do not have a bar. The location is great and the Trolley stops within a short walking distance. Lovely restaurants around, our favourite was Tony Roma's just over idrive to Homewood Suites, again really very friendly and great customer service. The reception staff got us a great deal on a hire car and arranged for us to be picked up to collect the car all this was carried out with the up most efficiency. I throughly recommend Homewood Suites and heard some really negative reports from other holiday makers about their hotels and felt very relieved that ours was so clean, welcoming, good food and very comfortable beds. Hopefully we'll go back there next year. Our thanks to Mario and staff for going that extra mile to make our holiday thoroughly enjoyable. Popet

Reviews.Title: “Ok...its worth it”
Reviews.Author: rrushhour
Reviews.Content: After two thousand exhausting hours of trip advisor and every hotel message board and user review site we could find, my wife and I settled on Homewood in Orlando on American Way off of International drive. Trying hard not to pick a DUMP, I had a severe migraine from comparing hotels. Ended up picking a bad one in Jamaica Negril (Couples Swept Away) based on trip advisor reviews earlier this summer and didn't want to make the same mistake...anyway..... Homewood gets an A+. Pros... the room was very clean very friendly staff breakfast was pretty good (best blueberry waffles i've ever had) free beer and wine mon thru thurs night (eventhough we didn't get any) pretty much ANY food or shopping is within walking distance good clean area of town cons... I cant think of any the suite is like a nice small cozy apartment. great for an extended stay. I would recommend Homewood to anyone, and will stay there again the next time we visit disney.

Reviews.Title: “loved homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: maccies
Reviews.Content: booked with travel city direct. seems to be the only uk operator to this hotel? Upgraded on flights the extra money is deffo worth it. This hotel is perfect for your orlando holiday. 5 mins to Universal, across the road to wet & wild and only 15-20 mins from disney. Can't comment on shuttle as never used it as had our own car. The time of year that we stayed there (sept) we had no queuing up for anything at all so we were at the front at all the car parks. Room are anything you could wish for with a seriously comfy double bed (you don't want to get up when the alarm goes off!) Breakfast is nice but after 2 weeks it does get a bit repetative but go for the waffles before the novelty wears off. Managers buffet is a real bonus if you get back early enough but we only managed it twice, (all you can eat and enough lager & wine to sink a ship). A real bonus at this hotel is the laundry only 4 dollars for a complete load thats washing & conditioner plus drying time, I done all of mine before I came home and saved loads of hours this way. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It is also easy to spot on way home from anywhere just look for the sheraton hotel with its massive golf ball like structure on top at the entrance to American Way.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: Gathersnomoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites Universal Studios, Orlando, Sept. 11-13. Frankly, we chose it because it was #1 in popularity in Orlando and we wanted to see why. We were almost entirely pleased with our experience, with only minor detractions. It is a little hard to find if you don’t know the neighborhood, being on a loop side street and not too easy to locate from the thoroughfare. Check-in was very pleasant. The front-desk staff is well trained, polite, friendly, and professional. We had requested a suite on the side away from the major highway and got what we asked for. A small convenience shop next to the front desk offers most amenities travelers might need. The all-suite hotel was apparently nearly full, with businesspeople and internationals very obvious. Families were well represented also. Hallways are nicely finished and well lit. The layout is simple and easy to find your way around. There is a game room for kids, a well-equipped exercise room, and a business office with two computers for guest use. Most rooms get wireless, high-speed Internet reception, but not all. We talked to guests who couldn’t connect in their room. Connectivity in our suite was not entirely reliable. But Internet is free, so we can’t complain. We were very pleasantly surprised when we opened the door to our suite. The table was very attractively set for two! One enters next to a very well-equipped kitchenette where one could easily prepare full meals. Just beyond is the living area with a two-cushion sofabed and chair, table, and entertainment center. The TV had a keyboard and game control device. Through a closeable door one moves into the good-sized bedroom and bath area. We were assigned two queen beds. Good drapes almost completely blocked outside light, useful due to the bright area lighting at night. There was a combo chest of drawers under another TV. A very attractive, well-lit lavatory area was across from the water closet containing the toilet and tub. We had an abundance of towels for a change and didn’t need to request more. Of course there were the customary iron, ironing board, hair dryer, and personal hygiene amenities. Interestingly, hot water in the sink and shower was instantaneous. The shower head was ok, but not great. Everything worked (except spotty Internet) and was clean, although the living room furniture was worn and needed replacing. Pool and Jacuzzi: Clean, well-equipped, and neat. Plenty of towels and chaise lounges. Breakfast: Served in a large eating area off the lobby, breakfast was more than the usual cello-wrapped muffins and drinks. There was a juice bar, milk, and several other beverage choices. Waffle iron, chafing dishes containing scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and hash browns. (Why can’t hotels serve good coffee? It always tastes like it was made by someone who is mad at coffee drinkers! Ptui!) But everyone seemed to find plenty to eat and chomped happily. Evening stuff: From 5 to 7 p.m. there were complimentary beverages and finger food. But people were carrying away plates of Wonder Bread and cold cuts, obviously making a cheap dinner for themselves. All-in-all, a good value especially considering the proximity to everything hedonistic in Orlando. Surrounded by restaurants of every sort and close to a Walgreens store. Perhaps 20 minutes from the airport. Misc: Safe, well-lit, busy area, good parking lots, very well maintained exterior.

Reviews.Title: “Loves It”
Reviews.Author: xxkerrixx
Reviews.Content: I absitutly Loved this hoted i stayed here last yr and i had a brill time its the best hotel ive ever stayed in !!!! I loved their hot dogs the wer 2 die for i really want to go back there now bt my father has borght a villa out there soooo ill have to wait until im older lol xxx

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: PatsyPie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week before moving into a villa in LBV. Had a one bedroomed suite facing I-Drive. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Choice of bath or shower. We also had the party of 50 or so Spanish students and had to wait quite a while for lift as they seemed to like going up and down in it. !! Found staff helpful and polite at all times. Breakfast was ok (not healthy by any means). The free shuttles to Universal and Seaworld we found to be adequate. Booked a taxi to the Mercado to board the free Busch Gardens Express without any problems. The pool and area were clean and tidy at all times. The only fault i could find with this hotel was the shop. Admittedly it was only small but I think it could have been better stocked. Would I stay here again? Definately without a doubt.!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent , first class value”
Reviews.Author: Vegasdebut007
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Hiltonhonors, so we are quite pro Hilton and Homewood Suites. We had a lovely pool side room with two queen beds and a pull out. We had a quite nights in a great bed before getting to Universal and the other parks. The breakfast was very good with lots of items. We also managed to stuff ourselves at the evening buffet - spag bol - brill. It really was a first class stay and given the location I am not sure it could be bettered. No need to worry about this one - it is very very good.

Reviews.Title: “great stay.”
Reviews.Author: ltj-1964
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children aged 7 and 6 stayed here for two weeks in August 2006. I chose this hotel after reading the rave reviews on this website. We were so glad that we did and the reviewer from the 3rd August must have stayed at the wrong hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I read the reviews about pool side rooms being better than rooms facing the highway and asked to be changed upon our arrival as we had been allocated a highway view. Mark, the receptionist did this instantly. The rooms are spacious with a room set apart from the bedroom. This is execellent for those with children who have gone to bed and can watch tv and relax without disturbing the children sleeping. This is what persuaded to stay here rather than other hotels who have the bedrooms and bathrooms and that's it. Our room was cleaned every day without fail and we had no complaints. The free breakfast, again an added bonus over other hotels, was very good and we had the managers special, the free evening buffet on one occasion, which was spaghetti. The catering staff were also very helpful. It is the little extras that make the stay pleasant. There are free pool towels to use. 2 computers with internet access, again free. One dollar to use the washing machine and one dollar to use the dryer. Free car parking. Compare that to other hotels. The hotel is graded three and half stars and it is easily worthy of that. I would easily recommend this to anyone. Our only gripe, as highlighted by another reviewer was when we stayed at the hotel there were 80 Venezualan students aged 15 staying. At times it felt like you were staying at a youth hostel as they made a lot of noise..The hotel is ideally situated off International Drive. We paid £940 for two weeks and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Analin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites between May 6 and May 13. We have to agree in some parts with the poster who wrote about dirty rooms in the beginning of August. The carpet was dirty and not well cleaned. Some nails from one of the previous visitors were there all the week on the carpet and also some other things. There were also stains on the carpet. The toilet chair was not cleaned properly. If you looked up below the upper parts of the bowl you could see a lot of dirt, it was all black. We complained the night we arrived and got the answer that it would be cleaned the next day. Finally we managed them to clean the toilet the same night which was taken care of by the caretaker. The woman in the reception were not helpfull and almost rude. The next day the lock to the toilet couldn't be opened and we had to contact the caretaker again. We also got some strange phonecalls in the early morning. Our apartment was on the right side away from the traffic so it was quiet at night. Breakfast was good and the dinnermeals were ok. We didn't find anything in the neighbourhood that was bad so we can't agree on the part that it wasn't safe to stay there. We are from Sweden and have travelled a lot. We have stayed a lot at hostels when travelling in Sweden so we are not spoiled in any way about cleaning and such things. Overall a bit of disappointment regarding to all of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in busy town”
Reviews.Author: ILnaturetrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for 3 nights the third week in June. The rooms were clean and the breakfast each morning was very good. We only had the evening meal one night. Our teenage children liked the chicken strips and mac & cheese, the wife & I ordered in Papa Johns pizza and enjoyed the hotel beverages with it. We did not use the kitchenette, but having a true freezer for freezing water bottles for the next day was a bonus. We did not use the pool as we were visiting the Orlando attractions all day long. We were traveling with our teenage children (boy & girl) so were very glad to have the 2 queen beds and the sofa sleeper. We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood is ok”
Reviews.Author: lynamh
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week after stayin at the crowne plaza for a week"! The hotel is clean it's self but in a morning the loby stunk of apricot airfreshner and eggs witch made us feel sick! The breakfast is nice and there is a diffrent selection every day. there is two computers witch the kids enjoyed going on for a hour when we came back from the parks. The pool is nice and the jikuzi is very relaxing after a hard day! The hotel is very close to orlando studios,wet ,n, wild, shops and international drive. the rooms are very airy and spacious and the bath rooms are very clean aswell! it was a lovely hotel just the smell witch put me off we told them at reception and they said they would sort it but the next day it was 10 times worse turns out they just sprayed more airfreshner!! ( yuck ) that was the only thing that let it down!! i would recomend homewood if you dont mind feeling sick in a morning!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!!”
Reviews.Author: abcdefghi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for almost a week, after having read rave reviews on Tripadvisor. We were extremely disappointed, and had to look at four different rooms before finally finding one we could halfway bare to stay in for the duration of our stay. Here's why: - The rooms facing the freeway were very noisy (and that's at least half the rooms, remember that the freeway is right outside the window). - All the rooms were dirty. The bathrooms were not properly cleaned, one room had sheets with brown stains on them, the carpets were not vacuumed around the edges (meaning the foot closest to the wall, and keep in mind, these are wall-to-wall carpets). In addition, housekeeping sprayed the rooms with a deodorizer so grosse that we had to air out the rooms for hours before being able to spend any time there. - The rooms with two queen beds in them (which includes most rooms) only have one nightstand and one night lamp, which both beds have to share. Very inconvenient. - The dinner food was unhealthy (they serve dinner Monday through Thursday). Saturated fat and refined carbs, and that was it. - The area is not safe. - And the absolutely worst part: The service was the worst we have ever experienced. We are very well travelled, and we were shocked!! When we, in a very polite manner, complained, the staff didn't listen, cut us off by answering all incoming phone calls, were rude, unhelpful and arrogant. I considered calling their head office to tell them about this, as it was so horrible. When asking them for advice on restaurants in the area, they gave us wrong directions. So they were unknowledgeable as well. What's good about this place: - The rooms are large, and they have a kitchenette including a refridgerator. There's a separate sitting area. - The parking was free and ample. - The rate included breakfast. - The hotel is close to International Drive, Wet n' Wild and Universal Studios (walking distance). All in all, do not stay here, especially if travelling with someone who's allergic to dust or is sensitive to strong smells. Why let the rudest, least helpful hotel staff in the world ruin your vacation?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: WanderingLamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family in July 06 - clean, friendly with great facilities - close to all the attractions. Especially liked the free beer by the pool on a week night - didnt eat there in the eve, but breakfasts were good. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great :)”
Reviews.Author: loveorlando
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great for the measly price of $ 114.00 a night you get a suite, hot breakfast, meal between 5-7 in the afternoon 4 times a week. Great staff, everything runs smoothly. Free internet access in a comp room, and a game room, fitness room. There is always room by the pool, it is not big but I consider that a + when travelling with young children. Everything was clean and they even put the dirty dishes in the washer for you ! Great location........ 2 televisions with the option of renting all the almost new movies just with the click of the remote. Would definately stay there again and recomend it to everyone. WR.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: NZSailfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Great location, wonderful friendly and helpful staff. My partner was especially impressed with the free beer every night. Suites were large and well stocked. Great to have two TV's and a big bathroom. Also enjoyed the free breakfast. Would recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jaide22
Reviews.Content: i went to homewood suites in april 06 with my husband and 3 children age ranging from 6 to 14. we expected a average hotel, no extras at all. we were most suprised. It was lovely! we were greeted by a friendly member of staff, who welcomed us and told us when brekfast was etc and we were allocoated a room. I was pleasantly suprised at the room. It had a good kicthenette with washer, fridge,freezer microwave etc they also suplied coffee, hot chocolate and popcorn. There was 2 telivisons. We had maid service everyday. The beds were amazing, king size and so comfortable. There was free interent access, they had free breakfast and tea [ although we only ate the breakfast as we ate out every night] but im sure if it tasted as good as the breaksfast you couldnt complain. They had a games room with pool, pinball, airhockey. The pool was lovely. Very nice temperature and clean. The hot tub was great too. It is in a wonderful location, right near wet n wild [literally acroos the road] and only up the road to the dining part of i drive and down the other to the shopping. It also has a crazygolf course next door. That is a great fun! All in all it was a brillaint holiday and a wondeful hotel. We thoughroly enjoyed it and it saved us a lot of money. If we ever came to orlando again we would DEFINALTY stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: weekendtravelerinia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 11th-June 17th. We had a clean room when we arrived (minus the silverware that was set out on the table - but we didn't care because we weren't going to use it, anyway - and, there was a dishwasher if we had wanted to use it - so, no big deal). We had a large refrigerator which came in very handy for our food and drinks. The staff was very accomodating and friendly at all times!!! It was also nice that (at night) we always had a security guard walking around in the lobby and the pool area - that made us feel very safe. We had complimentary breakfasts that were very yummy and were what really made the hotel worth it's price! We were able to make our own fresh, hot waffles (other things were also offered - fruit, scrambled eggs, yogurt, rolls, cereal, juice, etc). I really don't have any complaints about anything except on our last day we called for a 4:30 am wakeup call so we wouldn't miss our airplane and we never received it ... yes, we did have the alarm clock in the room set, but I wanted to make sure that if the electricity went off, we'd still make it to the plane on time. I'm sure it was just an oversight because we did receive our other wake-up calls throughout the week ... just make sure that you also set your alarm clock if you need to get up early for anything. The complimentary dinner served in the evening was what you would expect for a free dinner - they had spaghetti and garlic bread (we only ate the dinner at the hotel once during our stay because we were busy seeing the sights). I don't like spaghetti so I wasn't impressed but my children and my mom seemed to like it. It was also very nice that the hotel had a washing machine and clothes dryer on the 3rd floor (very helpful since we only had room in our suitcases to pack in 3 days worth of clothing for the 8 days we would be away from home). We also had complimentary hotel shuttles to Universal Studios and Sea World. There was also a shuttle bus that cost $6.00 per person to Disney (much cheaper than the taxi's that we had taken to much closer places). We also used the I-Ride Trolley for $1.00 per person - this was convenient (the trolley stops every 15-20 minutes at each international drive stop) and my kids thought it was cool to ride. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Florida and I would rate it a 4.5 out of 5. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 out of 5 is because I think the housekeeping didn't clean the room quite so well as other hotels during our stay (when we arrived back at the hotel from our day of sight-seeing we still had our used, open bottled water sitting where we left it and a dirty spoon left where we left it on the counter until we finally moved it on the 3rd day). Not a big problem though, because (like I said), when we got there, the room was clean ... and, it was our mess so we just cleaned it up. I'm just used to having full maid service at the hotels I normally stay at ... but, for $134+ tax per night (including free breakfast, free dinner and the free shuttles), I don't think there's room to complain. We were VERY happy at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PattySouthFlorida
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed here for one night. I chose this hotel based on the reviews here and also because of the low rate ($114.00 on AAA site). I can see why the Homewood Suites gets such good reviews. It was very clean, and spacious. The staff was very friendly. The only negatives I had were that the doors separating the bedroom from the living room did not close properly, so a lot of light and noise came through from the living room when I was trying to sleep (my boys wanted to stay up to watch TV). Also, the air conditioning vent is directly over the bed and BLASTS cold air. I felt a stong draft all night. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The free breakfast was very good...lots of variety so there is something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smith030
Reviews.Content: We spent ten days in this hotel from late May thru June 5th and could not have had a finer experiance. The room service was excellent and the hot breakfast every morning was a wonderful way to start our day. The hotel was clean and quite considering the number of children there with their families. There is no doubt about where we will stay the next time we are in Orlando. The staff was as nice and helpful as they could be. I reccomend this hotel on the basis of cleanliness, quietness, overall comfort and price.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 13th to the 16th. Very nice hotel. Beautiful rooms, very clean. The kitchen area was very convenient. Breakfast was nice. Not thrilling, but better than just cold cereal and bagels. Kids loved the pool. Nice and close to Universal and Seaworld. Right off International drive so GREAT location!!! Didn't and wouldn't stay here if I was going to Disney though. Not too close. Only mishap was when the fire alarms went off at around 10:30 on Sunday night, and we had to wake up the kids and evacuate our room. There wasn't anyone from management around to let us know where we should wait, or when we could return to our room. No apologies or anything from the hotel afterwards. There was a bad electrical burning smell from the electrical room behind one of the elevators and the fire dept. took care of it. The elevator was down the next day for a while. The inconvenience wasn't a big deal, but an explanation or apology or something would have been nice. All in all, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Came up Smelling Like Roses!!”
Reviews.Author: LindaJoyS
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT HOTEL at A GREAT PRICE!! We mainly picked this hotel after reading all the favorable reviews on Travel Advisor. And boy, were those travelers right! (SOO glad we found this site! ) We booked our room on the HIlton site, and got a $5 AARP discount each nite. (Didnt see that discount available on other sites, so would recommend going to Hilton's Homewood Suites site if you want the AAA or AARP discount) We paid only $114 a nite --- you can't beat the value for your money here!! I must have mentioned it was our Anniversary in the comment section when booking or when I called to confirm our reservations 2 nites before going, to ensure getting a room NOT facing I-4 highway (an item someone on this site mentioned). Well... when we returned to our room the first nite, there on the kitchen table was a nice bottle of wine (sold off the lobby for $22) and ROSE PETALS were strewn around the room and on the bed!! At first , we thought this was a common occurrence and were SOO impressed -- LOL -- but checked at desk and gal there said the Mgr. had that done in honor our Anniversary! What a LOVELY gesture that was SOO appreciated!. Even without that special touch, the hotel had everything and more that we could have wanted. Loved being able to get a quick breakfast that was NOT just a continental fare before hitting the theme parks. (Lots of choices and delicious, and saved a lot of time each morning, ensuring our getting to parks before they opened.) SPACIOUS room with full kitchen, nice sitting area with couch and chair with its own TV --in addition to one in the bedroom. Comfy beds and pillows. SOOO close to Universal and Sea World. Free shuttle for guests (not to Disney tho), but we had a rental car so didnt need it. Renting a car is sooo cheap in Orlando and it was a quick and direct ride to Disney on the I-4 highway. ( We even came back in the middle of the day to rest some days and went back to Disney at nite since the drive was so effortless ) .. It's right off International Drive which is bustlling with hotels, stores and restaurants. ALso loved the room off lobby which had 2 computers and free access to the Internet, plus a printer......Game room, fitness room, outdoor pool. They have it all ! Homewood Suites is now among our FAVORITE hotels and would highly recommend their facilities to anyone considering a trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal in all things”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second time we have been to the Homewood Suites Universal, and would gladly go again, great quiet location, very clean, ideal for attractions and I4 motorway. great free beakfasts and manager specials 4 nights a week. Staff are very pleasant and wwell mannered, quick reponse to any of your needs. Our son is blind and they changed rooms on our arrival and were allways asking if we had everything he needed. Stay here you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but in a busy location”
Reviews.Author: Robb100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights recently. I stay at Homewood Suites often and this one was nice. However, the carpet in the room was stained and worn. Overall the room was comfortable. My biggest gripe was the pool. My son was looking forward to swimming in the morning and while we ate breakfast it was fun seeing the ducks landing and swimming in the pool. However, after breakfast we walked up to the pool and noticed a lot of duck poop on the bottom and two huge hairballs floating around. I told the front desk and they said they would clean it up. I didn't check the next morning. The breakfast was up to normal HWS standards, maybe a little bit better. Good mix of hot and cold items. The exercise room was excellent with some freeweights and several machines. International drive is a very busy location. This was a last minute trip tied to some work I had to do in the area. If I was choosing I would pick another location, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lacrazia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 week and enjoyed the large rooms, complimentary buffet breakfast and daily Manager's Specials they had. It was a good value for families with children but as a single person I still enjoyed the benefits as well. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Orlando and wishing to stay in the area closest to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel That Does No Wrong!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending an enjoyable week on the gulf coast, my family (wife and I and 2 boys, 7 and 1.5 years) came to this hotel for 4 days during late April and early May. I selected it largely due to the favourable reviews on this site. I travel a lot for business and usually find myself in some very nice hotels. That said, I would classify this hotel as one of the best I've stayed in, as it understood its purpose and played it to perfection. In bullet form: The Hotel - the hotel is very clean and nicely painted. No Matisse in the lobby, but friendly staff who actually seem concerned about your enjoyment, without being obsequious. - the hotel offers a complementary hot breakfast buffet each morning. Those hoping for smoked salmon and custom omlettes need to look elsewhere. However, if you have hungry kids there is nothing better than to come out of your room and have immediate scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, bagels and toast, a selection of juices and wait for it... actually good coffee! Try the make-it-yourself waffles with whipped cream and syrup. Yum! - between 4 and 7 (approx) on Mon-Thurs they have a managers welcome. This is a VERY simple snack/meal, but it is provided with wine or beer... again complementary. After a day of Seaworld we decided to take them up on it. It was pasta with beef stew. It was passable and the kids liked it. The red wine was decent compared to most wine given away. - be aware that other than the above, there is no restaurant in the hotel. This is one nextdoor at the Hilton Garden Inn. - the pool is heated. I mean it.. it is HEATED. It must be about 88F. There is no shock going into it and my littlest son loved his first introduction to a pool. The Rooms - the rooms have a decent kitchen... 2 element stove, dishwasher, full fridge, garborator, microwave, sink, coffee maker, cutlery and dishes for 4, and they include paper towels and dishwasher detergent. Extra garbage bags are left too. - each room has a seperate bedroom with a door between the living room and the bedroom. Closing the door muffles quite well any noise from either TV in both rooms. - beds are very good, firm, but good. Even nicer is they have a choice of pillows on each bed: a down pillow, a puffy foam pillow, and a flatter foam pillow. - noise from other units is very minimal. Despite a reasonably full hotel there was little noise from other rooms. - there is no mini-bar so you'll have to buy your own. I like a beer in the evening, so I was very pleased to see the hotel sold beer by the lobby desk (those non-Quebec Canadians can appreciate this). What really shows the decency of the hotel is that while I've had pay $6 for a beer in ritzy hotel minibars, they sold a beer for $3, or pick 6 for $10. Very reasonable. - by the way the hotel also sells a variety of things consistant with serving people who may be staying there for a while. Any Negatives? - the hotel is faultless, although I must point out you are by International Drive. Having never stayed on this particular piece of road, I was surprised (and kinda revolted) by the crowds, traffic, and overall tackiness of the area. If your diet is only McD, BK, KFC, and IHOP, you'll be very happy. - beware of the pizza offers slipped under your hotel door. We ordered from one and they simply never showed despite 2 hours and repeated calls and promises that "the guy just left with your order". Go down to the lobby desk and ask for their recommended places and you'll be served much better. I paid a whopping $124 a night, which means I paid the same amount for 4 nights as I've had to pay for 1 in London, UK at a ostenatious but ultimately poor hotel. This Homewood Suites was great value at twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as Advertised - Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Homewood Suites based on the reviews provided on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The room was more than adequate for myself and my boyfriend, we could have easily fit 3 more people into the room. After spending time in European hotels, it was nice to have a sink outside of the shower room for a change! Not to repeat all of the things that have been mentioned in previous reviews, we noted a few additional nice items during our visit. Firstly, I had no problems with Wireless access upon booting up my Mac - an issue I sometimes have at various places. The connection was good and enabled me to upload some of my pictures while travelling instead of waiting until I got home. Secondly, Local phone calls were free, even to mobile phones. While this may hot be a big thing or perk for some, as someone who has to pay for every minute dialled, it was a nice surprise for me! Overall, the rooms were clean and well kept and we enjoyed use of the kitchen. The hotel is situated close to Universal and was within a 15 minute drive to the Disney Theme parks (we visited during a slower time I think so traffic may pick up during peak times). We didn't eat at any of the Manager's dinners, but can say that breakfast was well varied and offered something for most tastes. We enjoyed our stay and would definately use this hotel again for future Orland visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here while I checked on my property that is being built in the area. The room was immaculate and the suite amenities were a bonus. Free breakfast and happy hour snacks and drinks. The pool are area was very clean as well. I will definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “excellent for what it has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: da_jm
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Homewood Suites with our two young children during the height of Spring Break and I'd like to provide feedback on the stay. The hotel is not very easy to find late at night, as it is rather "tucked away" off International Drive. The location of International Drive is very, very touristy and gets very, very crowded on the weekends (especially during Spring Break!). While the hotel itself is rather secluded from the madness that is International Drive, actually maneuvering to the hotel can be tricky. Our room was absolutely fine - the standard "suite" with a separate set of doors to close the bedroom area from the sitting area / kitchen. We had 2 double beds which worked perfectly for us -- our kids in 1 bed, the parents in the other. The bathroom was standard size with the toilet and tub in one room and the sink outside of it. Kitchen area was perfect - fullsize refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, oven, microwave (and cooking utensils, plates, etc). The pool area was fine - plenty of clean towels available poolside and a small jaccuzi (6 person, max). I booked my stay online directly through the parent company (Hilton); be sure to keep this information with you as the rate that I had procured was not what they were going to charge me (quoting me more expensive rates) at check-in. Thankfully, I had the hotel confirmation printed out and with me when I checked in and I was able to get the rate I had confirmed. (pamela at the front desk was lovely) The buffet breakfast really exceeded our expectations. Each morning featured different foods, with staples of eggs, waffles, bagels, fruit, cereal and yogurts. As a previous reviewer mentioned, trays were available to bring food back to your room. Saved much $$ on this! We only did one night of the managers reception and it was fantastic. There is a monthly menu available in your room - we had a pasta night and each night will have either caesar or garden salad + pb&j for the kids if they don't like what is being served. (it's buffet style as well). I did laundry quite a few times - the laundry rooms do not have any products for sale - you'll need to bring your own or buy some detergent whilst in FL. Cost is $1 per load to wash and dry (each). 5th floor only had 1 washer, but I never had a problem. In summary, the Homewood Suites is a very nice hotel. However, if you are trying to decide between staying in a Disney hotel or even in the Lake Buena Vista area, this hotel is not for you. There is nothing "magical" about this hotel - it's a Homewood Suites in a very crowded, touristy part of Orlando. The hotel itself is lovely, but it's a distance to any Disney attraction. Of course, Universal is right there as is Wet n wild, if that's what you're interested in. If you're purely doing Disney, I'd choose something closer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for the Orlando Area”
Reviews.Author: VinylSlider
Reviews.Content: Our family (two adults, two kids ages 13 and 9) stayed at the Homewood Suites Orlando Universal from March 18-23, 2006. The hotel is tropical themed, and very nice. We used Hilton Honors points for the stay, but the rates I saw were very reasonable. The location is directly across from Universal Orlando. However, Interstate 4 is between the hotel and Universal, and total distance from the hotel to the Universal entrance is around ½ mile. They have a free shuttle you can sign up for, but as with most shuttles, that will put some limitations on your flexibility. We drove to Universal/Disney and paid the daily parking fee. We spent two days at Universal and three at Disney, which is 20-30 minute drive door-to-door depending on traffic. The morning breakfast buffet was standard for Homewood Suites, and a good money saver. There is a Sweet Tomatoes buffet-style restaurant about two blocks away that is very good for larger families or groups. The business center (two PCs), pool, and fitness center were all in great shape. Please see the many pictures attached.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay - my husband, myself and our 3 boys. Excellent place to stay, the room was very spacious with lounge area with very comfortable sofa bed. Small kitchen area was ideal for preparing snacks and drinks (very large fridge!). I was worried about there not being enough room for the 5 of us, but there was plenty - much better than a standard hotel room. Ideally located, within easy walking distance of Wet and Wild and International Drive with its numerous places to eat etc. We used the I-Trolly service - excellent service, would highly recommend. There is a complimentary shuttle service to Universal/IOA which was really useful and very reliable, but you need to book. Buffet breakfast and Managers Reception meals saved us lots of dollars on food. The kids loved the outside pool and sports court. There is also a business suite with free internet access, which was a great bonus. Also a gym and small games room. There is nothing negative I have to say about this place, everything was brilliant and we had a very relaxing stay. It is a very new, very, very clean hotel with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoy the Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: racefanof88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites for our trip to Orlando in Feburary. We loved it. The size was just right for my family of 5. The breakfast buffet was very good, we didn't care for the manager's reception food. We go to Disney for our vacation every year and we will be staying at Homewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alaskamom51
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, traveling with two teens and my husband this was just perfect. Liked having the suite with kitchen and two tv's. Breakfast was good each morning and had the light dinner at the hotel twice. It's the kind of food my kids like, tacos and pasta. That saved some money for us, and I enjoyed the wine and salad. Front desk clerk was very nice and helpful. Went to Universal park two days, that really is enough time, but enjoyed both parks. We drove to the parks, but they do have a shuttle from the hotel. The beds were great, even the pull out sofa. Only one problem was my kids said the pool was a little on the dirty side. Free internet in your room. Over all a great hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed here for 5 nights while visiting the various theme parks. Rooms were spacious and clean, beds and pillows were comfortable. Our favorite part though was the free buffets offered. Breakfast was delicious, scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, cereals, hot waffles, pancakes, potatoes, yogurt, doughnuts, juices, etc. I didn't see any details posted on the "evening reception" before we went, so now I thought I'd post our experience. Each night has a theme, such as Mexican, Italian, or Kid's Nite. On kid's night for example, we had delicious breaded chicken breast tenderloins, a small salad bar, canned corn, tater tots, sodas, beer, and wine. We saved a TON of money feeding everyone at the hotel for free for breakfast and dinner and taking some picnic type food in our backpacks for lunch. We didn't have to eat out from the time we arrived until we left Friday night. We would DEFINITELY stay again. What a moneysaver!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: granmaz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday, spending our second week at the Homewood Suites Universal. It really is a great place to stay and we were very impressed with everything. The breakfast was excellent and the evening reception saved us from going out for an evening meal on three evenings - very good. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the suites and commom areas clean and well kept. The pool was great, though perhaps a little small for when it is hot and busy. We are hoping to stay again later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Kimserena
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I've never written a review before, but have used this site for many vacations. However, I truly felt that it was worth it to write this time being that we traveled w/our 3 children (10, 6, & 8 months) to Universal Studios and felt that this hotel was well worth the stay. The hotel is brand new (must have been w/in the last 12 months) and everything was very clean, new, and appealing. The rooms were large enough for all 5 of us to stay w/out being on top of one another for about $125 per night. (We book some 3-night special) The free breakfast buffet was a wonderful bonus, time saver, and money saver as well. We never had the opportunity to enjoy the Manager's Special in the afternoons b/c we were at Universal for the entire day, (I would also recommend the "All you can eat" deal that the park offers for $20 per adult - You definately get your moneys worth!), but I'm sure the Manager's special was up to par. The hotel does not have all the "bells & whistles" that some of the other on-site hotels have, but Homewood has added some nice touches such as the basketball court, small game room and gym in addition to the pool and hot tub. The staff was very friendly and the location is directly outside the entrance to the park, but not on the main road. We will definately return to this hotel for our next trip to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “excellant service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently had a two week stay here. Our welcome was very friendly. Our only problem came after our first night in which we had a room on the second floor above the pool pump house, next to the lift and the drinks and ice making machine, ok if your a heavy sleeper but a little to noisy for us. So the next morning I asked if we could have a quieter room, which proved no problem at all and were moved to a nice room overlooking the pool. The rooms are a good size and kept very clean by the efficient housekeeping staff. Breakfast is good but gets busy from 8.30 onwards. The hotel is just a five minute walk from I-drive and the very useful I-ride trolley buses which patrol its entire lengh. One tip, we found the games room quite useful to keep the kids happy for 15 minutes if we wanted to read some literature or sort anything out with reception. All in all a very nice stay at a clean and friendly hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just visited Homewood Universal for a 2 week holiday and would definately return. The rooms are spacious and acceptably clean with clean towels and toiletries daily. The hotel is well located just off International Drive in a quiet side road - the location and hotel itself felt very safe and secure. The free breakfast was excellent, the manager's free buffet held 4 nights a week including free lager and wine was a very nice touch (albeit no choice of meal). The staff were either acceptable or extremely helpful (in particular the breakfast staff who were not in the least perturbed at clearing up a glass of spilt orange juice by our 7 year old son). The washing machine and dryer on 2 floors were always available when we wanted and were extremely cheap to use. Overall we had a fantastic time, are looking forward to returning and would class it an excellent holiday for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Amenities, Perfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Rednordic
Reviews.Content: My family and I, husband and two small sons, stayed here the first weekend of January. The rate was one of the best I could find for the area and for this type of suite. It had a kitchen, living area, and seperate bedroom with two queen beds. The living area and bedroom both had televisons. The lobby is very welcoming as is the staff. In the morning they offer a free breakfast with, what I thought to have, plenty of options; from eggs, waffles, sausage to english muffins, fruit, bagels and yogurt. We didn't use the pool area, too cool, but it also looked very nice. It's right off of International Drive, so close to many things, but tucked back where you don't have to see or hear all of the traffic. It was really a wonderful hotel and we would love to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Exellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in the Brazil, Rio De Janeiro and very loved Orlando. This hotel very represents well the joviality, the modernity and the spirit of party of Orlando. New, comfortable, very clean and the gentile employees are considerate. We wait that it continues thus, because we will come back with certainty. Congratulations to the Hilton Hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fantastic time in orlando,we spent christmas and new year there, it was magical!
